original: des na ji ltar du ba gzhan du ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: des na ji ltar du ba gzhan du ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du //
translated: Therefore, just as smoke is smoke,

original: du ba nyid me'i 'bras bu nyid yin pas me'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: du ba nyid me'i 'bras bu nyid yin pas me'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: smoke is the effect of fire, because it is the effect of fire.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what follows from that?

original: bshad pa du ba de gzhan las kyang 'byung na ste gzhan gyi yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed na /
analyzed: bshad pa du ba de gzhan las kyang 'byung na ste gzhan gyi yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed na /
translated: It is said that if smoke arises from something else, and if it follows after and turns away from something else,

original: de me'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de me'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the nature of fire.

original: de dngos po gzhan gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag ni dngos po gzhan kho na yin gyi me ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dngos po gzhan gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag ni dngos po gzhan kho na yin gyi me ni ma yin no //
translated: The following and turning away that become the nature of another thing are just another thing, but not fire.

original: des na ji ltar dngos po de me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ji ltar dngos po de me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as that thing is not the nature of fire,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag kyang ngo //
translated: so too are the following and turning away.

original: de bas na du ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na du ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, the production of smoke is not its nature.

original: des na ji ltar te me me ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ji ltar te me me ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as fire would not become non-fire,

original: du bskyed par byed par yang mi 'gyur bas lan 'ga' yang skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du bskyed par byed par yang mi 'gyur bas lan 'ga' yang skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be a producer, and so it would never produce smoke.

original: 'di ni lan cig kyang me ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni lan cig kyang me ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be non-fire even once.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag me'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas na me yang du ba skyed par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag me'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas na me yang du ba skyed par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that since the presence and absence of smoke is the nature of fire, then fire is only the producer of smoke,

original: de'i tshe ni gzhan las 'byung ba gang yin ba de du ba nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gzhan las 'byung ba gang yin ba de du ba nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then that which arises from another would not be smoke.

original: yang na gzhan las 'byung ba de du ba ma yin te du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhan las 'byung ba de du ba ma yin te du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, that which arises from another is not smoke, because it arises from what is not the nature of a smoke-producer.

original: du ba'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rten du gyur pa du ba skyed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni me nyid kho na yin pas du ba ni du ba skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: du ba'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rten du gyur pa du ba skyed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni me nyid kho na yin pas du ba ni du ba skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since that which is the basis of the presence and absence of smoke, which is called the producer of smoke, is fire itself, smoke does not arise from what is other than the nature of a smoke-producer.

original: ci ste yang du ba skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ste yang du ba skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos bzhin du /
translated: But if the nature that generates smoke exists, like the qualities of existence and so on,

original: de dag gzhan @147b la yang yod pa yin pa des na de las kyang du ba 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gzhan @147b la yang yod pa yin pa des na de las kyang du ba 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then smoke would also arise from those other things.

original: bshad pa / de'i rang bzhin yin na ni ste du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / de'i rang bzhin yin na ni ste du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If it has that nature,

original: de nyid me yin pas du ba me la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de nyid me yin pas du ba me la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: then it is just fire, and therefore there is no error that smoke arises from fire.

original: me yod na du ba yod pa'i phyir me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ji ltar du ba skyed par byed pa yin pa 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: me yod na du ba yod pa'i phyir me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ji ltar du ba skyed par byed pa yin pa 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: Since smoke exists when fire exists, it has been demonstrated that the intrinsic reality of fire is what generates smoke.

original: des na gzhan yang du ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni me'i rnam pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan yang du ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni me'i rnam pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it is said that “it also generates other smoke,” then it would be said that it has the aspect of fire.

original: de bas na skyed par byed pa gzhan gang yin pa de nyid 'bar zhing mdangs gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi me nyid yin pa'i phyir me ma yin pa la du ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na skyed par byed pa gzhan gang yin pa de nyid 'bar zhing mdangs gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi me nyid yin pa'i phyir me ma yin pa la du ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since that which is the producer is fire itself, which has the aspect of blazing and shining, smoke does not occur in what is not fire.

original: gal te brgya byin spyi bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gal te brgya byin spyi bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid sdud par byed do //
translated: If you say that the head of Indra, etc., is the collector, etc.,

original: brgya byin zhes bya ba dbang po'i mchod sdong gi spyi bo gal te me'i rang bzhin te gang yod na du ba 'byung ba nyid las de 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: brgya byin zhes bya ba dbang po'i mchod sdong gi spyi bo gal te me'i rang bzhin te gang yod na du ba 'byung ba nyid las de 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If the head of Indra, the top of the sacrificial post of Indra, is the nature of fire, and smoke occurs only when it exists, then it is fire.

original: de'i phyir de nyid me yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid me yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is fire.

original: 'on te me'i rang bzhin min no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te me'i rang bzhin min no zhe na /
translated: But if it is not the nature of fire,

original: 'o na ni de yod na du ba skye ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de yod na du ba skye ba ma yin pas na /
translated: then smoke does not arise when it exists.

original: ji ltar de las du ba 'byung /
analyzed: ji ltar de las du ba 'byung /
translated: How can smoke arise from it?

original: 'di ga las she na 'di ltar du ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin me du ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa rjes su byed pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni me nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na 'di ltar du ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin me du ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa rjes su byed pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni me nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How is this known? It is known because the nature of the cause of smoke, which is the object that follows after smoke and conforms with its absence, is fire.

original: de yang me'i rnam pa zhes bya ba de'i nus pa nyid kyis dngos po gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang me'i rnam pa zhes bya ba de'i nus pa nyid kyis dngos po gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the so-called form of fire is a particular thing due to its own power.

original: gal te ji ltar nus pa me'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir me ma yin pa la yang nus pa de yod na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar nus pa me'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir me ma yin pa la yang nus pa de yod na /
translated: If, just as the power is the intrinsic nature of fire, that power exists in what is not fire,

original: de yang me nyid yin par brjod pa de bzhin du skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yang me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de yang me nyid yin par brjod pa de bzhin du skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yang me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: then just as you say that it is fire, so also momentariness, etc. are the intrinsic nature of fire.

original: des na brgya byin gyi co do skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yang mer 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na brgya byin gyi co do skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yang mer 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because Indra’s diadem is momentary, it would be fire.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ni me'i rnam pa'i khyad par bye brag tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ni me'i rnam pa'i khyad par bye brag tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because momentariness, etc. are particular features of the form of fire.

original: de ni 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir de las skad cig mar bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir de las skad cig mar bstan to //
translated: Because it is destroyed, it is taught to be momentary.

original: de las gzhan yang 'jig par 'gyur ba yin na de yang skad cig mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang 'jig par 'gyur ba yin na de yang skad cig mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were destroyed by something else, it would be momentary.

original: des na skad cig ma'i phyir ni dbang po'i co do mer 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma'i phyir ni dbang po'i co do mer 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of momentariness, the sense faculties do not become old.

original: rgyu 'di nyid ni 'di'i de ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid las ma gtogs par khyad par bye brag tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid ni 'di'i de ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid las ma gtogs par khyad par bye brag tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: This very cause is the reason why it is not a different nature from that very nature of the object’s being understood in that way.

original: ji ltar de yod na du ba yod pa'i phyir de rgyu nyid yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar de yod na du ba yod pa'i phyir de rgyu nyid yin la /
translated: When it exists, smoke exists, and therefore it is the cause of smoke.

original: @148a * // de yod pa yang rang bzhin de nyid yin pa ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: @148a * // de yod pa yang rang bzhin de nyid yin pa ni bstan zin to //
translated: And the existence of that is its very nature. This has been explained.

original: 'o na ji ltar du ba mi skyed pa'i me me nyid dam /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar du ba mi skyed pa'i me me nyid dam /
translated: Well then, how could fire not produce smoke?

original: du bas bskyed pa'i du ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: du bas bskyed pa'i du ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or how could smoke be produced by smoke?

original: nyes pa 'di med de me dang du ba'i khyad par de ltar khas blangs kyi /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di med de me dang du ba'i khyad par de ltar khas blangs kyi /
translated: This fault does not exist because we accept the difference between fire and smoke in that way.

original: me tsam ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tsam ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not just fire.

original: me ma yin ba rgyu yin pa 'gog gi / me thams cad rgyur 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me ma yin ba rgyu yin pa 'gog gi / me thams cad rgyur 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We refute that nonfire is the cause, but we do not assert that all fire is the cause.

original: yang na ma yin te me du ba skyed par rung ba nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir skye ba nas brtsams te phan gdags bya 'dogs byed nyid las mi 'da'o zhes gzhan du bstan zin to //
analyzed: yang na ma yin te me du ba skyed par rung ba nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir skye ba nas brtsams te phan gdags bya 'dogs byed nyid las mi 'da'o zhes gzhan du bstan zin to //
translated: Or, it is not so, because it is not devoid of the capacity to produce fire and smoke. Beginning from the time of its production, it does not go beyond being that which is benefited and that which benefits. This has been explained elsewhere.

original: gal te du ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i me yang yod pas na /
analyzed: gal te du ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i me yang yod pas na /
translated: But since there is fire that does not produce smoke,

original: me tsam nyid du ba skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: me tsam nyid du ba skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that fire alone does not produce smoke?

original: des na 'di ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin khyad par gyi bye brag yin no zhes pa 'di nyid du 'gyur bas na me nyid dang bral du zin kyang khyad par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: des na 'di ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin khyad par gyi bye brag yin no zhes pa 'di nyid du 'gyur bas na me nyid dang bral du zin kyang khyad par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Therefore, this is a particular case like momentariness, etc. Thus, even if it is devoid of fire, there is a change due to a particular feature,

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan gyis du ba rgyu me la mi 'khrul bar brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan gyis du ba rgyu me la mi 'khrul bar brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: or else, it should be stated that smoke is not mistaken regarding fire as its cause in another way.

original: smras pa me nyid khyad par dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i khyad par khyad par yang yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: smras pa me nyid khyad par dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i khyad par khyad par yang yod pa kho na'o //
translated: It is said that even if fire itself has a particular feature, there is a particular feature that becomes its own nature.

original: de lta ma yin na ni me nyid tha mi dad par khyad par tha dad pa'i phyir spyi khas blangs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni me nyid tha mi dad par khyad par tha dad pa'i phyir spyi khas blangs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then since fire itself would be different from itself, it would be a universal.

original: des na ji ltar me nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du du ba skyed par byed pa dang / du ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag gis kyang yin pas skyon 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na ji ltar me nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du du ba skyed par byed pa dang / du ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag gis kyang yin pas skyon 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, just as fire itself is different, so it is also different from that which produces smoke and that which does not produce smoke. Thus there is no fault.

original: gang gi tshe brgya byin gyi spyi bo me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brgya byin gyi spyi bo me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the head of Śakra is not the nature of fire,

original: du ba du ba'i rgyu ma yin pa brgya byin gyi spyi bo las 'byung na /
analyzed: du ba du ba'i rgyu ma yin pa brgya byin gyi spyi bo las 'byung na /
translated: then smoke arises from the head of Śakra, which is not the cause of smoke.

original: de ni rgyu mer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rgyu mer 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be the cause of fire.

original: gal te mi 'dra ba las mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / du ba skyed par byed pa me'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir du ba me ma yin pa las mi 'byung bas na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dra ba las mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / du ba skyed par byed pa me'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir du ba me ma yin pa las mi 'byung bas na /
translated: If it is said that smoke does not arise from that which is not fire because it does not arise from that which is dissimilar, because a different cause produces a different effect, and because the form of that which produces smoke is fire,

original: me las mi 'khrul bar brjod na /
analyzed: me las mi 'khrul bar brjod na /
translated: then it is said that smoke is not mistaken regarding fire.

original: ji ltar lhan cig byed pa mi 'dra ba tha dad pa dang / me ma yin pa las du ba skye /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig byed pa mi 'dra ba tha dad pa dang / me ma yin pa las du ba skye /
translated: How is it that smoke arises from a different, heterogeneous set of conditions, and not from fire?

original: de nyid smras pa ni 'o na da ni lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid smras pa ni 'o na da ni lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, “Well then, now it is from a different set of heterogeneous conditions.”

original: de dag ni tha dad pa nyid kyis mi 'dra ba dang / me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tha dad pa nyid kyis mi 'dra ba dang / me ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: They are different, and therefore heterogeneous, and not of the nature of fire.

original: des ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras @148b bu skye bar sgrub pa na 'di lhan cig byed pa dag las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras @148b bu skye bar sgrub pa na 'di lhan cig byed pa dag las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When he establishes the arising of the effect in the manner explained, it does not arise from a set of heterogeneous conditions.

original: ci 'dra ba zhe na dper na zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhe na dper na zhes smos so //
translated: What is it like? He says, “For example.”

original: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag las rnam par shes pa gcig skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag las rnam par shes pa gcig skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: One consciousness arises from eye, form, light, and mental activity.

original: de la ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo'i rigs pa'am rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur pa gang yin pa 'dra ba med pa lhan cig kyang med do //
analyzed: de la ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo'i rigs pa'am rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur pa gang yin pa 'dra ba med pa lhan cig kyang med do //
translated: There is no similarity, nor is there co-existence, of a different effect due to a different cause, like the reasoning of Indra’s crown jewel.

original: ci'i phyir dkyus ma nyid bzhag ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dkyus ma nyid bzhag ste /
translated: Why is it established as just that?

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dper bkod ce na /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dper bkod ce na /
translated: The eye and visible form, etc. are cited as examples.

original: de la lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi byed pa tha dad par bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi byed pa tha dad par bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is possible to show that the functions of the cooperating causes are distinct.

original: me dang bud shing la sogs pa la ni 'di brtag bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: me dang bud shing la sogs pa la ni 'di brtag bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: But in the case of fire and fuel, etc., this is to be investigated.

original: bstan par bya ba ni mi nus so //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ni mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to show that.

original: gcig tu skyed pa'am ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs so //
analyzed: gcig tu skyed pa'am ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs so //
translated: The reply is given by the words “one produces, etc.”

original: gcig pus skyed ba srid pa na mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba 'gog pa'am /
analyzed: gcig pus skyed ba srid pa na mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba 'gog pa'am /
translated: When it is possible that one produces, it is the arising of something similar from something dissimilar that is refuted,

original: rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: and it does not follow that the effect is not distinct from the distinct causes.

original: don gyi rang bzhin nyid rgyu'i nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de'i rang gi ngo bo brjod pa gang yin pa de yang gang gis na ji srid brgya byin gyi spyi bo du ba skyed na mer 'gyur bar brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin nyid rgyu'i nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de'i rang gi ngo bo brjod pa gang yin pa de yang gang gis na ji srid brgya byin gyi spyi bo du ba skyed na mer 'gyur bar brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Because the nature of the object itself is the potentiality of the cause. Whatever is said to be its intrinsic reality, that is also said to be the cause of that.

original: bud shing yang 'gyur la mig la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba brjod par 'gyur ba gcig la ltos nas brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bud shing yang 'gyur la mig la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba brjod par 'gyur ba gcig la ltos nas brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is not said that one thing is said to be dependent on another.

original: de'i rang bzhin gcig pus skyed par byed pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gcig pus skyed par byed pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest thing that is produced by its own nature alone.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pas skyed par byed pa ni de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pas skyed par byed pa ni de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes smos so //
translated: However, it is said that the collection produces it, and that is its nature.

original: des na mi 'dra ba dang 'dra ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ni tshogs pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'dra ba dang 'dra ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ni tshogs pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this distinction of the dissimilar and similar is dependent on the collection.

original: de lta bu'i tshogs pa la skye ba'i dngos po de ni de lta bu nyid las skye ba'i don mi 'dra ba 'byung na ni zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshogs pa la skye ba'i dngos po de ni de lta bu nyid las skye ba'i don mi 'dra ba 'byung na ni zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The thing that is produced from such a collection is said to be produced from just that.

original: 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: 'di ltar mi 'dra ba las skye na ni rgyu'i nus pa nyams par bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi 'dra ba las skye na ni rgyu'i nus pa nyams par bshad de /
translated: If it were produced from the dissimilar, the potency of the cause would be impaired,

original: de bzhin du yang yod par 'gyur na de las skye ba'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang yod par 'gyur na de las skye ba'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it would exist in that way, but the meaning of production from that would not be established.

original: lhan cig byed pa dag ni tha dad kyang de 'bras bu yod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa mi ldog pa des na skye ba'i don dang mi 'bral lo //🔽'dis ni rgyu tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid kyis rigs pa gang yin pa de yang 'di nyid la yin @149a * //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dag ni tha dad kyang de 'bras bu yod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa mi ldog pa des na skye ba'i don dang mi 'bral lo // 'dis ni rgyu tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid kyis rigs pa gang yin pa de yang 'di nyid la yin @149a * //
translated: The co-operating causes are different, but the nature of the effect is not different, and so the meaning of production is not lost.

original: par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: par nges par bya'o //
translated: This shows that whatever is reasonable in the case of a different cause producing a different effect should be understood to apply here.

original: de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'i don skye ba'i rgyu ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'i don skye ba'i rgyu ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning of the exclusion of a nature that is not that is the cause of production, because it is just that.

original: re re dang bral na gzhan las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re dang bral na gzhan las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were absent in each case, it would not arise from another.

original: tshogs pa de de'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa de de'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: That collection is its nature,

original: des na mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams ji snyed pa dang / rnam pa ji lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa de shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa yin pa des na /
analyzed: des na mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams ji snyed pa dang / rnam pa ji lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa de shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa yin pa des na /
translated: and so the eye, form, light, and attention, to the extent that they are, and in whatever way they are, the nature that produces the cognition, by that they have the capacity to produce the cognition.

original: gal te brgya byin spyi bo me'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan rnam pa de lta bu ma yin ba las de skye na de'i rang bzhin du thal bar brjod pa de bzhin du me dang bud shing dag kyang du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i
analyzed: gal te brgya byin spyi bo me'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan rnam pa de lta bu ma yin ba las de skye na de'i rang bzhin du thal bar brjod pa de bzhin du me dang bud shing dag kyang du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i
translated: If it is argued that the head of Śakra is not like that, and that smoke arises from something else, then just as it is said that the nature of smoke is to arise from fire and fuel,

original: phyir me nyid dam bud shing nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir me nyid dam bud shing nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: fire and fuel would not be fire and fuel because they have the nature of producing smoke.

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the head of Śakra would have the nature of both.

original: des las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa 'di ni tshogs pa la ltos pa nyid yin te 'di ltar de kho na rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa 'di ni tshogs pa la ltos pa nyid yin te 'di ltar de kho na rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: This relation characterized by the arising of an effect depends on the collection, and thus it is inferred from that alone.

original: des ni 'di thams cad ni de la bsam pa nyid yin par rigs so //
analyzed: des ni 'di thams cad ni de la bsam pa nyid yin par rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable that all of this is merely thought in that regard.

original: gal te yang tshogs pa nyid yod na 'bras bu bskyed par mthong la re res mi nus na yang 'ga' yang nus par mi 'thad pa re res nus kyang 'ga' yang don med pa ma yin te thams cad nye bar gnas nas 'bras bu mthong bas ngo bo
analyzed: gal te yang tshogs pa nyid yod na 'bras bu bskyed par mthong la re res mi nus na yang 'ga' yang nus par mi 'thad pa re res nus kyang 'ga' yang don med pa ma yin te thams cad nye bar gnas nas 'bras bu mthong bas ngo bo
translated: If the assembly itself is seen to produce the effect, and if each member of the assembly is not able to produce the effect, then it is not tenable that any of them is able to produce the effect.🔽But even if each member of the assembly is able to produce the effect, it is not the case that any of them is purposeless, because the effect is seen to arise when all of them are present.

original: nyid kyis thams cad nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir dang gcig byed pa na gzhan gyi bya ba mi 'gal ba'i phyir tshogs pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin bas rgyu tha dad pa las tha mi dad par 'gyur bar thal ba yang spangs pa de lta na yang
analyzed: nyid kyis thams cad nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir dang gcig byed pa na gzhan gyi bya ba mi 'gal ba'i phyir tshogs pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin bas rgyu tha dad pa las tha mi dad par 'gyur bar thal ba yang spangs pa de lta na yang
translated: Since all of them are applied by their very nature and since there is no contradiction in one of them performing the action of another, the assembly itself is the producer of the effect. Therefore the absurd consequence that the effect would not be different from the different causes is avoided.

original: tshogs pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bstan par smras pa tshogs pa'i yan lag rnams kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni tshogs de nyid yul gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de dag gi rten yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bstan par smras pa tshogs pa'i yan lag rnams kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni tshogs de nyid yul gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de dag gi rten yin no //
translated: because it is to be shown that the collection itself is the producer, and because it is said that the collection is taught in order to show the special application of the members of the collection.🔽The beginning of the treatise is: “That collection itself is the basis of those entities that are the effects, such as the aspect of the object, etc.”

original: de ltar yang yid la byed pa las ni dbang po'i byed pa gsal ba'i rang bzhin yul las ni rnam pa dang 'brel pa ste gang gi phyir 'di yul gsal ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang yid la byed pa las ni dbang po'i byed pa gsal ba'i rang bzhin yul las ni rnam pa dang 'brel pa ste gang gi phyir 'di yul gsal ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the activity of the sense faculty is of the nature of manifestation, and the object is related to the aspect, because this is the manifestation of the object, etc.

original: 'di ji lta ba de ltar ni gzhan du bsgrubs zin pas 'dir mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ji lta ba de ltar ni gzhan du bsgrubs zin pas 'dir mi brjod do //
translated: This is established elsewhere in the same way, so it is not mentioned here.

original: lhan cig byed pa dag gi nye bar sbyor ba'i rnam par @149b dbye ba bstan par ma rtogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de lta bu nyid du yod do zhes pas brtag par rigs pa yin no //🔽gal te tshogs ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i rgyu rnams 'bras bu'i khyad bar sgrub par byed pa la phyogs par 'dod na 'o na de dag so sor yang de lta bu'i 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dag gi nye bar sbyor ba'i rnam par @149b dbye ba bstan par ma rtogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de lta bu nyid du yod do zhes pas brtag par rigs pa yin no // gal te tshogs ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i rgyu rnams 'bras bu'i khyad bar sgrub par byed pa la phyogs par 'dod na 'o na de dag so sor yang de lta bu'i 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But those who do not understand the presentation of the differentiation of the conjunction of the cooperating causes should investigate whether they exist in just that way.🔽If you assert that the causes that are included in the collection are inclined to establish the effect’s specific attributes, then those causes would individually generate that effect.

original: bshad pa gang gi phyir gcig pu skyed par byed pa'am zhes bya bas tshogs pa nyid rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten du 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rnam grangs med par skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa gang gi phyir gcig pu skyed par byed pa'am zhes bya bas tshogs pa nyid rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten du 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rnam grangs med par skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Since it is asserted that the collection itself is the basis for the existence of its own nature, the cooperating causes generate the effect without distinction.

original: 'dir rigs smos pa nye bar mtshon pa rim gyis byed na gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i tha dad pa nyid 'gog pa yin te lhan cig pa rnams so sor skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir rigs smos pa nye bar mtshon pa rim gyis byed na gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i tha dad pa nyid 'gog pa yin te lhan cig pa rnams so sor skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the mention of type is taken as an illustration, then the difference that must be present is refuted, because it is not the case that coexistent things are not produced separately.

original: phan tshun phan 'dogs pa'i phyir tshogs par 'gyur pa de dag 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni 'bras bu gcig dmigs pa nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun phan 'dogs pa'i phyir tshogs par 'gyur pa de dag 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni 'bras bu gcig dmigs pa nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The fact that they have the nature of producing a single effect is understood from the observation of a single effect, because they become a collection due to their mutual benefit.

original: de ltar rigs pas rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba bsal te /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba bsal te /
translated: Thus, through reasoning, arising from a different type is refuted.

original: de ni gang du de ltar mthong ba yod pa der ci gang 'di lta bu'i dngos po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gnod pa'i rtsa ba las don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir rtogs pas 'khrul pa yin nam /
analyzed: de ni gang du de ltar mthong ba yod pa der ci gang 'di lta bu'i dngos po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gnod pa'i rtsa ba las don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir rtogs pas 'khrul pa yin nam /
translated: If it is seen that way in some cases, then why is it that in other cases, such as the arising of a sprout from a seed, it is not understood to be mistaken, because it is a different object from the root of harm that follows such a thing?

original: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes dogs pa la de ston pa ni gang yang cung zad rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung bar mthong ba de la yang rang gi sa bon las rab tu 'byung ba can gyi don la ltos te /🔽rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes dogs pa la de ston pa ni gang yang cung zad rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung bar mthong ba de la yang rang gi sa bon las rab tu 'byung ba can gyi don la ltos te / rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: In that case, too, it is only the nature of the effect that is different, in dependence on the seed from which it arises.

original: ji ltar yod ce na bshad pa rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ji ltar yod ce na bshad pa rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: How is it that it exists? It is said that the nature of the cause is different.

original: rgyu tha dad pas bskyed pa'i dngos po ni tha dad pa las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pas bskyed pa'i dngos po ni tha dad pa las mi 'da'o //
translated: An entity that is produced by a different cause does not transcend difference.

original: rigs mi mthun pa gang las de gang zhig 'byung bar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa gang las de gang zhig 'byung bar mthong zhe na /
translated: From what dissimilar type is it seen to arise?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa lci ba la sogs pa las autpala la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa lci ba la sogs pa las autpala la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show that, it is said that a lotus, etc. arises from mud, etc.

original: autpala las kyang autpala la 'byung la autpala dang rigs mi mthun ba lci ba las kyang 'byung bar mthong /
analyzed: autpala las kyang autpala la 'byung la autpala dang rigs mi mthun ba lci ba las kyang 'byung bar mthong /
translated: A lotus is seen to arise from a lotus, and a lotus is seen to arise from mud, which is dissimilar to a lotus.

original: gal te autpala dang rigs mi mthun pa lci ba las 'byung ba'i autpala la autpala las skyes pa'i autpala las tha dad pa yin na 'o na de de autpala nyid ma yin pa des na tha dad pa'i phyir ji lta na de ltar dmigs she na 'di la🔽bshad pa / de skad du brjod @150a * //
analyzed: gal te autpala dang rigs mi mthun pa lci ba las 'byung ba'i autpala la autpala las skyes pa'i autpala las tha dad pa yin na 'o na de de autpala nyid ma yin pa des na tha dad pa'i phyir ji lta na de ltar dmigs she na 'di la bshad pa / de skad du brjod @150a * //
translated: If the lotus that arises from heavy earth, which is not of the same kind as the lotus, is different from the lotus that arises from a lotus, then it is not a lotus. Therefore, because it is different, how is it that it is perceived in that way?🔽To this, we reply:

original: kyang zhes bya ba ste /🔽autpala'i rnam pa yin yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ste / autpala'i rnam pa yin yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Although it is said thus,🔽it is a lotus.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gal te yang de la autpala'i rnam pa yod pa de lta na yang lci ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can de ni gang gi bye brag gis byas pa'i tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te yang de la autpala'i rnam pa yod pa de lta na yang lci ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can de ni gang gi bye brag gis byas pa'i tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Even though it has the aspect of a lotus, it is only different by the particular that is the sign of heavy earth, and so on.

original: des na rang bzhin de lci ba'i 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin de lci ba'i 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, that nature is the effect of heaviness.

original: gang gis brgya byin gyi spyi bo'i tshul du lci ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yang autpalar thal bar 'gyur ba autpala tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis brgya byin gyi spyi bo'i tshul du lci ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yang autpalar thal bar 'gyur ba autpala tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not just the lotus that is the cause of heaviness, and so on, as if it were the head of Indra.

original: dper na bum pa'i rnam pa'i dngos po nyid rdza mkhan las 'byung ba'i phyir de snam bu'i bdag nyid tha ga pa las 'byung ba ni rgyu tha dad par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i rnam pa'i dngos po nyid rdza mkhan las 'byung ba'i phyir de snam bu'i bdag nyid tha ga pa las 'byung ba ni rgyu tha dad par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the entity of the form of a pot comes from a potter, so it is not a different cause from the form of a cloth, which comes from a weaver.

original: yul dang dus kyi dbye bas rang gi mtshan nyid dam skad cig gis tha dad gang yin pa de ni tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de de tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus kyi dbye bas rang gi mtshan nyid dam skad cig gis tha dad gang yin pa de ni tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de de tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever is different by way of a difference of object or time or by way of a difference of moment is not different, because the proof of its difference is just the difference of its nature.

original: de yang ga la te mngon sum gyis ma grub kyang rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyis rtogs pas na spang bar 'os pa'am tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ga la te mngon sum gyis ma grub kyang rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyis rtogs pas na spang bar 'os pa'am tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And how is that? Although not established by direct perception, it is understood by way of a difference of cause, so it is not proper to reject it or to make it different.

original: autpala nyid rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba la dper brjod pa ni dper na /
analyzed: autpala nyid rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba la dper brjod pa ni dper na /
translated: The example of a lotus being born from a dissimilar type is like

original: chu shing sa bon dang sngon bu las skye ba rigs mi mthun pa yin bar mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chu shing sa bon dang sngon bu las skye ba rigs mi mthun pa yin bar mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: the observation that a banana plant is born from a seed and a blue lotus is born from mud.

original: des na der yang de bzhin du rigs mi mthun pa yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na der yang de bzhin du rigs mi mthun pa yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that even there, they are of different types.

original: autpala la sogs pa'i khyad par 'di rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbye ba de lta byu ni 'jig rten na gsal ba kho nar rnam par byed do //
analyzed: autpala la sogs pa'i khyad par 'di rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbye ba de lta byu ni 'jig rten na gsal ba kho nar rnam par byed do //
translated: The difference of the lotus, etc. is not to be inferred, but rather, that kind of difference is clearly distinguished in the world.

original: 'o na ji ltar rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How then can it be said that the difference is due to the difference in the nature of the cause?

original: 'di sgrub byed nyid du bstan pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di sgrub byed nyid du bstan pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not taught as a proof,

original: 'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu nyid du'o //
translated: but rather, as the cause of such a difference.

original: khyad par mi 'dra ba de ni rgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshigs go //
analyzed: khyad par mi 'dra ba de ni rgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshigs go //
translated: That difference is not similar, because it arises from a different cause.

original: gang gi phyir ba lang gi lci ba'i autpala sogs pa rnams rnam pa yang tha dad pa de'i phyir de dag ni 'jig rten yang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang gi lci ba'i autpala sogs pa rnams rnam pa yang tha dad pa de'i phyir de dag ni 'jig rten yang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The difference in the form of the lotus, etc. made from cow dung is also different, therefore, that is understood in the world.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad ma rtogs par rgyu tha dad par dmigs par 'khrul pa nor ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad ma rtogs par rgyu tha dad par dmigs par 'khrul pa nor ba'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, since the error of observing a difference in the cause is due to the non-apprehension of all the differences in the effect,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par nges pa bye brag tu mthong bar rtogs pa shin tu rnam par phye pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par nges pa bye brag tu mthong bar rtogs pa shin tu rnam par phye pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: the effect of the very clear apprehension of the definite difference as it has been explained is the non-error with respect to the cause.

original: gal te yang rnam @150b par phye ba med kyang dngos su na 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa yin ba de lta na yang rtags la ltos pa nyid kyis de skad brjod do //
analyzed: gal te yang rnam @150b par phye ba med kyang dngos su na 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa yin ba de lta na yang rtags la ltos pa nyid kyis de skad brjod do //
translated: And even if the effect is non-erroneous in reality, even without the differentiation, still it is said to be so by virtue of its dependence on the reason.

original: da ni ji skad bshad pa'i don bsdus nas ston to /
analyzed: da ni ji skad bshad pa'i don bsdus nas ston to /
translated: Now, the meaning of what has been explained is summarized and presented.

original: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa las //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa las //
translated: From the positive and negative concomitances,

original: gang zhig rang bzhin gang rjes 'jug / byed mthong de ni de yi rgyu //
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin gang rjes 'jug / byed mthong de ni de yi rgyu //
translated: That which is seen to follow a certain nature is the cause of that.

original: de phyir mi mthun las mi 'byung //
analyzed: de phyir mi mthun las mi 'byung //
translated: Therefore, it does not arise from a dissimilar cause.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i yan lag gi don bar mchod pa yang sdud la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i yan lag gi don bar mchod pa yang sdud la /
translated: Here, the meaning of the intermediate part of the chapter is summarized.

original: 'di gang gi yan lag yin pa rab tu byed pa'i don gtso bor gyur pa de yang sdud do //
analyzed: 'di gang gi yan lag yin pa rab tu byed pa'i don gtso bor gyur pa de yang sdud do //
translated: The root text also includes the primary subject matter of the treatise, which is the limbs of the treatise.

original: de la dang po bshad pa ni de ni de'i rgyu yin te skyed par byed pa yin na //🔽gang gi gang zhe na bshad pa gang zhig rang bzhin gang rjes su 'jug byed de gang gis rang bzhin gang rjes su 'jug par byed cing gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur bar byed do //🔽de ni bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis na rang ngam gzhan las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ji ltar rjes su 'jug bar byed pa yin zhe na /🔽de las skye bar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po bshad pa ni de ni de'i rgyu yin te skyed par byed pa yin na // gang gi gang zhe na bshad pa gang zhig rang bzhin gang rjes su 'jug byed de gang gis rang bzhin gang rjes su 'jug par byed cing gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur bar byed do // de ni bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis na rang ngam gzhan las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de ji ltar rjes su 'jug bar byed pa yin zhe na / de las skye bar bshad pa ni /
translated: The first of these is explained as follows: It is the cause of that, because it is the producer of that.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las zhes bya ba'o //🔽ldog pas ni rgyu dang 'brel pa'i sngon rol du yod pa med par brdzod  do //🔽rjes su 'gro bas ni rgyu yod pa na yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las zhes bya ba'o //🔽ldog pas ni rgyu dang 'brel pa'i sngon rol du yod pa med par brdzod  do //🔽rjes su 'gro bas ni rgyu yod pa na yod pa nyid do //
translated: What is what of what? The explanation is this: That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what. That which is the nature of what is the nature of what

original: des na de ltar yod pa res 'ga' 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba de gang yod na 'gyur ba de rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar yod pa res 'ga' 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba de gang yod na 'gyur ba de rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that when that existence occurs, that cause is the cause of the arising characterized by occasional occurrence.

original: des na skye ba'i don rnam par dpyad pa nyid las tha dad pa las mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na skye ba'i don rnam par dpyad pa nyid las tha dad pa las mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of arising is not something that occurs from a separate entity.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa dang lhan cig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa dang lhan cig bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the certainty of the relation of cause and effect is demonstrated together.

original: da ni sngar gal te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: da ni sngar gal te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa'i rten ma yin no //
translated: Now, previously it was argued: “If seeing and not seeing are not the basis for understanding positive and negative concomitance,

original: 'o na de ji ltar du bas me mi 'khrul lo zhes rtogs zhes brtsad pa gang yin pa de'i lan mjug sdud pa ni de bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar du bas me mi 'khrul lo zhes rtogs zhes brtsad pa gang yin pa de'i lan mjug sdud pa ni de bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then how is it understood that fire is not mistaken for smoke?” The conclusion to that argument is stated: “Therefore…”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po des de rtogs te mi 'khrul pa rtogs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po des de rtogs te mi 'khrul pa rtogs so //
translated: That relation of cause and effect is understood, i.e., it is understood without error.

original: 'o na de gang las she na /
analyzed: 'o na de gang las she na /
translated: But how is that?

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis zhes smos so //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis zhes smos so //
translated: It is stated: “by seeing and not seeing.”

original: mi 'khrul pa bzhin du der yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag ji ltar sgrub par byed pa las mi nyams she na /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa bzhin du der yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag ji ltar sgrub par byed pa las mi nyams she na /
translated: Just as in the case of non-error, how can one avoid the fault that seeing and not seeing are established in the same way?

original: lan cig ces smos so //
analyzed: lan cig ces smos so //
translated: The response is: “once.”

original: 'di dag mi 'khrul pa la ni lan cig ma yin par 'jug ba la ltos pas skyon du 'gyur gyi @151a * //
analyzed: 'di dag mi 'khrul pa la ni lan cig ma yin par 'jug ba la ltos pas skyon du 'gyur gyi @151a * //
translated: In the case of non-error, the fault would arise because it depends on engagement more than once.

original: 'dir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni ma yin te /
translated: But not here,

original: lan cig zhugs pa nyid kyis de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan cig zhugs pa nyid kyis de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood in that way by the mere once-engagement.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan gyis ni de rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni gzhan du ni ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan gyis ni de rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni gzhan du ni ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement “it is not understood in any other way apart from cause and effect” is “not in any other way.”

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Concomitance” is stated.

original: ma lus pa'i mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni ma lus par mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni ma lus par mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The complete seeing and not seeing are the complete seeing and not seeing.

original: des na gang gi zhes bya ba la ltos pa na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag go zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: des na gang gi zhes bya ba la ltos pa na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag go zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, when “whose” is supplied, the meaning is “concomitance and counter-concomitance.”

original: rtogs pa ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: because the realization of that depends on it.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis mi 'khrul pa la rtogs pa ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag nyid las yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis mi 'khrul pa la rtogs pa ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag nyid las yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If non-erroneous realization in terms of another aspect were due to just seeing and not seeing,

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma lus par mthong ba la rag las pa'i phyir thams cad mthong pa ma yin pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma lus par mthong ba la rag las pa'i phyir thams cad mthong pa ma yin pa la mi srid do //
translated: then that would be impossible without seeing all of the positive and negative concomitances, because it depends on seeing all of the positive and negative concomitances.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyis ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyis ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no realization in terms of another aspect.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di ma lus par mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la brten pa yin gyi lan mang du mthong ba las 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di ma lus par mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la brten pa yin gyi lan mang du mthong ba las 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, why is it that realization is based on seeing and not seeing all of the positive and negative concomitances, but not based on seeing them many times?

original: 'ga' zhig tu lus can ma yin pa nyid la rtag pa nyid mthong yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu lus can ma yin pa nyid la rtag pa nyid mthong yang zhes smos te /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says, “Even though one sees that something is permanent in some places, one does not realize that it is permanent everywhere.”

original: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu lus can ma yin pa nyid la rtag pa nyid mthong pa de lta na yang lus can ma yin ba tsam gyis rtag pa dang rjes su 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu lus can ma yin pa nyid la rtag pa nyid mthong pa de lta na yang lus can ma yin ba tsam gyis rtag pa dang rjes su 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If you see that nonembodiment alone is permanent in some things such as space, still nonembodiment alone does not entail permanence,

original: blo la sogs pa gzhan la lus can ma yin pa nyid la yang rtag pa nyid med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa gzhan la lus can ma yin pa nyid la yang rtag pa nyid med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because you see that other things such as the intellect, though nonembodied, are not permanent.

original: des rjes su 'gro ba mtha' dag mthong ba med pa rjes su 'gro ba mi rtogs so //
analyzed: des rjes su 'gro ba mtha' dag mthong ba med pa rjes su 'gro ba mi rtogs so //
translated: You do not ascertain the pervasion by seeing only a part of the entailment.🔽Similarly, you do not ascertain the counter pervasion by seeing only a part of the counter pervasion.

original: de bzhin du ldog pa ma lus par ma mthong na yang ldog pa nges pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la lus can ma yin pa nyid rtag pa nyid med par ma mthong ba yang bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: de bzhin du ldog pa ma lus par ma mthong na yang ldog pa nges pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la lus can ma yin pa nyid rtag pa nyid med par ma mthong ba yang bya ba la sogs pa
translated: The explanation that you do not ascertain the counter pervasion by seeing only a part of the counter pervasion is as follows: You do not see that nonembodiment alone is not permanent in some things such as a pot, because you see that it is permanent in such things as space.

original: la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: You also see that it is not permanent in such things as action.

original: des na gal te 'bras bu'i 'bras bu nyid dor nas mi 'khrul pa nges pa ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na gal te 'bras bu'i 'bras bu nyid dor nas mi 'khrul pa nges pa ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if the result of the result itself were to be excluded, then the ascertainment of nondeception would be from seeing and not seeing.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case,

original: 'ga' zhig tu de ltar dmigs kyang thams cad du de lta bu'i ngo bor nges pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu de ltar dmigs kyang thams cad du de lta bu'i ngo bor nges pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though one observes it in some cases, it is not established that it is ascertained as having that nature in all cases.

original: des na de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul pa'i tshad ma brjod nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul pa'i tshad ma brjod nas /
translated: Therefore, having stated the nondeception of the result of a reason in that way,

original: @151b rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @151b rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to state the nature of a reason,

original: 'bras bu ni zhes rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni zhes rtsod par byed do //
translated: he says, “The result is . . .”

original: 'bras bu de las skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang mi 'khrul pa yin la rag na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ji ltar rnam pa gang gis tshad ma gang gzhir gyur pas med na mi 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu de las skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang mi 'khrul pa yin la rag na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ji ltar rnam pa gang gis tshad ma gang gzhir gyur pas med na mi 'byung ba yin /
translated: If the result is the defining characteristic of arising from that, then it is nondeceptive with respect to the cause. But how is the nature of a reason a nonobservation of something that is related? In what way is it a valid knowledge that is the basis of a reason?

original: da zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin na'o //
analyzed: da zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin na'o //
translated: If it is not a nonobservation, then it is not a nonobservation of something related.

original: de ltar dogs pa la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rang gi ngo bo sngar bshad zin pa nyid tshad ma brjod pa'i yan lag tu ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rang gi ngo bo sngar bshad zin pa nyid tshad ma brjod pa'i yan lag tu ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, with regard to the doubt, the reason of essence itself, which was explained earlier, is shown to be a part of the expression of the valid cognition.

original: rang bzhin la yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin la yang zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “also in the case of essence” is used.

original: rang bzhin la ni med na mi 'byung ba mi 'khrul pa yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa la dngos po tsam la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni med na mi 'byung ba mi 'khrul pa yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa la dngos po tsam la ltos pa yin no //
translated: In the case of essence, the non-erroneous non-occurrence of the absence is merely related to the mere existence, and it is dependent on the mere thing.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ni gtan tshigs kyi chos yin pas des gtan tshigs 'phangs pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ni gtan tshigs kyi chos yin pas des gtan tshigs 'phangs pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: Since the non-occurrence of the absence is the property of the reason, it is not stated because it implies the reason.

original: des na 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is what is being said:

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa la yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa la yin no //
translated: The non-occurrence of the absence in the case of the reason of essence is merely related to the existence as it was explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig ces smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig ces smos so //
translated: For that very reason, the phrase “that which” is used.

original: rang bzhin gang zhig yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin de la ni yod pa med na mi 'byung bar 'dod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin de la ni yod pa med na mi 'byung bar 'dod do //
translated: That essence which is related to the mere existence, that essence is asserted to be the non-occurrence of the absence.

original: rang bzhin ni skabs kyis yod pa nyid kyi yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni skabs kyis yod pa nyid kyi yin no //
translated: The nature is the existence itself at the time.

original: des na de ltar rang bzhin gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar rang bzhin gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the nature as the intrinsic reality,

original: de las med na mi 'byung pa rigs pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni de med na mi yod pa bdag med par 'gyur te gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i don la yin no //
analyzed: de las med na mi 'byung pa rigs pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni de med na mi yod pa bdag med par 'gyur te gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i don la yin no //
translated: he explains that the invariable relation is only logical, since it is impossible for it not to exist when that exists. The invariable relation of the reason is with respect to the meaning of that sort.

original: de med na med pa nyid na med na 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de med na med pa nyid na med na 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: If it does not exist when that does not exist, then it is only produced when that exists.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, this is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin la med na mi 'byung ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di 'dir rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin la med na mi 'byung ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di 'dir rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Since the nature is related to mere existence, it is the invariable relation. Therefore, it is only logical that it is like this here.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa tha dad med phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa tha dad med phyir ro //
translated: Because the explanation of the reason is not different.

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa dang rjes su 'brel par brjod do //🔽des na ji ltar med na mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa dang rjes su 'brel par brjod do // des na ji ltar med na mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Because it is not different, it is said to be related to existence.🔽Thus, how could it not be the invariable relation?

original: ci ste tha dad pa med par ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci ste tha dad pa med par ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: But if it is not different, how is it understood?

original: chos gang zhig cig shos gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni rnam par dpyad pa las de lta bu rtogs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: chos gang zhig cig shos gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni rnam par dpyad pa las de lta bu rtogs pa kho na ste /
translated: Any dharma that is the nature of another is only realized through analysis,

original: tha dad pa nges pa rtag par ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nges pa rtag par ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: just as difference is ascertained to be permanent, as explained.

original: byas pa la sogs mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ni rang nyid nye bar bkod de ston par 'gyur ro //🔽gang kho na @152a * //
analyzed: byas pa la sogs mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ni rang nyid nye bar bkod de ston par 'gyur ro // gang kho na @152a * //
translated: The nature of the produced, impermanence, etc., is itself posited and shown.🔽That which is said to be the nature of existence

original: yod pa'i rang bzhin zhes brjod pa yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa de kho na 'di gang yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i rang bzhin zhes brjod pa yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa de kho na 'di gang yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: is only existence, and it is only related to existence.

original: des na 'dir rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rigs pas med na mi 'byung ba 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rigs pas med na mi 'byung ba 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, a reason that is a nonobservation of something related is established.

original: tha mi dad pa de'i rigs pa khong du chud pa ni gtan tshigs de dang de dag la tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa de'i rigs pa khong du chud pa ni gtan tshigs de dang de dag la tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The understanding of the reasoning of nondifference is different from those reasons.

original: 'di ltar byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dngos su tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dngos su tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because that which is produced in this way is impermanent, there is no difference in actuality, and therefore the reason of essence is a reason of non-observation of a nature.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa ni nges pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa ni nges pa kho na ste /
translated: That which is not different from its own nature is definitely so.

original: de gcig la 'khrul pa med kyang rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan la yang de ltar 'gyur bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gcig la 'khrul pa med kyang rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan la yang de ltar 'gyur bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even if one is not mistaken about it, it is not certain that its nature will be the same for another.

original: ji ltar mi rtag pa gcig rtsol ba las byung ba yin yang gzhan rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin bar 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag pa gcig rtsol ba las byung ba yin yang gzhan rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin bar 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: Just as one impermanent thing is produced by effort, but another is not produced by effort,

original: des na rtsol ba las byung ba yang 'ga' zhig mi rtag pa ma yin bar 'gyur ro zhes the tshom 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtsol ba las byung ba yang 'ga' zhig mi rtag pa ma yin bar 'gyur ro zhes the tshom 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: so it is uncertain whether or not something produced by effort is impermanent.

original: ma yin te de'i bdag nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad mas 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i bdag nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad mas 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: No, because the nature of something is established by the valid knowledge that refutes what is discordant with it.

original: gang la yod pa de kho nar 'di 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang la yod pa de kho nar 'di 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is only in the one who has it that it exists.🔽

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it exists in only that, then it is not in any other.🔽If that is so, then it is not the same as that,

original: de lta na ni 'o na tha mi dad pa tsam de'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes gzhan du gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na tha mi dad pa tsam de'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes gzhan du gtan la phab zin to //
translated: because it has been determined that it is not the same as that.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis ldog pa grub na rjes su 'gro ba yang de'i shugs kyis 'phangs pas grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi dngos por grub pas na de'i bdag nyid khas blangs pas ci bya des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis ldog pa grub na rjes su 'gro ba yang de'i shugs kyis 'phangs pas grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi dngos por grub pas na de'i bdag nyid khas blangs pas ci bya des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang
translated: If the pervasion is established by the mere fact that there is no valid cognition to contradict it, then the forward pervasion is also established by implication. Therefore, since the existence of the reason is established, what is the use of accepting that it is the same as that?

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub na bltar rung ba'i yul can gyi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag gis 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa nges so zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad par 'gyur
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub na bltar rung ba'i yul can gyi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag gis 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa nges so zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad par 'gyur
translated: Therefore, if the existence of the relation of cause and effect and of the pervaded and the pervader is established, then it is not tenable to say that the negative pervasion of the effect and nature reasons is ascertained by the nonobservation of a cause and pervader that are perceptible objects.

original: ro // 'di ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs gnod pa'i tshad mas go ldog pa
analyzed: ro // 'di ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs gnod pa'i tshad mas go ldog pa
translated: Thus, in the case of a natural sign, the establishment of the relation between the signifier and the signified is due to the power of a valid cognition that contradicts the discordant side.

original: ji ltar mi nges /
analyzed: ji ltar mi nges /
translated: How could it be indefinite?

original: des khyab par bya ba dang khyab @152b par byed pa'i dngos po nges pa'i sngon rol du nges par 'gyur ba'i ldog pa gang yin pa de grub pa na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa gzhan gyi don ci yod /
analyzed: des khyab par bya ba dang khyab @152b par byed pa'i dngos po nges pa'i sngon rol du nges par 'gyur ba'i ldog pa gang yin pa de grub pa na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa gzhan gyi don ci yod /
translated: If the contrapositive of that relation between the signifier and the signified is ascertained prior to the establishment of the relation between the signifier and the signified, then what is the point of the other one, the nonobservation of the pervader?

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba nyid 'brel pa yin la de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad mas ldog pa sgrub pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas 'brel pa nges par brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba nyid 'brel pa yin la de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad mas ldog pa sgrub pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas 'brel pa nges par brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the relation is the forward pervasion and that it is established by the valid cognition that contradicts the discordant side, then the relation is established by the valid cognition that contradicts the discordant side.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not correct.

original: de lta na yang ji skad bshad pa'i skyon mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang ji skad bshad pa'i skyon mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But even so, the fault explained earlier is not averted.

original: rjes su 'gro ba 'brel pa las gzhan nyid do zhes ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba 'brel pa las gzhan nyid do zhes ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained earlier that the relation of following is something other than the relation of connection.

original: de'i phyir chos gcig gi bdag nyid kho na 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gcig gi bdag nyid kho na 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is logical to say that the relation is the identity of a single phenomenon,

original: de yang de dang chos gcig gi bdag nyid kho na las de rtogs pa na de'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pas grub pa nyid do zhes rigs so //
analyzed: de yang de dang chos gcig gi bdag nyid kho na las de rtogs pa na de'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pas grub pa nyid do zhes rigs so //
translated: and that when one realizes that, the nature of the other is also established through the analysis of its own nature.

original: da ni 'dir don tha mi dad kyang chos tha dad par rtogs par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dir don tha mi dad kyang chos tha dad par rtogs par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to prove that although the objects are not different, the phenomena are realized as different,

original: 'o na da ni zhes rgol bar byed do //
analyzed: 'o na da ni zhes rgol bar byed do //
translated: the opponent objects, “But now, if that is so . . . ”

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin na /
translated: If, as has been explained, that which is impermanent is necessarily arisen and that which is arisen is necessarily impermanent, then whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: de'i tshe byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can dang chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos byas pas mi rtag pa sgrub pa na gtan tshigs su brjod par 'gyur
analyzed: de'i tshe byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can dang chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos byas pas mi rtag pa sgrub pa na gtan tshigs su brjod par 'gyur
translated: At that time, since that which is produced and impermanent are not different, when one establishes the property of the thesis, the general characteristic of the subject and the property, or one part of the meaning of the thesis, by the property of the probandum, that which is produced establishes impermanence, and it becomes the reason.

original: ro // byas pa dang mi rtag pa gcig pa'i phyir byas pa mi rtag go zhes byas na mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ro // byas pa dang mi rtag pa gcig pa'i phyir byas pa mi rtag go zhes byas na mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: Because that which is produced and impermanent are the same, if one says “That which is produced is impermanent,” it is as if one says “Impermanent because impermanent.”

original: des na gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bzhin du de yang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bzhin du de yang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because, like the property of the probandum, it is not understood.

original: 'di spangs pa'i phyir nyes pa de ni med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di spangs pa'i phyir nyes pa de ni med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to abandon this, it says “That fault does not exist because…” and so on.

original: gang phyir dngos kun te /
analyzed: gang phyir dngos kun te /
translated: Because all things

original: gsal ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
analyzed: gsal ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
translated: are not only the manifest,

original: spyi yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but also the universal. This is the meaning.

original: ldog pa la ni rten pa can de ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa la ni rten pa can de ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and the reversal of that is the possession of the reversal of that.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: mthun pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi dngos dag las so //🔽rang gi dngos po ni mthun dngos te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi dngos dag las so // rang gi dngos po ni mthun dngos te /
translated: From other homogeneous things.🔽A homogeneous thing is one’s own thing.

original: bdag gi ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: It is one’s own property.

original: bdag gi ba yang 'brel pa las yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi ba yang 'brel pa las yin la /
translated: And that is due to the relation,

original: de yang rigs 'dra ba nyid las yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs 'dra ba nyid las yin no //
translated: and that is due to the similarity of type.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rigs mi @153a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rigs mi @153a * //
translated: In the same way, a heterogeneous thing is a different type.

original: mthun pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po yin no //
translated: It is a different type from a homogeneous type.

original: rigs mthun dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs mthun dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the reversal of a homogeneous type and a heterogeneous type.
