original: gtan tshigs bshad pa ni rang bzhin gyis rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa ni rang bzhin gyis rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir /
translated: The reason is stated: “because they naturally abide in their own nature.”

original: des na don 'di yin te dngos po rang gi rang bzhin gyis gang gi phyir rang gi rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa yin gyi gzhan gyi bdag nyid la mi 'gro ba de'i phyir de las 'di'i rang bzhin de ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te dngos po rang gi rang bzhin gyis gang gi phyir rang gi rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa yin gyi gzhan gyi bdag nyid la mi 'gro ba de'i phyir de las 'di'i rang bzhin de ldog pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is as follows: A thing naturally abides in its own nature, because it is the ultimate of its own nature, and it does not go to the nature of another. Therefore, its nature is reversed from that.

original: gang gi phyir 'di rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi bdag nyid la med pas ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi bdag nyid la med pas ldog pa yin no //
translated: Because it exists in its own nature, therefore it is excluded from the nature of others.

original: des na shing shing gi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa des na ba lang la sogs pa shing ma yin pa la med pa de'i phyir shing ma yin pa las ldog pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shing shing gi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa des na ba lang la sogs pa shing ma yin pa la med pa de'i phyir shing ma yin pa las ldog pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the tree exists in its own nature by the essence of the tree, therefore it is excluded from non-trees such as cows, etc.

original: de bzhin du de nyid sha pa'i rang bzhin gyis seng ldeng la sogs pa la med pas seng ldeng la sogs pa las ldog pas na rigs mthun pa las kyang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid sha pa'i rang bzhin gyis seng ldeng la sogs pa la med pas seng ldeng la sogs pa las ldog pas na rigs mthun pa las kyang ldog pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, since it does not exist in khadira, etc. by the essence of śimśapā, therefore it is excluded from homogeneous things by being excluded from khadira, etc.

original: gsal ba ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid kho nas ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal ba ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid kho nas ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: The manifest is excluded only by the essence of the manifest.

original: spyi'i bdag nyid kyis ni 'dre par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid kyis ni 'dre par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: The doubt is removed that it would be mixed by the essence of the universal.

original: kun zhes smos so //
analyzed: kun zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the word “all” is stated.

original: de ltar yang 'brel par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'brel par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is shown to be related.

original: des na de ltar dngos po la dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ldog pa yod par bsgrubs nas da ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtag pa tha dad pa bstan pa'i phyir de phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos po la dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ldog pa yod par bsgrubs nas da ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtag pa tha dad pa bstan pa'i phyir de phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, since a thing does not exist as another thing, having thus established the existence of the negation, now, in order to demonstrate the reason for the existence of the many different negations, he says, “Therefore, . . .”

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa la brten pa can yin pa de'i phyir gang dang gang las don ldog pa don la don gang dang gang med pa'i phyir ldog pa rnams mang ba nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa la brten pa can yin pa de'i phyir gang dang gang las don ldog pa don la don gang dang gang med pa'i phyir ldog pa rnams mang ba nyid du brjod do //
translated: Since it is based on the negation, therefore, from whatever thing a meaning is negated, because that meaning does not exist in that meaning, the negations are said to be many.

original: de'i rgyu can gyis te de'i rgyu mtshan can gyis rigs dbye /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyis te de'i rgyu mtshan can gyis rigs dbye /
translated: By the reason for that, i.e., by the reason for that, the class is distinguished.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas rigs tha dad par rab tu brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas rigs tha dad par rab tu brtags pa yin no //
translated: It is imagined by the conceptual consciousness as different classes.

original: 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod de /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gang dang gang don la med pa de dang de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i chos don la snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang don la med pa de dang de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i chos don la snang ba yin no //
translated: Whatever does not exist in a meaning, that dharma, which is the antidote to that, appears in the meaning.

original: mang po'i tshig gis ni chos mang por bstan to //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig gis ni chos mang por bstan to //
translated: The word “many” teaches many dharmas.

original: de dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin du snang ngo zhes rigs kyi tshig sbyar bas bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin du snang ngo zhes rigs kyi tshig sbyar bas bstan to //
translated: The word “type” is used to indicate that they appear as the nature of the universal.

original: byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par brtags pa'i chos de dag ni nya phyis la sogs pa la dngul la sogs pa ltar gtan med pa ni ma yin no @153b zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par brtags pa'i chos de dag ni nya phyis la sogs pa la dngul la sogs pa ltar gtan med pa ni ma yin no @153b zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The phrase “but they are not completely nonexistent” means that the phenomena of the pot, etc., which are imagined as produced, impermanent, etc., are not completely nonexistent, like the silver, etc., of a shell, etc.

original: de'i khyad par ni rtogs 'gyur ba dag rab tu byed ces bya ba yin no //🔽ldog pa'i mtshams su gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir khyad par te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni rtogs 'gyur ba dag rab tu byed ces bya ba yin no // ldog pa'i mtshams su gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir khyad par te /
translated: The phrase “their particularities are understood” means that they are well understood.🔽They are particularities because they are different from other things that are not their limits.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa tha dad pa dang 'dre ba dang bral ba'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa tha dad pa dang 'dre ba dang bral ba'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the produced, the impermanent, etc., which are different from the nature of things, which are free from confusion and mixing.

original: tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi rten la med kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te des na brtags pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas de rtogs par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi rten la med kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te des na brtags pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas de rtogs par rung ba yin no //
translated: Impermanence, etc., which are different and concomitant, do not exist in the nature of the basis, but their own natures do. Therefore, it is suitable to understand them through the realization of the imputations.

original: 'di bstan pa na skabs kyi nyes par thal ba med do zhes bshad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //🔽don gyi rang bzhin mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gang zhig brtags pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba'i chos gang gis go bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de chos de las gzhan gyis go bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bstan pa na skabs kyi nyes par thal ba med do zhes bshad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // don gyi rang bzhin mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gang zhig brtags pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba'i chos gang gis go bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de chos de las gzhan gyis go bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: When this is taught, the fault of the context does not arise.🔽The meaning is that the particular characteristic of impermanence does not exist in the nature of things. The particular that is understood by the dharma of the class of imputations cannot be understood by any other dharma.

original: dngos po'i mi rtag pa gang zhig mi rtag pa zhes brtags pa'i chos kyis chod nas khyad par gyis rtogs pa de ni byas pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis rtogs par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i mi rtag pa gang zhig mi rtag pa zhes brtags pa'i chos kyis chod nas khyad par gyis rtogs pa de ni byas pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis rtogs par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: The impermanence of things, which is understood through the particular of the imputation of impermanence, cannot be understood by the aspect called “produced.”

original: de bzhin du byas pa zhes bya bas rtogs pa yang mi rtag pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du byas pa zhes bya bas rtogs pa yang mi rtag pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, since the realization of “product” is impermanent, it is not a realization.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, this is the meaning:

original: gang gi phyir dngos su byas pa nyid la sogs pa bdag nyid gcig pa yin yang rnam pa de lta bu'i tshul gyis ni rtogs pa tha dad pa yod pa yin te /🔽gang gis mi rtag pa ma grub pa'i phyir byas pa zhes bya bar brjod pa yang ma grub par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos su byas pa nyid la sogs pa bdag nyid gcig pa yin yang rnam pa de lta bu'i tshul gyis ni rtogs pa tha dad pa yod pa yin te / gang gis mi rtag pa ma grub pa'i phyir byas pa zhes bya bar brjod pa yang ma grub par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Although the nature of “product” and so on is the same in actuality, there is a difference in realization in terms of such a mode.🔽Since impermanence is not established, the expression “product” would not be established.

original: de grub na yang mi rtag pa yang grub pas don med par 'gyur ba byas par rtogs pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de grub na yang mi rtag pa yang grub pas don med par 'gyur ba byas par rtogs pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, if that is established, since impermanence is also established, the subject “realization of product” would be pointless.

original: dngos po la gcig yin yang dngos su rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa gcig gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la gcig yin yang dngos su rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa gcig gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: Since a thing is one, it is not apprehended as a single realization, because it is not directly realized.

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyis rtogs pa tha dad par snang ba'i phyir gcig rtogs kyang gzhan rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyis rtogs pa tha dad par snang ba'i phyir gcig rtogs kyang gzhan rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it appears as a different realization by the subject of the exclusion of other, even if one is realized, the other is not realized.

original: de lta mod kyi rnam pa thams cad du dngos po yongs su dor ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa ci zhig ltar yang rtogs pa grub pa des na ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rnam pa thams cad du dngos po yongs su dor ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa ci zhig ltar yang rtogs pa grub pa des na ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: But since it is not the case that all things are completely abandoned, then in some way or other, the realization is established. Therefore, there is no opportunity for the faults explained above.

original: 'grel pa ni dngos po thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni dngos po thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The commentary is from “All things” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad ni @154a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad ni @154a * //
translated: Because all things

original: rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa can kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa can kho na yin te /
translated: are only those that abide in their own nature.

original: 'di dag la rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag la rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa yod pa yin no //
translated: They exist as those that abide in their own nature.

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The meaning of the nature of things is that this is their nature.

original: de tsam gyi ngo bo ni rang gi bdag nyid kho na la gnas pa yin gyi gzhan gyi bdag nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyi ngo bo ni rang gi bdag nyid kho na la gnas pa yin gyi gzhan gyi bdag nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature that is just that is only that which abides in its own nature, but not in the nature of another.

original: de ltar / rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
analyzed: de ltar / rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
translated: Thus, because they abide in their own nature,

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bshad nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bshad nas /
translated: having explained the reason,

original: bsgrub bya 'chad pa ni de phyir de dag ni rang gzhan du 'dre bar mi byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'chad pa ni de phyir de dag ni rang gzhan du 'dre bar mi byed do //
translated: The topic of the thesis is stated: therefore, they do not mix with each other.

original: gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist in another.

original: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The meaning is that they are distinguished from other homogeneous and heterogeneous things.

original: de dag rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo las ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de dag rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo las ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the logic of this statement: “They are distinguished from other natures because they abide in their own natures?”

original: de gzhan ma yin pa nyid du thal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de gzhan ma yin pa nyid du thal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “Because it follows that they are not other.”

original: gal te gzhan de de nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan de de nyid yin na /
translated: If that other is that very thing,

original: de lta na 'di gzhan gyi ngo bo dang 'dres par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'di gzhan gyi ngo bo dang 'dres par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then this would be a mixing of other natures.

original: gang gi tshe 'di gang yin pa ni de kho na yin la gzhan ni gzhan kho na yin pa de'i tshe 'dres pa'i don ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di gang yin pa ni de kho na yin la gzhan ni gzhan kho na yin pa de'i tshe 'dres pa'i don ci zhig yod /
translated: When this is that very thing and the other is just another, then what is the meaning of mixing?

original: de lta na ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid du gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid du gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it is clear that they abide in their own natures.

original: 'dres par gyur pas byas te 'di dag gcig tu gyur na yang de gzhan ma yin pa pha rol por ma gyur pa nyid du 'gyur bas de lta na yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la 'dre ba ma grub kyi /
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pas byas te 'di dag gcig tu gyur na yang de gzhan ma yin pa pha rol por ma gyur pa nyid du 'gyur bas de lta na yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la 'dre ba ma grub kyi /
translated: If they were mixed, then even if they were identical, they would not be different, and thus mixing with another’s self is not established.

original: 'on kyang rang rang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam par gnas pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang rang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam par gnas pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, they would each exist in their own nature alone.

original: ci ste yang rang bzhin tha dad pa yod kyang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang 'dres kyang gzhan ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yang rang bzhin tha dad pa yod kyang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang 'dres kyang gzhan ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if they have different natures, then because they would be identical by some nature, even if they were mixed with another’s self, it would not follow that they are not different.

original: dper na bum pa snam bu las rang gi ngo bo tha dad kyang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid kyis gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes kha cig sems pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa snam bu las rang gi ngo bo tha dad kyang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid kyis gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes kha cig sems pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, some think that although a pot is different in nature from a cloth, they are identical by the nature of the three qualities.

original: 'di ltar bum pa yang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i bdag nyid yin la snam bu yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa yang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i bdag nyid yin la snam bu yang yin no //
translated: In this case, a pot is the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas, and so is a cloth.

original: yon tan gsum ni bum pa las tha mi dad la snam bu las kyang tha mi dad do //🔽des na gzhan yin yang 'dre bar 'thad pa yin no zhes dogs pa thams cad smos pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir gang yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: yon tan gsum ni bum pa las tha mi dad la snam bu las kyang tha mi dad do // des na gzhan yin yang 'dre bar 'thad pa yin no zhes dogs pa thams cad smos pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir gang yang zhes smos so //
translated: The three qualities are not different from the pot, nor are they different from the cloth.🔽Therefore, even though they are different, it is still tenable that they are mixed.🔽In order to demonstrate the point of this objection, he says, “If it is said that . . .🔽. . . the pot and so on are not its nature.”

original: gang yang bum pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi @154b rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba gsal ba las tha mi dad pa dang ngo bo tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang bum pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi @154b rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba gsal ba las tha mi dad pa dang ngo bo tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: The nature of the pot and so on is not that of the universal.

original: gzhung lugs ji lta ba bzhin khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung lugs ji lta ba bzhin khas blangs pa'o //
translated: This is the assertion according to the scriptural tradition.

original: de ni bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag nyid de dag gi ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag nyid de dag gi ma yin te /
translated: That is not the nature of the pot and so on, which are different.

original: rang bzhin de dag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin de dag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not their nature. This is the meaning.

original: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa bdag nyid du gyur pa tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin yod par gyur pa de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa dag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa bdag nyid du gyur pa tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin yod par gyur pa de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa dag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: How is this so? He explains: “If the nature of the pot and so on, which is not different, exists, then the pot and so on would not exist.”

original: 'di ltar bum pa yon tan gsum las tha mi dad na /🔽bum pa nyid yon tan gsum yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa yon tan gsum las tha mi dad na / bum pa nyid yon tan gsum yin pa'am /
translated: If the pot were not different from the three qualities,🔽either the pot itself would be the three qualities,

original: yang na yon tan gsum nyid bum pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang na yon tan gsum nyid bum pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: or the three qualities themselves would be the pot.

original: bum pa nyid dang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa nyid dang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the pot itself is the nature of the three qualities.

original: de lta na 'o na sngon po skad cig ma nyid las tha mi dad na sngon po nyid skad cig ma nyid pa'i phyir 'jig pa tsam ma ma gzugs tsam du 'gyur gyi gzugs dang 'jig par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sngon po skad cig ma nyid las tha mi dad na sngon po nyid skad cig ma nyid pa'i phyir 'jig pa tsam ma ma gzugs tsam du 'gyur gyi gzugs dang 'jig par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If blue were not different from momentariness, then because blue itself would be momentary, it would be mere destruction, not form.🔽Therefore, just as form and destruction are the same, although they are not different, in the same way, the pot would be the nature of the three qualities.

original: des na tha mi dad kyang gzugs dang 'jig pa yin pa de bzhin du bum pa yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ste gzugs nyid 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang skad cig ma dag
analyzed: des na tha mi dad kyang gzugs dang 'jig pa yin pa de bzhin du bum pa yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ste gzugs nyid 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang skad cig ma dag
translated: This is an inappropriate analogy, because form itself is destruction. Therefore, blue and momentariness

original: tha dad med kyang 'di rnam par rtog pas tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad med kyang 'di rnam par rtog pas tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: are not different. Although they are not different, they are conceived as different by conceptual thought.

original: de bzhin du gal te bum pa nyid yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na 'di rang bzhin gcig yin na snam bu la yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir de yang bum pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te bum pa nyid yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na 'di rang bzhin gcig yin na snam bu la yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir de yang bum pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: So too, if the vase itself is the nature of the three qualities, and thus it is a single nature, then since the cloth also has the nature of the three qualities, it too would be the nature of the vase.

original: bum pa'i rang bzhin yang yin la yon tan gsum yang yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang skad cig ma la sogs pa ltar tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i yon tan gsum snam bu la yod par ga la 'gyur
analyzed: bum pa'i rang bzhin yang yin la yon tan gsum yang yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang skad cig ma la sogs pa ltar tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i yon tan gsum snam bu la yod par ga la 'gyur
translated: Since it is the nature of the vase and also the three qualities, it would be a nature that is not different from the vase, like blueness and momentariness, and so how could the three qualities that are devoid of the nature of the vase exist in the cloth?

original: te / de yon tan gsum nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te / de yon tan gsum nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For it would not be the three qualities.

original: de lta na 'o na sngon po dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir yin pa'i phyi sngon po nyid spangs nas ser po 'jig pa yin par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sngon po dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir yin pa'i phyi sngon po nyid spangs nas ser po 'jig pa yin par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: “In that case, since blueness and destruction are the same nature, then after abandoning blueness, yellow would not be destruction,

original: 'jig pa yin na ni sngon po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa yin na ni sngon po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: or if it is destruction, it would follow that it is blueness.”

original: de ltar ni mi nus te /🔽sngon po'i bdag nyid @155a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te / sngon po'i bdag nyid @155a * //
translated: But that is not possible.

original: du gyur pa'i 'jig pa nyid ser po la khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du gyur pa'i 'jig pa nyid ser po la khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you do not accept that the destruction which is of the nature of blue is yellow.

original: de yod na ni thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de yod na ni thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: If it did exist, then this consequence would follow:

original: de sngon po dang dbyer med pa na sngon po spangs nas rjes su 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon po dang dbyer med pa na sngon po spangs nas rjes su 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were inseparable from blue, then it would be impossible for it to occur after blue has ceased.

original: yon tan gsum ni snam bu las gzhan du khas ma blangs so //
analyzed: yon tan gsum ni snam bu las gzhan du khas ma blangs so //
translated: You do not accept that the three qualities are different from the cloth.

original: bum pa la yod pa ni bum pa dang tha mi dad pas na snam bu bum par thal lo //
analyzed: bum pa la yod pa ni bum pa dang tha mi dad pas na snam bu bum par thal lo //
translated: Since that which exists in the pot is not different from the pot, it follows that the cloth is the pot.

original: des na yon tan gsum tsam rjes su 'jug pa de bum pa las gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yon tan gsum tsam rjes su 'jug pa de bum pa las gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the mere occurrence of the three qualities would be different from the pot.

original: des na bum pa nyid yon tan gsum yin no zhes khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: des na bum pa nyid yon tan gsum yin no zhes khas mi blang ngo //
translated: Therefore, you cannot accept that the pot itself is the three qualities.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa snga ma la /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa snga ma la /
translated: Therefore, in the former conception,

original: bum pa nyid yon tan gsum yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir snam bu bum pa nyid du thal lo //
analyzed: bum pa nyid yon tan gsum yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir snam bu bum pa nyid du thal lo //
translated: it follows that the cloth is the pot, because the pot itself would be the three qualities.

original: 'on te yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid kho na bum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid kho na bum pa yin no //
translated: Or is the pot just the nature of the three qualities?

original: de'i tshe de dag med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, they would not exist at all.

original: de bshad pa ni de kho na yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de kho na yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is “it would be just that.”

original: gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa gsal ba la rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yin pa de'i phyir de kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa gsal ba la rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yin pa de'i phyir de kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the existence of the manifestation, therefore it would be just that.

original: gal te ji ltar tha mi dad pa yod pa de bzhin du gsal ba'i rang bzhin du tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni tha dad pa yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar tha mi dad pa yod pa de bzhin du gsal ba'i rang bzhin du tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni tha dad pa yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asked, “Just as there is no difference in existence, is there not also a difference in the nature of the manifestation?” the answer is “no,” because there is no difference.

original: bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The difference in the nature of the manifestation, such as a pot, does not exist.

original: de yod na de las ma rtogs pa zhes gzhi mthun pas gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de yod na de las ma rtogs pa zhes gzhi mthun pas gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: If it did, it would be a reason based on a common locus with the statement “not understood from that.”

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te gal te bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa yod la yon tan gsum yang tha mi dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te gal te bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa yod la yon tan gsum yang tha mi dad pa yin na /
translated: This is what is being said: if the pot and so on are different, and the three qualities are not different,

original: de tshe de dang tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di khas blang bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tshe de dang tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di khas blang bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not possible to accept that, because they would be different.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i bsam pa tha mi dad pa las nyes pa bshad pa ni de nyid tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i bsam pa tha mi dad pa las nyes pa bshad pa ni de nyid tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fault explained from the perspective of the non-different intention as stated is “if they are different from that.

original: gal te yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid las bum pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid las bum pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: If the pot is not different from the nature of the three qualities,

original: de'i tshe 'di snam bu la sogs pa las tha mi dad pas ji ltar yang bum pa la sogs pa tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di snam bu la sogs pa las tha mi dad pas ji ltar yang bum pa la sogs pa tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: then at that time, since it is not different from cloth and so on, how could the pot and so on be different?

original: bum pa dang tha mi dad pa'i yon tan gsum snam bu las tha dad pa med bzhin du yang snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad do zhes ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bum pa dang tha mi dad pa'i yon tan gsum snam bu las tha dad pa med bzhin du yang snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad do zhes ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the three qualities, which are not different from the pot, are not different from cloth and so on, while the pot and so on are different by their nature.

original: de'i phyir yon tan gsum tsam nyid yod pa @155b lus pa yin la de lta na yang dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas so zhes grub bo zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan gsum tsam nyid yod pa @155b lus pa yin la de lta na yang dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas so zhes grub bo zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, only the three qualities remain, and even so, it is established that all things abide in their own entities.🔽This is what is shown by “And even so.

original: de yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That is the meaning of “and so on.”🔽

original: gang gi tshe tha mi dad par khas blangs pa gang yin pa de kho na yod do zhes lus par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tha mi dad par khas blangs pa gang yin pa de kho na yod do zhes lus par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is accepted that they are not different, then only that which exists remains.

original: gzhan 'ga' yang med pas na 'di gang du 'dre bar 'gyur te des na rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa grub pa'i phyir gzhan la ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' yang med pas na 'di gang du 'dre bar 'gyur te des na rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa grub pa'i phyir gzhan la ldog pa yin no //
translated: Since nothing else exists, where would they mix? Therefore, since it is established that they abide in their own entities, they are not different.

original: 'o na don tha dad pa yang yod par 'gyur la tha dad pa rnams kyi rang bzhin tha mi dad pa yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na don tha dad pa yang yod par 'gyur la tha dad pa rnams kyi rang bzhin tha mi dad pa yang yod pa yin no //
translated: But if they are different, then difference would exist, and the nature of different things would not be different.

original: gang gis ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba tha dad pa dag dang tha mi dad par dbyer med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba tha dad pa dag dang tha mi dad par dbyer med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that they are undifferentiated in the sense of being undifferentiated from what is different, as explained above, and thus they are not without fault.

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: But they are definitely different.

original: tha mi dad pa de ni tha dad pa de dag la 'brel pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa de ni tha dad pa de dag la 'brel pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: That which is not different is related to those that are different.

original: de bas na tha dad par rang gi bdag nyid kyis rang rang gi ngo bo la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ma 'dres kyang 'di dag la tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yod pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'di dag de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad par rang gi bdag nyid kyis rang rang gi ngo bo la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ma 'dres kyang 'di dag la tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yod pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'di dag de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although they are not mixed because they are established in their own individual natures as different, they are mixed in the sense that they have the same nature, because they are related to that which is not different.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa dag bum pa la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas kyang yod pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa dag bum pa la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas kyang yod pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, although such things as pots are established in their own individual natures as pots, etc., they are mixed in the sense of existence.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de'i bdag nyid ni de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de'i bdag nyid ni de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nature of existence is related to them,

original: thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it exists in all.

original: des na bdag nyid 'ga' zhig 'dre bar 'gyur bas na /🔽gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid 'ga' zhig 'dre bar 'gyur bas na / gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Therefore, since they are mixed in some way,🔽how can it be said that “all things are by nature

original: zhes ji ltar brjod ce na zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes ji ltar brjod ce na zhes dogs pa la /
translated: unmixed”?

original: don gzhan yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: don gzhan yang zhes smos so //
translated: The word also has a different meaning.

original: don gzhan nyid kyis sngar gyi skyon med par bstan to //🔽de lta yin na de dag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'dre bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid kyis sngar gyi skyon med par bstan to // de lta yin na de dag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'dre bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: It shows that the previous error does not apply.

original: du ma dang 'brel kyang zhes smos so //🔽de lta bur gyur pas kyang de dag 'dre ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: du ma dang 'brel kyang zhes smos so // de lta bur gyur pas kyang de dag 'dre ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: If that were so, they would not be mixed because they would have different natures. To refute that, it says, Even though they are related to many.

original: de ni de dag gi spyi ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi spyi ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: Even though they are like that, they are not mixed. To explain this, it says, That is not their universal.

original: du ma gang dag dang 'di 'brel pa de dag gi spyi de ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma gang dag dang 'di 'brel pa de dag gi spyi de ma yin no //
translated: That which is related to many is not their universal.

original: gal te 'di dag gis spyir grub na ni de'i tshe 'di dag gi mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gis spyir grub na ni de'i tshe 'di dag gi mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta na ni ma yin no //
translated: If they were established as universals, then because they would be similar, they would be mixed by their very nature. But that is not so.

original: ma yin par ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ma yin par ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is it known that they are not so?

original: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
translated: Because they do not have that nature.

original: gal te 'di de dag dang @156a * //
analyzed: gal te 'di de dag dang @156a * //
translated: If they were universals,

original: 'brel par khas blangs pa'i phyir 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam zhen bden te 'di sgra de ltar brjod kyi de 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel par khas blangs pa'i phyir 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam zhen bden te 'di sgra de ltar brjod kyi de 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Indeed, that is so, but they are expressed in that way, but not as they are expressed in that way.

original: de de dag gi tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de dag gi tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought is that they are not the nature of those.

original: de'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: His thought is this:

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gcig re re la yongs su rdzogs pas mang po rnams kyi tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gcig re re la yongs su rdzogs pas mang po rnams kyi tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe /
translated: When each of the same nature is complete, the many are not different in nature.

original: 'di mang po rnams kyi mtshungs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di mang po rnams kyi mtshungs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, this is the same for the many.

original: ba lang du rtogs pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag gang gi tshe khra bo la sogs pa re re la /
analyzed: ba lang du rtogs pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag gang gi tshe khra bo la sogs pa re re la /
translated: When the nature of the object that is cognized as an ox is in each of the variegated and so on,

original: la la tha dad pa med par yod pa de'i tshe de dag thams cad de lta bur mtshungs par grub pa'i phyir tha mi dad par de nyid de dag gi spyi yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la tha dad pa med par yod pa de'i tshe de dag thams cad de lta bur mtshungs par grub pa'i phyir tha mi dad par de nyid de dag gi spyi yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they exist without difference, then all of them are established as being the same in that way, and therefore, without difference, that is their universal.

original: tha dad pa gcig ni yod kyang de dag gi rang bzhin gang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa gcig ni yod kyang de dag gi rang bzhin gang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Even if there is one difference, since their natures are not the same, how could it be the nature of a universal?

original: gal te lta mi dad na tha mi dad pa yod pas de las tha dad pa med par thal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te lta mi dad na tha mi dad pa yod pas de las tha dad pa med par thal ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not different, then since it is not different from that, is it not the case that it follows it is not different from that?

original: bden na 'dir 'dre ba 'gog par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bden na 'dir 'dre ba 'gog par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: If that is true, then here we wish to refute mixing.

original: spyi gzhung gzugs pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi gzhung gzugs pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not for the purpose of establishing a universal.

original: des na tha mi dad pa khyad par rnam pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad na yang spyi'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir 'dre ba med do //
analyzed: des na tha mi dad pa khyad par rnam pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad na yang spyi'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir 'dre ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference without a different aspect, and because even if there is difference, it is not the nature of a universal, there is no mixing.

original: gal te gcig pu du ma dang 'brel pas mtshungs par 'gyur na rigs mi mthun pa dag kyang gnyis la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ram yan lag rnams la yang yan lag can gcig yod pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir gnyis nyid la
analyzed: gal te gcig pu du ma dang 'brel pas mtshungs par 'gyur na rigs mi mthun pa dag kyang gnyis la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ram yan lag rnams la yang yan lag can gcig yod pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir gnyis nyid la
translated: If it were similar because the one is related to the many, then dissimilar types would be similar because they possess two or more, or because the parts would have one whole.

original: sogs pa yang spyi'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa yang spyi'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Two and so on would also be the nature of universals.

original: de bshad pa ni gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is “two and so on.”

original: de dag la yang spyi'i rang bzhin nyid thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang spyi'i rang bzhin nyid thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that they would also be the nature of universals.

original: don gzhan de'i ngo bo ma yin yang 'brel pa'i phyir de dag gi spyir 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: don gzhan de'i ngo bo ma yin yang 'brel pa'i phyir de dag gi spyir 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even though they are not the nature of that other object, because they are related, they would be universals.

original: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni 'brel pa can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni 'brel pa can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that they are not is “the related.”

original: 'brel pa can gzhan tha dad pas kyang gzhan dag mtshungs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gzhan tha dad pas kyang gzhan dag mtshungs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the related are different, they are not similar to others.

original: 'di ltar gcig tha mi dad pa ma yin na 'di dag gi rang bzhin mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig tha mi dad pa ma yin na 'di dag gi rang bzhin mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, if they are not identical, they are not of the same nature.

original: des na rang bzhin mi 'dra ba rnams kyang tha dad @156b gcig dang 'brel pas mtshungs pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin mi 'dra ba rnams kyang tha dad @156b gcig dang 'brel pas mtshungs pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, even those that are not of the same nature are said to be similar because they are related to the one.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽de dang ldan pa dag tu ni 'gyur te zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / de dang ldan pa dag tu ni 'gyur te zhes smos so //
translated: How can that be?🔽He says, “They are said to be endowed with it.”

original: gcig po des de dang ldan pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gcig po des de dang ldan pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: They are said to be endowed with that one.

original: mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not similar.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i 'byung po dag mgul chings kyis de dang ldan pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i 'byung po dag mgul chings kyis de dang ldan pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like those of different species that are bound together by a yoke.

original: dngos po'i de'i ngo bo nyid ni de dang rang bzhin gcig pa'am de dang 'brel pa las 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po'i de'i ngo bo nyid ni de dang rang bzhin gcig pa'am de dang 'brel pa las 'gyur la /
translated: The nature of a thing is either of the same nature as that or related to it.

original: mgul chings kyi tshul du 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'brel lo cog gis ni rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mgul chings kyi tshul du 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'brel lo cog gis ni rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is related to it in the manner of a yoke is not related to it in the manner of its nature.

original: des na ji ltar 'brel pa can gcig pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang 'brel pa can rnams mtshungs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'brel pa can gcig pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang 'brel pa can rnams mtshungs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be that, although one related object is not the nature of another, the related objects are not the same?

original: shes pa tha mi dad pa'i yul yang ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: shes pa tha mi dad pa'i yul yang ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: Nor is it the object of a non-different cognition.

original: 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang zhes 'brel to //
translated: Nor is it by another related object.

original: 'brel ba yang tha dad pa dang 'brel ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba yang tha dad pa dang 'brel ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it by a different relation.

original: des na rang gi ngo bo mi 'dra ba rnams de kho na bzhin rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bo mi 'dra ba rnams de kho na bzhin rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, those that are different in their own natures are just as they are understood.

original: des na 'brel pas ni de dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'brel pas ni de dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by a relation, there is just the possession of that.

original: 'byung po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: 'byung po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: Like an element. This is a similar example.

original: tha mi dad pa'i don nyid de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ni tha dad pa rnams mtshungs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang tha mi dad pa dang 'brel pas yin no zhe na ma yin te re zhig dngos po ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i don nyid de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ni tha dad pa rnams mtshungs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang tha mi dad pa dang 'brel pas yin no zhe na ma yin te re zhig dngos po ni bshad zin to //
translated: If the meaning of non-difference is just the nature of that, then differences are not the same, but rather they are the same by being related to the non-different. This is not so. First, the thing has already been explained.

original: rtogs pa 'di kho na ltar yin te gang gi phyir 'brel pa can de dag gis bdag nyid kho na sre zhing spyi rtogs par snang gi / ji ltar 'byung po dag bzhin du 'brel pa can gcig dang / 'brel pa can dag go zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di kho na ltar yin te gang gi phyir 'brel pa can de dag gis bdag nyid kho na sre zhing spyi rtogs par snang gi / ji ltar 'byung po dag bzhin du 'brel pa can gcig dang / 'brel pa can dag go zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: just as the spirits are, not as one particular and the particulars.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar khyad par gcig ba lang ngo zhes bya bar snang ba de bzhin du gzhan yang yin pa'i phyir gcig snang ba gang yin pa de nyid gzhan snang ba yin pa des na 'dres par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar khyad par gcig ba lang ngo zhes bya bar snang ba de bzhin du gzhan yang yin pa'i phyir gcig snang ba gang yin pa de nyid gzhan snang ba yin pa des na 'dres par brjod do //
translated: In this way, just as one particular appears as “cow,” so do the others. Therefore, the appearance of one is the appearance of the others. Thus, they are said to be mixed.

original: gzhan du ni 'dres pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'dres pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the meaning of “mixed” would not exist.

original: rang bzhin gcig po des gcig gi bdag nyid myong ba med par ni rang bzhin de nyid kyis gcig la gcig tu 'dzin par byed pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig po des gcig gi bdag nyid myong ba med par ni rang bzhin de nyid kyis gcig la gcig tu 'dzin par byed pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Without the experience of one nature, it is not tenable that that very nature is apprehended in the other.

original: tha dad pa de dag de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel par rtogs pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa de dag de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel par rtogs pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those that are different are not its nature, it follows that it would be understood as related to them.

original: de'i phyir tha mi dad pa dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha mi dad pa dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, they are similar because they are not different and are the same nature.

original: @157a * // 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @157a * // 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not related.

original: gal te 'dir 'phrod pa 'du bas sbrel ba yin la 'byung bo'i mgul chings la sogs pa ltar 'du ba can dag las tha dad par 'dzin pa yang yod pa ma yin pa des na tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba spyi dang khyad par dag don
analyzed: gal te 'dir 'phrod pa 'du bas sbrel ba yin la 'byung bo'i mgul chings la sogs pa ltar 'du ba can dag las tha dad par 'dzin pa yang yod pa ma yin pa des na tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba spyi dang khyad par dag don
translated: If here they are connected by contact, like a necklace of animals, and it is not apprehended as different from the things that are connected, then the general and the specific, which are different and related,

original: gcig la 'gal bas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang tha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig la 'gal bas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang tha dad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: are contradictory in one object. Therefore, it is not their nature, and it is not apprehended as different from them. Thus, it is the apprehension of their nature.

original: tha dad pa ma rtogs kyang gzhan gzhan du rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma rtogs kyang gzhan gzhan du rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if it is not apprehended as different, it is not apprehended as other.

original: 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is mistaken.

original: 'khrul par 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'khrul par 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: It is asserted that it is mistaken.

original: 'on kyang de spyis mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin pa'i phyir don gcig med pa'i phyir don tha dad pa dag la yang tha mi dad par rtogs pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de spyis mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin pa'i phyir don gcig med pa'i phyir don tha dad pa dag la yang tha mi dad par rtogs pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But since the reason for seeing it is the generality, and since there is no single object, it is also correct to understand that there is no difference among the different objects.

original: dogs pa 'di smras pa ni /
analyzed: dogs pa 'di smras pa ni /
translated: This doubt is expressed in the following:

original: gal te de ni de mthong ba'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ni de mthong ba'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that this is an error in seeing it,

original: lan btab pa ni spyi de mthong ngo zhes bya ba ga las de dang ldan par rtogs nas spyi'i rang gi tshad mas grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: lan btab pa ni spyi de mthong ngo zhes bya ba ga las de dang ldan par rtogs nas spyi'i rang gi tshad mas grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: The answer is: If it is said that one sees the generality, then from what is it understood that it possesses that? The generality would be established by one’s own valid knowledge.

original: rten tha mi dad par rtogs pa na spyi mthong ngo zhes ga las yin /
analyzed: rten tha mi dad par rtogs pa na spyi mthong ngo zhes ga las yin /
translated: But when the basis is understood to be nondifferent, how can it be said that the generality is seen?

original: 'on te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang rang gi tshang mas grub pa med kyang rten tha mi dad pa rtogs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang rang gi tshang mas grub pa med kyang rten tha mi dad pa rtogs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Or, if it is as explained, although there is no establishment by each one’s own valid knowledge, it is set forth in this way in order to establish the understanding that the basis is nondifferent.

original: gal te 'khrul pas sa bon med pa can //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pas sa bon med pa can //
translated: If it is said that the error is without a seed,

original: zhes bya bas dogs pa de bsu nas 'bras bu de zhes bya bas lan 'debs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas dogs pa de bsu nas 'bras bu de zhes bya bas lan 'debs so //
translated: Thus, having anticipated this qualm, he responds with “that effect.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te de dang ldan par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tshad mas grub pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te de dang ldan par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tshad mas grub pa ma yin pas na /
translated: ” This is what is being said: because it is not established by valid cognition, since it is not understood to be endowed with that,

original: gal te rtogs pa grub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir nye bar rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa grub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir nye bar rtogs na /
translated: if it is understood for the sake of establishing understanding,

original: de ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: then it will be established in another way,

original: gsal ba dag nyid la de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dag nyid la de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood in that way with regard to the very manifest entities.

original: khyed kyis tha mi dad pas tha dad pa med par rtogs pa 'khrul par khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyis tha mi dad pas tha dad pa med par rtogs pa 'khrul par khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: You accept that the non-distinct is understood as distinct, and that is mistaken,

original: des don rnams tha mi dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des don rnams tha mi dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those objects are not non-distinct.

original: 'di ni tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par rtogs pa 'khrul pa yin la de yang gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par rtogs pa 'khrul pa yin la de yang gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is the mistaken understanding of the distinct as non-distinct, and that is not the nature of the manifest,

original: ngo shes pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: because it does not have the nature of recognition. This is how it should be explained.

original: 'di ltar khra po yang ba lang gi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khra po yang ba lang gi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Thus, a cow is the nature of a black cow,

original: ser skya yang yin no //
analyzed: ser skya yang yin no //
translated: and also of a tawny cow.

original: 'on kyang der tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad tsam @157b 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang der tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad tsam @157b 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: But the error is only a conventional one, since they are not different.

original: de'i ba lang nyid kyi rang bzhin ni gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ba lang nyid kyi rang bzhin ni gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: The nature of its cowness is not that of another.

original: 'di nyid 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: This is also shown by the fact that they have the same effect.

original: ji ltar mang po rnams 'bras bu gcig byed pa na so sor de'i rgyu nyid phan tshun tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du ba lang nyid kyang yin no zhes so //
analyzed: ji ltar mang po rnams 'bras bu gcig byed pa na so sor de'i rgyu nyid phan tshun tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du ba lang nyid kyang yin no zhes so //
translated: Just as many things, when they produce the same effect, are individually the cause of that, and are mutually different, so it is with cowness.

original: 'phrod pas 'du ba'i phyir tha dad par ma mthong ba'i gcig pos du ma tha mi dad par rtogs pa yang mthong ba med do //
analyzed: 'phrod pas 'du ba'i phyir tha dad par ma mthong ba'i gcig pos du ma tha mi dad par rtogs pa yang mthong ba med do //
translated: And we do not see that a single thing, which is not seen to be different because of its conformity, is understood to be non-different from many things.

original: ji ltar grangs dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rdzas dag la bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grangs dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rdzas dag la bzhin no //
translated: Just as in the case of substances such as number.

original: 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by another related thing,

original: dper na 'byung po la sogs pa dag la bzhin no zhes bshad pa ni grangs dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //🔽des na de de ltar tha mi dad pa don gyis don rnams kyi bdag nyid dam rtogs pa 'dre ba la ma yin no zhes de ltar de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre ba nyid bkag pa'am mjug sdud pa ni de lta bas na gzhan gyi spyi ni gzhan ma🔽yin no // de ltar zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin rten tha mi dad pa las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //🔽blo la zhen pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽yang na 'di dag gi spyi gzhan yin du zad do //🔽de lta na yang 'dres par gyur pa ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: dper na 'byung po la sogs pa dag la bzhin no zhes bshad pa ni grangs dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o // des na de de ltar tha mi dad pa don gyis don rnams kyi bdag nyid dam rtogs pa 'dre ba la ma yin no zhes de ltar de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dre ba nyid bkag pa'am mjug sdud pa ni de lta bas na gzhan gyi spyi ni gzhan ma yin no // de ltar zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin rten tha mi dad pa las tha dad pa'i phyir ro // blo la zhen pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro // yang na 'di dag gi spyi gzhan yin du zad do // de lta na yang 'dres par gyur pa ni ma grub ste /
translated: For example, it is like the case of spirits and so on.🔽Thus, the non-difference of the universal from the particulars is not tenable.🔽Therefore, the universal is not different from the particulars.🔽The universal is not different from the particulars, because it is not different from the particulars in terms of time, place, and nature.

original: des na gang gi phyir dngos kun zhes bya ba la sogs par rigs pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir dngos kun zhes bya ba la sogs par rigs pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The universal is not different from the particulars, because it is not different from the particulars in terms of time, place, and nature.🔽The universal is not different from the
