analyzed: kha cig med par dgag pa'i yul can du smra ba ni byis pa rang gi lag pas me mdag 'dren pa bzhin du yongs su nyon mongs pas gdung bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhan du rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: Some, who claim that the object of negation is a nonimplicative negation, are like a child who burns his own hand. I have already explained this extensively elsewhere.

original: gzhan yang sngon po'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni sngon po ma yin pa med par dgag pa'i yul can du rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon po'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni sngon po ma yin pa med par dgag pa'i yul can du rtogs pa med do //
translated: Moreover, the cognition that thinks “blue” does not realize the object to be a nonimplicative negation that is not nonblue.

original: rjes su dpag pa las de'i yul can nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las de'i yul can nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the object of inference,

original: gang zhig gang gi rnam pa tsam yin ba de ni de rtogs kyang ma rtogs na de'i ngo bo dpog pa yin te /🔽dper na sgra'i rnam pa tsam gyi mi rtag pa nyid sgras rtogs kyang ma rtogs pa byas pa nyid las rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rnam pa tsam yin ba de ni de rtogs kyang ma rtogs na de'i ngo bo dpog pa yin te / dper na sgra'i rnam pa tsam gyi mi rtag pa nyid sgras rtogs kyang ma rtogs pa byas pa nyid las rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: then when something is merely the aspect of something else, it is realized when that is realized. If it is not realized, then its nature is inferred from that.

original: sngon po sngon po @170a * //
analyzed: sngon po sngon po @170a * //
translated: For example, impermanence is merely the aspect of sound. It is realized when sound is realized. If it is not realized, then it is realized from being produced.

original: ma yin pa med par dgag pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pa med par dgag pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: Blue is not the nature of a nonimplicative negation that is not nonblue.

original: sngon po ma yin bar bkag pa de ni de ldog pa tsam yin na sngon po ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po ma yin bar bkag pa de ni de ldog pa tsam yin na sngon po ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: The negation of non-blue is merely the negation of that, but blue is not a negation.

original: ji ltar sgra nyid 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid sgra'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa de bzhin du sngon po ni ldog pa tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgra nyid 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid sgra'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa de bzhin du sngon po ni ldog pa tsam ma yin no //
translated: Just as impermanence, because it is the destruction of sound, is the intrinsic reality of sound, so blue is not merely a negation.

original: de'i ngo bo yin na ni mngon sum yang med par dgag pa dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yin na ni mngon sum yang med par dgag pa dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were its intrinsic reality, then a non-existent would be perceived as an object of perception.

original: des na zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa zla ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid gnod par byas pa yang rnam par rtog pa bzhin du zla ba ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam gyi yul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa zla ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid gnod par byas pa yang rnam par rtog pa bzhin du zla ba ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam gyi yul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of two moons, which is the apprehension of the aspect of the moon, is impaired, and like a conceptual cognition, it has an object that is merely the negation of non-moon.

original: rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i yul can du rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i yul can du rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: If you infer that it has an object that is the negation of conceptual cognition,

original: rig pa 'di'i byed pa ni mngon sum la gzhol bar rtogs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa 'di'i byed pa ni mngon sum la gzhol bar rtogs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: the function of this awareness is understood to be directed toward perception, not otherwise.

original: des na sngon po de lta bur gyur pa ma yin par byed pa gzhan gyis ni med par dgag pa la dmigs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngon po de lta bur gyur pa ma yin par byed pa gzhan gyis ni med par dgag pa la dmigs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to observe an absence that is a nonimplicative negation, which is not a transformation of blue.

original: ci ste ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po la sngon po ma yin pa med pa de bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa la yang med pa des na ngo bo phyir rol dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ldog pa tsam sgro 'dogs par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po la sngon po ma yin pa med pa de bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa la yang med pa des na ngo bo phyir rol dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ldog pa tsam sgro 'dogs par brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that just as there is no nonblue in external things, there is no non-blue in the superimposition, and therefore, since the nature of the superimposition is not the same as that of the external thing, you are saying that the mere negation is superimposed,

original: 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: we have already explained this.

original: sngon po la sngon po ma yin pa med kyi sngon po ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni med pa'i phyir ji ltar ngo bo tsam yin pa de bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa yang yin pa'i phyir 'dir med par dgag pa ga la yod /
analyzed: sngon po la sngon po ma yin pa med kyi sngon po ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni med pa'i phyir ji ltar ngo bo tsam yin pa de bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa yang yin pa'i phyir 'dir med par dgag pa ga la yod /
translated: Since there is no nonblue in blue, but there is no nonexistence of a nonblue thing, how can it be a mere nature? Since it is also a superimposition, how can it be an absence that is a nonimplicative negation?

original: gzhan yang gal te yang brtag pa gzhan med pa de lta na yang gzhan yang med par rnam par rtog pa des rig pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yang brtag pa gzhan med pa de lta na yang gzhan yang med par rnam par rtog pa des rig pa ma yin te //
translated: Moreover, if you say that even though there is no other superimposition, the conception of nonexistence is not a conception of that,

original: dper na de nyid kyi phyi rol ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de nyid kyi phyi rol ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not external.

original: sgro 'dogs kyi dngos po don dam par phyi rol nyid ma yin yang phyi rol ma yin pa zhes ma rig pa'i dngos po la phyi rol ma yin ba yang rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs kyi dngos po don dam par phyi rol nyid ma yin yang phyi rol ma yin pa zhes ma rig pa'i dngos po la phyi rol ma yin ba yang rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Although the object of superimposition is not external in reality, it is not known as non-external in the object of ignorance.

original: des na phyi rol la don gzhan bkag pa yod kyang yod pas rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na phyi rol la don gzhan bkag pa yod kyang yod pas rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, although the external object is negated as a different entity, it is not known as existent.

original: mngon sum gyis kyang rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that even direct perception would be knowledge.

original: 'on kyang de ltar rig pas yul du byas pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar rig pas yul du byas pa las yin no //
translated: However, it is from the object taken as the object by such knowledge.

original: 'di ni phyi rol ma yin pa rig pa bzhin dgag pa'i don yang rig pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi rol ma yin pa rig pa bzhin dgag pa'i don yang rig pa med do //
translated: This is not known as the meaning of negation, like the knowledge of the non-external.

original: sngon po rig pa ni sngon po ma yin pa rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po rig pa ni sngon po ma yin pa rig pa ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of blue is not the knowledge of non-blue.

original: spyi ni spyi'o snyam par rtogs pa med kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par rig pa yod pa yin pas sngon po rig pa ni sngon po ma @170b yin pa rig pa yin pas der ni sgra tsam ma grub par zad do //
analyzed: spyi ni spyi'o snyam par rtogs pa med kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par rig pa yod pa yin pas sngon po rig pa ni sngon po ma @170b yin pa rig pa yin pas der ni sgra tsam ma grub par zad do //
translated: Although there is no cognition of the universal as a universal, there is a cognition that is in accordance with it. Therefore, the cognition of blue is the cognition of what is not blue. In that case, the mere word is not established.

original: de bzhin du sngon po rig pa la ni ldog pa 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po rig pa la ni ldog pa 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: In the same way, there is no cognition of any exclusion in the cognition of blue.

original: des na gzhan sel ba'i yul nyid rtogs pas gnod par smra ba dag byed brag pa la sogs pas brtags pa dang 'dra ba'i rjes su dpag pa tsam dpung gnyen du gyur pa dag gis ji ltar spangs /
analyzed: des na gzhan sel ba'i yul nyid rtogs pas gnod par smra ba dag byed brag pa la sogs pas brtags pa dang 'dra ba'i rjes su dpag pa tsam dpung gnyen du gyur pa dag gis ji ltar spangs /
translated: Therefore, how can the proponents of the object of exclusion be refuted by mere inferences that are similar to the ones imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas and so on, which are their allies?

original: rtogs pa nyid ngo ba shes par brjod pa kho bo cag gis ni de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid ngo ba shes par brjod pa kho bo cag gis ni de bsal ba yin no //
translated: We have refuted that by simply stating that cognition itself is awareness.

original: 'di ltar phyir ldang ba med pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis ji ltar legs par bsal ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyir ldang ba med pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis ji ltar legs par bsal ni gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: In this way, it is only the clear explanation that is without any response that is excellent.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i don sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i don sdud pa'o //
translated: “ Therefore” refers to the summary of the meaning that has been explained.

original: sgra la sogs pa dngos po mthong ba'i yon tan mtha' dag ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ma lus par mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa dngos po mthong ba'i yon tan mtha' dag ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ma lus par mthong ba nyid do //
translated: All the qualities of seeing things such as sound are seen without exception, all the qualities of impermanence and so forth are seen.

original: de dag ngo bo gang yin ba dag ni de nyid rtogs par byed pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo gang yin ba dag ni de nyid rtogs par byed pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The nature of those is realized by the consciousness that realizes suchness.

original: sgra dang sngon po la sogs pa dag gi ngo bo de dag kyang sgra dang sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo can yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang sngon po la sogs pa dag gi ngo bo de dag kyang sgra dang sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo can yin no //
translated: The nature of sound, blue, and so forth is the nature of sound, blue, and so forth.

original: de yang mthong zin pa'i phyir 'dir rig par bya ba gzhan med do //
analyzed: de yang mthong zin pa'i phyir 'dir rig par bya ba gzhan med do //
translated: Since that is already seen, there is no other object of knowledge here.

original: des na rig pa'i don du rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rig pa'i don du rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore conceptual thought does not engage for the sake of knowing.

original: de tsam nyid rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mthong ba kho na bzhin 'jug par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de tsam nyid rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mthong ba kho na bzhin 'jug par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that alone is the object of knowledge, it follows that it would engage just as it is seen.

original: / mthong du zin kyang tha dad pa gcig mthar thug pa rang bzhin gyis tha dad par 'khrul pa srid pas nges par mi byed de /
analyzed: / mthong du zin kyang tha dad pa gcig mthar thug pa rang bzhin gyis tha dad par 'khrul pa srid pas nges par mi byed de /
translated: Even though it is seen, it does not ascertain it because it is possible to mistakenly think that the individual final nature is different.

original: des na dngos por na 'khrul pa nyid bsal bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na dngos por na 'khrul pa nyid bsal bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, if there were an entity, error itself would be eliminated.

original: ngo bo rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But the nature of an entity is not to be realized,

original: rtogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been realized.

original: de lta bas na ma mthong bas gzung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mngon sum zhugs pa'i rten can gyis 'jug pa'i skabs kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma mthong bas gzung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mngon sum zhugs pa'i rten can gyis 'jug pa'i skabs kyi mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus, the phrase “because it is not seen” concludes the section on the operation of perception that is based on the operation of the nonapprehension of an entity.

original: des ni de ltar gcig zhugs pa la 'jug pa gzhan gang yin pa de gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni de ltar gcig zhugs pa la 'jug pa gzhan gang yin pa de gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is established that any other operation of a means of valid knowledge that operates in that way has the exclusion of other as its object.

original: da ni gang zhugs pa la tshad ma gzhan 'jug par 'gyur pa de yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: da ni gang zhugs pa la tshad ma gzhan 'jug par 'gyur pa de yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las kyang zhes smos so //
translated: Now, in order to prove that any other means of valid knowledge that operates in regard to that also has the exclusion of other as its object, he says, “Also, from inference.”

original: 'di la du ba las me rtogs pa na me tsam gyi rang bzhin du rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di la du ba las me rtogs pa na me tsam gyi rang bzhin du rtogs kyi /
translated: In this regard, when fire is cognized from smoke, it is cognized as the nature of mere fire.

original: rtsva las byung ba dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsva las byung ba dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos su ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not cognized as having the properties of arising from grass, impermanence, and so on.
This is the way to understand the meaning of the following lines from the🔽Treatise on the Middle Way:🔽

original: na 'di la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa na snga ma tha dad pa'i don nyid du go bar byed do //
analyzed: na 'di la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa na snga ma tha dad pa'i don nyid du go bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, when another valid cognition operates, it is understood that the previous one had a different object.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa las me'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nges par 'gyur bas rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i chos kun nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa las me'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nges par 'gyur bas rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i chos kun nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the property of fire is ascertained by inference, all properties such as arising from grass are ascertained.

original: phyogs gang la skyon 'dir 'gyur ba de bshad pa ni dngos po 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: phyogs gang la skyon 'dir 'gyur ba de bshad pa ni dngos po 'dzin na'o //
translated: The explanation of the position where this fault arises is “if it apprehends an entity.”

original: rjes su dpag pas dngos po 'dzin na chos gcig nges pas chos thams cad nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas dngos po 'dzin na chos gcig nges pas chos thams cad nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If inference apprehends an entity, then by ascertaining one property, all properties would be ascertained.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gal te du bas me rtogs pa na /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gal te du bas me rtogs pa na /
translated: This is what is being said: If fire is understood from smoke,

original: me myong ba yin na de ni tshe me ji lta bar gyur ba de lta bu nyid du myong ba yin la /
analyzed: me myong ba yin na de ni tshe me ji lta bar gyur ba de lta bu nyid du myong ba yin la /
translated: if fire is experienced, then it is experienced just as it is.

original: de yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin bas de dag kyang 'dir myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin bas de dag kyang 'dir myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it has the nature of impermanence and so on, those are also experienced here.

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin tsam yin pa de ni de myong ba na myong ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin tsam yin pa de ni de myong ba na myong ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say that when one experiences the mere nature of something, one does not experience it.

original: dper na rang bzhin de nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin de nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like that very nature.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa yang me'i rnam pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa des na ji ltar me'i rnam pa myong ba na ma myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa yang me'i rnam pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa des na ji ltar me'i rnam pa myong ba na ma myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Impermanence, etc. are also the nature that is merely the aspect of fire. Therefore, when one experiences the aspect of fire, how could one not experience them?

original: gya gyu dang khong stong la sogs pa ni dbyibs yin la /
analyzed: gya gyu dang khong stong la sogs pa ni dbyibs yin la /
translated: Curved, hollow, etc. are shapes.

original: de yang rdul phra rab du mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir chod pa dang mchod pa'i ngos gnyis bzhin du 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin par 'gyur gyi ;
analyzed: de yang rdul phra rab du mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir chod pa dang mchod pa'i ngos gnyis bzhin du 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin par 'gyur gyi ;
translated: And since they are composed of many subtle atoms, they are grasped and not grasped, like the two sides of an obstruction.

original: de tsam gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de la ni rtogs pa 'di med do //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de la ni rtogs pa 'di med do //
translated: But for that which is merely the nature of that, this understanding does not exist.

original: ji ltar me nyid 'bar ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar me nyid 'bar ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as fire is burning,

original: me nyid kyis ni mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang me 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ni 'di'i khyad par yin gyi me tsam gyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: me nyid kyis ni mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang me 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ni 'di'i khyad par yin gyi me tsam gyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Fire is not impermanent by its very nature, but because fire is destroyed, impermanence is its attribute, not the nature of fire itself.

original: des na me nyid du rig gi mi rtag pa nyid du ma yin pas 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: des na me nyid du rig gi mi rtag pa nyid du ma yin pas 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: Therefore, fire is known, but not impermanence. So what is the contradiction?

original: ji ltar 'gal ba med /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal ba med /
translated: How is there no contradiction?

original: 'di ltar rnam grangs la brten pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin med kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam grangs la brten pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin med kyang /
translated: In this way, although there is no intrinsic nature in terms of the mode of positing a nominal convention,

original: me gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir me mi rtag pa nyid dang bral ba ni rig pa'i yul du 'gyur bar mi nus so //
analyzed: me gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir me mi rtag pa nyid dang bral ba ni rig pa'i yul du 'gyur bar mi nus so //
translated: because that which is fire is itself destroyed, it is not possible for fire to be known as devoid of impermanence.

original: de lta na 'o na me gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la yang me rig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid rig par 'gyur te mngon sum bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na me gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la yang me rig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid rig par 'gyur te mngon sum bzhin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, since that which is fire is itself impermanent, then even in inference, impermanence would be known by the mere knowledge of fire, just as in direct perception.

original: de ltar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te /
translated: That is not possible.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes rnam par rtog @171b pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes rnam par rtog @171b pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Impermanence is impermanence, because it is known by the conceptual thought that thinks, “impermanence.”

original: rnam par rtog pa ni chos tha dad pa las ni brten pa yin pas de logs shing nyid du rig pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni chos tha dad pa las ni brten pa yin pas de logs shing nyid du rig pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: Conceptual thought is based on the differentiation of phenomena, and it is the nature of conceptual thought to know them as separate.

original: de bzhin du mngon sum la ni chos tha dad par mi gsal ba'i phyir de dag ni don ji lta ba bzhin myong gi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum la ni chos tha dad par mi gsal ba'i phyir de dag ni don ji lta ba bzhin myong gi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, in direct perception, because the differentiation of phenomena is not clear, they are experienced just as they are, and not as conceptual thought.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po rig pa'i byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po rig pa'i byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in inference, there is no operation of knowing things,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previously explained errors would occur.

original: dngos po sel bar byed pa la ni nyes pa 'di med do zhes bshad pa ni sel ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po sel bar byed pa la ni nyes pa 'di med do zhes bshad pa ni sel ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, “There is no error in the exclusion of things,” is the response.

original: 'dis ni sgro btags kyi sgo nas byung ba'i me ma yin par sgro btags pa tsam zhig 'dir gsal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni sgro btags kyi sgo nas byung ba'i me ma yin par sgro btags pa tsam zhig 'dir gsal ba yin gyi /
translated: This passage clarifies that the mere superimposition of non-fire due to superimposition is the object of exclusion.

original: rtsva las byung ba ma yin ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsva las byung ba ma yin ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not produced from grass, etc.

original: des na gang la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i go skabs yod pa de la ni tha dad par byed pa las gzhan pa'i byed pa med do //
analyzed: des na gang la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i go skabs yod pa de la ni tha dad par byed pa las gzhan pa'i byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, that which has the opportunity for the operation of another valid cognition, has no operation other than the operation of differentiation.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa bzhin mngon sum yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa bzhin mngon sum yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du mi 'gyur ram /
translated: If, like inference, direct perception also does not have an object that is an exclusion of other,

original: de la yang chos can 'dzin pas zhugs pas na tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang chos can 'dzin pas zhugs pas na tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then, since it is engaged in the apprehension of the subject, there is an opportunity for another valid cognition.

original: de ni med de mngon sum dngos po myong ba'i bdag nyid yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa la phyogs pa nyid du gyur pa na tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med de mngon sum dngos po myong ba'i bdag nyid yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa la phyogs pa nyid du gyur pa na tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because even though direct perception has the nature of the experience of an entity, when it becomes directed toward difference through conceptualization, there is an opportunity for another valid cognition.

original: mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba nyid kyis dngos po 'dzin par byed pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba nyid kyis dngos po 'dzin par byed pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Direct perception is established as the apprehension of an entity by the mere appearance of the entity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum tshad ma gzhan gyis 'jug kyang tha dad pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum tshad ma gzhan gyis 'jug kyang tha dad pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though another perception operates, it is not a subject of a different object.

original: rjes su dpag pa la rtsva la sogs pa las byung bar myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la rtsva la sogs pa las byung bar myong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, in inference, it is like the experience of arising from grass, etc.

original: rtsva las byung ba tsam spangs nas don mtha' dag myong ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva las byung ba tsam spangs nas don mtha' dag myong ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, having abandoned mere arising from grass, it has the nature of experiencing all objects.

original: 'grel pa ni 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'grel pa ni 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ste /
translated: The commentary is “some” and so on.

original: chos can 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: chos can 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is only that when some subject is seen by perception, another valid cognition does not operate.

original: 'dis ni kyang gi don brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni kyang gi don brjod do //
translated: This expresses the meaning of “also.”

original: dngos po 'dzin na zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin na zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of “grasping a thing” is “when also by inference.”

original: 'dis ni chos can la mngon sum gyi bye brag bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni chos can la mngon sum gyi bye brag bstan nas /
translated: This teaches the difference of perception with regard to the subject.

original: don sngar ma rtogs par brjod pa yin te /🔽mngon sum dang 'dra bar nye bar dgod pa mtshungs par bstan @172a * //
analyzed: don sngar ma rtogs par brjod pa yin te / mngon sum dang 'dra bar nye bar dgod pa mtshungs par bstan @172a * //
translated: It expresses what was not previously understood.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught to be similar to perception, it is like a presentation.

original: yang na sgro btags yod par sgrub pa'i phyir sa bon btab pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sgro btags yod par sgrub pa'i phyir sa bon btab pa'o //
translated: or else, in order to establish the existence of the superimposition, the seed is planted.

original: chos gcig nges par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba bshad pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos gcig nges par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba bshad pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, because of the ascertainment of one thing, explains the phrase, at that time.

original: mdor bstan pa'i don gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i don gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the meaning of the brief presentation,

original: gtan tshigs de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, because of the non-difference from that reason.

original: de nges na zhes bya ba ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nges na zhes bya ba ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase, if that is ascertained, establishes the text.

original: tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni skabs su babs pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni skabs su babs pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The phrase, no other valid cognition is operative, is related to the present context.

original: gzhan sel ba la nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba la nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, there is no fault in the exclusion of other, explains the phrase, when . . .

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ma 'dres pa dag kyang rtog pa'i mthus dngos po gzhan dang 'dres pa zlog par byed pa nyid gzhan sel pa'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ma 'dres pa dag kyang rtog pa'i mthus dngos po gzhan dang 'dres pa zlog par byed pa nyid gzhan sel pa'i yul can nyid do //
translated: The objects of the exclusion of other are the unmixed natures of things, which, by the power of thought, are made to exclude other things and are the objects of the exclusion of other.

original: thams cad du rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang 'dre ba sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar der 'thad pa'i don can yin zhes bsams nas gzhan dag rtsod par byed pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad du rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang 'dre ba sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar der 'thad pa'i don can yin zhes bsams nas gzhan dag rtsod par byed pa ni /
translated: Since it is not the case that everywhere the inference is preceded by a mixing with another, how can it be that it has a meaning that is established?

original: ma rtogs pa nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the doubt.

original: glo bur ba las zhes bya ba ni bab col du 'am /
analyzed: glo bur ba las zhes bya ba ni bab col du 'am /
translated: “From an adventitious cause” means from a cause that is accidental,

original: yang na khyab pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rgyu mtshan med par 'brel pa goms pa ni du ba mthong ma thag kho nar rtogs kyi me ma yin du sgro 'dogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na khyab pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rgyu mtshan med par 'brel pa goms pa ni du ba mthong ma thag kho nar rtogs kyi me ma yin du sgro 'dogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: or else, without a reason for following a pervasion, the cause of the familiarity with the relation is that as soon as one sees smoke, one understands it, but it is not preceded by the superimposition that it is not fire.

original: de spang ba'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In order to eliminate that” is in order to eliminate that doubt.

original: 'di skad brjod de rtogs pa'i yul yang ma rtogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa yod pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod de rtogs pa'i yul yang ma rtogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa yod pas byas pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said: The object of understanding is also made by the existence of superimposition that is not understanding.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang rtogs pa'i yul te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang rtogs pa'i yul te /
translated: The predicate of the probandum is also the object of understanding,

original: chos can dang dbye ba med pas chos can bzung pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can dang dbye ba med pas chos can bzung pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the apprehension of the subject, since it is not different from the subject.

original: 'on te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid yin pas na tshul 'dis yul du byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid yin pas na tshul 'dis yul du byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the probandum is different from the effect reason, then this mode does not take it as its object.

original: de la yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang bshad pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: 'on te tha dad na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is different, then.

original: chos can las rtogs pa'i yul tha dad par khas len na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang ma 'brel pa ni chos can de la rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can las rtogs pa'i yul tha dad par khas len na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang ma 'brel pa ni chos can de la rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asserts that the object of understanding is different from the subject, then that which is not related to the subject of the probandum would not be understood in that subject.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la chos can las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos tha dad pas rtogs na de rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na yang de gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la chos can las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos tha dad pas rtogs na de rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na yang de gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: If the probandum is different from the subject in the case of an effect reason, then it is not understood. But even if it is not understood, it must be related to the subject of the probandum.

original: de lta @172b ma yin na de de'i chos can nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de de ltar rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta @172b ma yin na de de'i chos can nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de de ltar rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If it were not so, then it would not be the subject of that. Therefore it is not understood in that way.

original: 'brel pa yang me dang sa phyogs rten dang brten pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang me dang sa phyogs rten dang brten pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid do //
translated: The relation is that the fire and the place are the basis and the dependent, and they are the cause and effect.

original: de ltar yin dang chos can me'i rgyu nyid du bzung ba na ma bzung ba srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang chos can me'i rgyu nyid du bzung ba na ma bzung ba srid pa ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then when the place is apprehended as the cause of fire, it is not possible that it is not apprehended.

original: gal te 'dir me'i rgyu nyid du rtogs pa'i yul du gyur kyang ma rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'dir me'i rgyu nyid du rtogs pa'i yul du gyur kyang ma rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: If it is the object of the cognition of the place as the cause of fire, but it is not cognized,

original: me ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: me ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then fire is not cognized.

original: bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true,

original: de rtogs na me mi rtogs mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rtogs na me mi rtogs mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: but when it is cognized, it is impossible that fire is not cognized.

original: de la mi rtogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa rtogs par byed pa ni me la yang rtogs par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa rtogs par byed pa ni me la yang rtogs par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that removes the superimposition of non-cognition of the place is the cognition of fire itself.

original: de bshad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is for that reason.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa ni phyin ci log pas yin no zhes ngag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las phyin ci log las zhes de'i rang bzhin ngo bo mi nges pa'i rgyur nye bar bkod pa nye ba dang 'brel pa yin pas de nyid
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa ni phyin ci log pas yin no zhes ngag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las phyin ci log las zhes de'i rang bzhin ngo bo mi nges pa'i rgyur nye bar bkod pa nye ba dang 'brel pa yin pas de nyid
translated: The uncertainty of its nature is due to error. In the complete statement, from error, the cause of the uncertainty of the nature of that is stated. It is related to the proximate. Therefore, that is

original: rgyu yin ba la ltos nas rang nyid ga las she na zhes gsal bar byas nas phyin ci log las zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yin ba la ltos nas rang nyid ga las she na zhes gsal bar byas nas phyin ci log las zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is clear that it is saying from a mistake.

original: 'dir sgro 'dogs yod par rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam ma rtogs kyang rig par brtag par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sgro 'dogs yod par rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam ma rtogs kyang rig par brtag par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, is it not the case that the existence of reification is not understood? And even if it is not understood, it is not appropriate to consider it as knowledge.

original: ji skad du gang gis yod kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ba rtogs pa 'di dag skye ba 'am 'gag pa ni ma rig pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du gang gis yod kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ba rtogs pa 'di dag skye ba 'am 'gag pa ni ma rig pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said, These understandings that do not understand even when existent are not ignorance, whether arising or ceasing.

original: sgro 'dogs pa yang rtogs pa nyid yin no zhes dogs pa la gtan tshigs gzhan bshad pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa yang rtogs pa nyid yin no zhes dogs pa la gtan tshigs gzhan bshad pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Fearing that reification is also understanding, another reason is explained: That is also...

original: bsam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the thought:

original: dbang po dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ltar dngos po'i dbang nyid kyis glo bur du du ba las me rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te rtags dang rtags can gyi rtogs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ltar dngos po'i dbang nyid kyis glo bur du du ba las me rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te rtags dang rtags can gyi rtogs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like the eye consciousness and so on from the sense faculties, it is not the case that the understanding of fire from smoke is suddenly by the power of things themselves, because it is not the understanding of the evidence and the evidence-bearer.

original: des me don du gnyer ba de rtogs par 'dod pa la de rtogs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des me don du gnyer ba de rtogs par 'dod pa la de rtogs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: The person who desires to know fire knows that which is to be known.

original: des na 'brel pa goms pa gang yin pa de yang rtags kyi de dang 'brel ba 'dzin pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dran pa la ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa goms pa gang yin pa de yang rtags kyi de dang 'brel ba 'dzin pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dran pa la ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the acquaintance with the relation is also dependent on the memory of the concomitance and the counter-pervasion, which are the signs of the relation.

original: des na de la sgro 'dogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de la sgro 'dogs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, there is no superimposition on that.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par 'jug pa ni 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir me don du gnyer ba de la rjes su dpag pa @173a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par 'jug pa ni 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir me don du gnyer ba de la rjes su dpag pa @173a * //
translated: Thus, the engagement in inference is preceded by desire, because the person who desires fire engages in inference.

original: 'jug par byed pa na tshad ma gzhan ma zhugs pa tshol te /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa na tshad ma gzhan ma zhugs pa tshol te /
translated: When he engages in inference, he seeks another valid cognition that has not yet engaged.

original: de lta ma yin na mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs na rjes su dpag pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs na rjes su dpag pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if it were understood by perception itself, inference would be pointless.

original: des na chos can 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis ma rtogs par nges par byed do //
analyzed: des na chos can 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis ma rtogs par nges par byed do //
translated: Therefore, he ascertains that it is not understood by the perception that apprehends the subject.

original: gang du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i me ma dmigs pa der ni mes dben par nges par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i me ma dmigs pa der ni mes dben par nges par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Where there is no perception of fire, which is the characteristic of the object of perception, there is only the certainty of the absence of fire.

original: des na phyogs de blo me dang ldan par 'dzin pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nges pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: des na phyogs de blo me dang ldan par 'dzin pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nges pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the statement “the mind is free from the apprehension of fire” shows the cause of the certainty of non-perception.

original: des na phyogs mes stong par shes pa nyid me ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs mes stong par shes pa nyid me ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyin ci log yin no //
translated: Thus, the mere knowledge that the place is empty of fire is the opposite of the superimposition that it is not fire.

original: de lta na 'o na der me rjes su dpog pa na dam bcas pa'i don mngon sum dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na der me rjes su dpog pa na dam bcas pa'i don mngon sum dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then when fire is inferred there, the meaning of the thesis would contradict perception.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: gang du mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba der rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba der rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inferred where there is no characteristic of non-perception.

original: de ni de la me med par sgro 'dogs pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni de la me med par sgro 'dogs pa med do zhe na /
translated: It is said that there is no superimposition of the absence of fire there.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: chos can ma grub par thal ba'i phyir chos can gcig tu brjod par 'dod par mngon sum gyi byed pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can ma grub par thal ba'i phyir chos can gcig tu brjod par 'dod par mngon sum gyi byed pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the subject is not established, and because the desire to state the subject as one is manifest without distinction in the function of perception.

original: des na de ltar de re zhig sgro 'dogs pa yod par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar de re zhig sgro 'dogs pa yod par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that this doubt exists in the first place, as a superimposition.

original: 'di la ni the tshom yang gdon mi za bar yod pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'di la ni the tshom yang gdon mi za bar yod pa yin no ;
translated: But in this case, doubt must exist, without a doubt.

original: ; tshad ma med pa la 'bad rtsol med pas the tshom med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur yang gang zhig rtogs par 'dod pas gang dpyod pa la brtson pa de ni der tshad ma zhugs pa'i sngon rol du the tshom du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ; tshad ma med pa la 'bad rtsol med pas the tshom med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur yang gang zhig rtogs par 'dod pas gang dpyod pa la brtson pa de ni der tshad ma zhugs pa'i sngon rol du the tshom du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: When one who is striving to investigate something in order to understand it, how can he not be in doubt before the valid cognition has occurred?

original: de bshad pa ni /🔽de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs par dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni / de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs par dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is:🔽He is not in doubt about the form of that.

original: de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs par log par rtog pa dang / me yod dam med snyam pa'i the tshom ste de dang bral ba de rtogs par bya ba la rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs par log par rtog pa dang / me yod dam med snyam pa'i the tshom ste de dang bral ba de rtogs par bya ba la rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bar mi byed do //
translated: He is not in doubt about the form of that, i.e., he is not in doubt about the existence or nonexistence of fire.

original: the tshom dang phyin ci log bzhin du ma rtogs pas kyang rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom dang phyin ci log bzhin du ma rtogs pas kyang rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But is one not a follower of reasoning because of non-understanding, just as one is not because of doubt or error? No, one is not.

original: de'i don du rtags kyis rtogs pa la gnas pa'i don la the tshom yod par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don du rtags kyis rtogs pa la gnas pa'i don la the tshom yod par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is certain that doubt exists with regard to the meaning that is ascertained by means of a reason.

original: yang na phyi ma de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid phyin ci log gi shes pa yod pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mngon par zhen pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yang na phyi ma de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid phyin ci log gi shes pa yod pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mngon par zhen pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Or else, what is the point of the assertion that the latter is a mistaken consciousness that is the subject of the elimination of that?

original: dngul la sogs @173b pa'i yul can du sgro 'dogs kyi shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin pas de las bzlog pa'i yul can gyi shes pa snga ma yod pa la ltos par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngul la sogs @173b pa'i yul can du sgro 'dogs kyi shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin pas de las bzlog pa'i yul can gyi shes pa snga ma yod pa la ltos par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a consciousness that superimposes an object such as silver is also a conceptual consciousness, it is the subject of the elimination of that. Therefore it follows that it is a consciousness that is the opposite of that and it must rely on a prior consciousness.

original: des na de yang rnam pa de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan la ltos nas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de yang rnam pa de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan la ltos nas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is also that type of consciousness, it follows that there is an infinite regress in reliance on that which is other than it.

original: des na sgro 'dogs pa med kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sgro 'dogs pa med kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though there is no superimposition, it is posited as the subject of the elimination of other.

original: gal te yang tshul gsum tshol ba nyid rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin pa de lta na yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes ston pa'i phyir rtags kyi rjes su 'brang pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: gal te yang tshul gsum tshol ba nyid rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin pa de lta na yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes ston pa'i phyir rtags kyi rjes su 'brang pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid yin par rtogs so //
translated: Even if the search for the three modes is the process of following a logical reason, still, in order to show that it is the pervasion, the process of following a logical reason is understood to be the property of the subject.

original: ma rtogs pa nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor ma gyur pa'i don de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ston to //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor ma gyur pa'i don de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ston to //
translated: The meaning of the verse that was not understood is summarized in the verse beginning with for that reason, and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di zhes gtan tshigs sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di zhes gtan tshigs sdud pa'o //
translated: The word thus refers to the way the reason is summarized.

original: rtags sel ba'i yul can yin par rab tu bsgrags zhes bya bas ni /🔽de yang phyogs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa skabs kyi don gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtags sel ba'i yul can yin par rab tu bsgrags zhes bya bas ni / de yang phyogs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa skabs kyi don gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is well known that the subject of the elimination of the reason is the property of the subject.🔽 This is the meaning of the phrase that property of the subject and so on.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdud pa ni gzhan du chos can can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdud pa ni gzhan du chos can can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary beginning with in this way is the subject.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa ni sgro 'dogs med pa la mi srid do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa ni sgro 'dogs med pa la mi srid do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that inference is impossible with respect to what is non-erroneous.

original: da ni sgro 'dogs med kyang sel ba'i yul can du bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni sgro 'dogs med kyang sel ba'i yul can du bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to establish that even without error, it has an object of exclusion, it is said:

original: 'ga' zhig la shes pa gang zhig rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la shes pa gang zhig rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “A cognition of something is conceptual.

original: gang 'ga' zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig la zhe na /
translated: With respect to what something?

original: gzhan gyi cha sgro ma btags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi cha sgro ma btags pa'o //
translated: With respect to what is not superimposed as something else.

original: gang du phyin ci log gi char sgro ma btags pa la'o //
analyzed: gang du phyin ci log gi char sgro ma btags pa la'o //
translated: Where is there no superimposition of an erroneous aspect?

original: des na 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this is what is being said:

original: dngos po gzhan sgro ma btags pa dngos po gzhan dang tha mi dad par ma byas pa'i yul can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan sgro ma btags pa dngos po gzhan dang tha mi dad par ma byas pa'i yul can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can yin no //
translated: That cognition which is conceptual and has an object that is not made different from something else, that is, not made different from something else without superimposing another thing, has an object of exclusion that is just that.

original: don de las gzhan gang yin pa de gal te yang sgro 'dogs kyi shes pas byas na don de dang tha mi dad par gyur pa ma yin par gyur pa de lta na yang shes pa de ni de sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: don de las gzhan gang yin pa de gal te yang sgro 'dogs kyi shes pas byas na don de dang tha mi dad par gyur pa ma yin par gyur pa de lta na yang shes pa de ni de sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: If that object is not different from that which is created by the cognition of superimposition, then even though it is not different from that object, that cognition is still the subject that eliminates that.

original: gang gi sgra ni 'di nyid du 'brel to //
analyzed: gang gi sgra ni 'di nyid du 'brel to //
translated: The word “this” is connected to that.

original: ci 'di rnam pa de lta ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid 'ga' zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di rnam pa de lta ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid 'ga' zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it an inference that has that aspect?

original: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /🔽spyi'i don can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni / spyi'i don can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: No, it is not.🔽The word “general” is stated.

original: spyi'i yul can no //🔽rjes @174a * //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can no // rjes @174a * //
translated: It has a general object.

original: su dpag pa yang spyi'i yul can yin bas /
analyzed: su dpag pa yang spyi'i yul can yin bas /
translated: Inference also has a general object.

original: mthong ba zhes khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes khyad par du byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished by the word “seeing.”

original: mthong ba'i yul gyi spyi gang yin pa de'i yul can no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul gyi spyi gang yin pa de'i yul can no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It has as its object the universal of the object of seeing.

original: sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba la gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs par rtogs pa'i shes pa skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba la gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs par rtogs pa'i shes pa skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: When a cognition that understands blue, etc. arises from directly seeing blue, etc.,

original: de rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa na sngon po la sogs pa spyir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa na sngon po la sogs pa spyir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When it is taken as an object by conceptual consciousness, it becomes a universal such as “blueness.”

original: des na 'dir rnam par rtog pa med pas yul du byas pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis sgro 'dogs mi srid kyang 'di sngon po'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir rnam par rtog pa med pas yul du byas pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis sgro 'dogs mi srid kyang 'di sngon po'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no conceptualization here, it is impossible for there to be superimposition by way of the aspect that is taken as an object. However, the cognition that engages in the thought “This is blue” is not a universal.

original: de dang tha mi dad par ma gyur pas de la sel ba'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes brjod pa yin no /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par ma gyur pas de la sel ba'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes brjod pa yin no /
translated: Since it is not nondistinct from that, it is said to have the effect of exclusion.

original: 'di de dang tha mi dad par gyur pa ma yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'di de dang tha mi dad par gyur pa ma yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though it is not nondistinct from that,

original: 'di de sel ba'i 'bras bu can las nyams pa ma yin no //🔽gal te de yod kyang zlog pa med pa kho nar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di de'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di de sel ba'i 'bras bu can las nyams pa ma yin no // gal te de yod kyang zlog pa med pa kho nar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di de'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not the case that it is not the effect of exclusion.🔽If, even though it exists, it were not reversed, then at that time it would not be the effect of that.

original: gzhan nyid kyis bzlog zin pas med pa na ni 'di de zlog par byed pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis bzlog zin pas med pa na ni 'di de zlog par byed pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were nonexistent due to being reversed by difference, then it would not be the case that it does not reverse that.

original: grang ba med me la grang ba zlog pa'i nus pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grang ba med me la grang ba zlog pa'i nus pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, if it were, then the absence of heat would not be able to negate heat.🔽In the case of the cognition of something, the cognition of that thing, once it has been cognized, is not blocked, even though it has the same effect as the original cognition.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i phyogs la rtogs zin pa'i don la rtogs par byed pa'i 'bras bu can nyid mi ldog pa bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi 'og rol du 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa yang sgro 'dogs de bsal ba la🔽'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i phyogs la rtogs zin pa'i don la rtogs par byed pa'i 'bras bu can nyid mi ldog pa bzhin du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi 'og rol du 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa yang sgro 'dogs de bsal ba la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the conceptual cognition that occurs after perception and inference is also engaged in eliminating superimpositions.

original: sgro 'dogs kyi shes pa dang yid kyi rgyal srid la sogs pa'i rtogs pa sgro 'dogs zhugs pa la 'jug pa yang de bzhin du der nus pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs kyi shes pa dang yid kyi rgyal srid la sogs pa'i rtogs pa sgro 'dogs zhugs pa la 'jug pa yang de bzhin du der nus pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The conceptual cognition that engages in the superimposition of a universal, such as “pot,” is also engaged in eliminating the superimposition of a universal.

original: 'di dag ji srid 'byung gi bar du de dang rgyu mthun pa de las bzlog pa'i shes pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di dag ji srid 'byung gi bar du de dang rgyu mthun pa de las bzlog pa'i shes pa mi 'jug go //
translated: As long as these superimpositions occur, the cognition that is the opposite of that, which is compatible with it, does not occur.

original: de bzhin du dngul du shes pa yod pa'i skabs na nya phyis kyi shes pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngul du shes pa yod pa'i skabs na nya phyis kyi shes pa mi 'jug go //
translated: In the same way, as long as there is the cognition of silver, the cognition of nacre does not occur.

original: 'di yang tshig gsum gyis bzlog par bya ba rjes su brjod pa dang / de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can zhes ngag gcig tu lan brjod do //
analyzed: 'di yang tshig gsum gyis bzlog par bya ba rjes su brjod pa dang / de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can zhes ngag gcig tu lan brjod do //
translated: This is also a reply in a single statement, which is a repetition of the object of negation in three words, and the object of the activity of the mere eliminator.

original: 'grel par ni gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba bzlog par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de nyid 'dri bar bkod de brjod do //
analyzed: 'grel par ni gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba bzlog par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de nyid 'dri bar bkod de brjod do //
translated: In the commentary, in order to show that form, etc. are the object of negation, he sets forth the question and answers it.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i mjug thogs su zhes bya bas ni mthong ba zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i mjug thogs su zhes bya bas ni mthong ba zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: By immediately after seeing form, etc., he explains seeing.

original: @174b rtags can ma yin pa'i nges pa'i shes pa zhes bya bas ni spyi'i don can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @174b rtags can ma yin pa'i nges pa'i shes pa zhes bya bas ni spyi'i don can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By non-mistaken cognition, he explains having a general object.

original: des na rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin zhes brjod pa ni de zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin zhes brjod pa ni de zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, he says, How can it be the object of an eliminator when there is no object of elimination?

original: de la lan ni sgro ma btags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la lan ni sgro ma btags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to that is without superimposition.

original: sgro btags med pa'i yul la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags med pa'i yul la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists in a non-superimposed object.

original: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid du ni rtogs pa kho na bas 'brel par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid du ni rtogs pa kho na bas 'brel par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not related to the object of exclusion, because it is understood only as the apprehender.

original: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid du gnas pa na gang zhig sgro gdags par 'os pa las sgro ma btags pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid du gnas pa na gang zhig sgro gdags par 'os pa las sgro ma btags pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
translated: When it is present as the apprehender of the object of exclusion, it is the object of exclusion, because it does not superimpose anything that should be superimposed.

original: des na de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can zhes bya ba ma bshad pa kho nar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can gyi gtan tshigs nyid bshad do //
analyzed: des na de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can zhes bya ba ma bshad pa kho nar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can gyi gtan tshigs nyid bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the reason is the object of exclusion, without explaining that it has the domain of mere exclusion.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gal te sgro 'dogs yod bzhin du 'gyur na ni rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du mi 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgro 'dogs yod bzhin du 'gyur na ni rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du mi 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If it were to exist while superimposition exists, it would not be the apprehender of the object of exclusion.

original: med pa nyid la 'gyur ba ma yin ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: med pa nyid la 'gyur ba ma yin ba'i phyir na /
translated: But because it is not the case that it does not exist,

original: de bzlog pa'i 'bras bu can du shin tu gsal bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i 'bras bu can du shin tu gsal bar rtogs so //
translated: it is clearly understood to have the result of countering that.

original: de med pa la nges par 'jug pa ni de dang 'gal bar rtogs pa'i phyir de zlog par nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa la nges par 'jug pa ni de dang 'gal bar rtogs pa'i phyir de zlog par nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it definitely engages in the absence of that, it is understood to be contradictory with that, and because it definitely makes one turn away from that.

original: ji ltar na 'di sgro ma btags pa'i yul la yod par rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di sgro ma btags pa'i yul la yod par rtogs she na /
translated: How is it that one realizes the existence of the object that is not reified?

original: gang la zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang la zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “in regard to which.”

original: dngos po'i chos gang la sgro 'dogs pa yod pa de la nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos gang la sgro 'dogs pa yod pa de la nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In regard to which thing there is reification, there is no ascertainment.

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is no ascertainment?

original: nges pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nges pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “ascertainment and reification,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid //
analyzed: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid //
translated: ascertainment and reification

original: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: are by nature mutually exclusive.

original: sgro 'dogs kyis nges pa skye ba'i gags byed la /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs kyis nges pa skye ba'i gags byed la /
translated: Reification prevents the arising of ascertainment,

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nges pas ni sgro 'dogs zlog par byed pa des na /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nges pas ni sgro 'dogs zlog par byed pa des na /
translated: and ascertainment arising from a powerful cause prevents reification.

original: 'di nyid gnod bya gnod byed kyi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid gnod bya gnod byed kyi ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are by nature mutually exclusive.

original: gal te skad cig ma nyid kyis rnam par shes pa ldog par grub pa ni /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma nyid kyis rnam par shes pa ldog par grub pa ni /
translated: If it is established that consciousness ceases due to momentariness,

original: gang las sgro 'dogs dang nges pa'i shes pa ngag gnon bya gnon byed kyi ngo bor gyur pa gzhan gyis bzlog par byar ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gang las sgro 'dogs dang nges pa'i shes pa ngag gnon bya gnon byed kyi ngo bor gyur pa gzhan gyis bzlog par byar ci yod ce na /
translated: What is there to be refuted by another, since the ascertainment of superimposition and the ascertainment of the absence of superimposition are mutually exclusive?

original: bshad pa rang gi yul la bden par lhag par zhen pas na skad cig ma nyid yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad rgyun gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa rang gi yul la bden par lhag par zhen pas na skad cig ma nyid yin yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad rgyun gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Reply: Because of the strong adherence to true existence with regard to its object, even though it is momentary, the continuum of all conceptual consciousnesses endures.

original: sems g-yengs pas 'gags su zin kyang @175a * //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pas 'gags su zin kyang @175a * //
translated: Even though it is interrupted by the distraction of the mind,

original: de bzhin du bden par nges pas 'bad rtsol yod na de kho na bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bden par nges pas 'bad rtsol yod na de kho na bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: if there is exertion in the ascertainment of true existence, it engages in that very object again.

original: nya phyis la dngul lo snyam du rtogs pa na gnod par byed pa skyes pa'i sngon rol du don gzhan la chags pas bar du rnam par mi rtogs kyang yang mngon du phyogs pa na de kho na ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul lo snyam du rtogs pa na gnod par byed pa skyes pa'i sngon rol du don gzhan la chags pas bar du rnam par mi rtogs kyang yang mngon du phyogs pa na de kho na ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one thinks that a mother-of-pearl shell is silver, even though one does not conceive anything else in between because of attachment to another object, when it is directly perceived, one realizes that it is not silver.

original: des na rnam par shes pa gang zhig de'i yul rtogs nas mi bden par rtogs par nus pa de kho na de zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa gang zhig de'i yul rtogs nas mi bden par rtogs par nus pa de kho na de zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, only that consciousness which, having cognized its object, is able to cognize it as unreal, is the one which stops it.

original: des na 'di ni phyis yin gyi dngul ni ma yin no zhes dngul mi bden pa nyid du rtogs pa na dngul du rtogs pa ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di ni phyis yin gyi dngul ni ma yin no zhes dngul mi bden pa nyid du rtogs pa na dngul du rtogs pa ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, when one cognizes the silver as unreal, the cognition of silver is stopped, but not the cognition of the mother-of-pearl, because one thinks: “This is the mother-of-pearl, not the silver.”

original: nya phyis rtogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nya phyis rtogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the mere cognition of the mother-of-pearl which stops the cognition of silver,

original: don gzhan la rtogs pa na der phyogs pa med kyang phyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan la rtogs pa na der phyogs pa med kyang phyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one cognizes an object, even though one is not directed to it, the cognition of it arises later.

original: 'di ni nya phyis yin gyi dngul ni ma yin par rtogs na ni de ltar 'gyur mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ni nya phyis yin gyi dngul ni ma yin par rtogs na ni de ltar 'gyur mi srid do //
translated: If one cognizes: “This is the mother-of-pearl, not the silver,” it is impossible that it should be so.

original: de'i yul nyid du nya phyis rtogs pa'i phyir rtogs pa de ldog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yul nyid du nya phyis rtogs pa'i phyir rtogs pa de ldog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because the mother-of-pearl is cognized as its object, that cognition stops it.

original: ma skyes pas ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pas ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not stopped by the non-arising of the cognition of silver.

original: 'di ni bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'di ni bshad zin to /
translated: This has been explained.

original: ma byung ba yang bden pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin na slar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba yang bden pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin na slar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the non-arisen is also conceived as real, it arises again.

original: yang na 'dir dngul yod par gyur to zhes yod pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'dir dngul yod par gyur to zhes yod pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it would follow, absurdly, that here there would be silver because there is silver.

original: des na gang zhig gang gi yul dpyod par nus pa nyid de zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang gi yul dpyod par nus pa nyid de zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is able to analyze the object of that is what stops the superimposition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa nyid sgro 'dogs zlog par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa nyid sgro 'dogs zlog par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is conceptual cognition that stops the superimposition.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonconceptual cognition.

original: der ni de'i rgyu mtshan yod pa dang med pa dag las 'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pa yod pa dang med pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: der ni de'i rgyu mtshan yod pa dang med pa dag las 'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pa yod pa dang med pa tsam du zad do //
translated: In that case, the mere presence or absence of a cognition that is the effect of the presence or absence of its cause is all that there is.

original: sgro 'dogs kyi shes pa yang ji srid rang gi yul la bden par mngon par 'du byed pa de srid zlog pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i gegs byed do //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs kyi shes pa yang ji srid rang gi yul la bden par mngon par 'du byed pa de srid zlog pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i gegs byed do //
translated: And as long as a superimposing cognition is engaged in the superimposition of true existence with regard to its object, it prevents the arising of a cognition that stops the superimposition.

original: 'grel pa ni dngos po thams cad las zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni dngos po thams cad las zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary reads “with regard to all things.”

original: nya phyis la sgro 'dogs pa yod pa'i phyir nya phyis nyid du nges pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nya phyis la sgro 'dogs pa yod pa'i phyir nya phyis nyid du nges pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because there is superimposition with regard to a mother-of-pearl shell, there is no ascertainment of the mother-of-pearl shell itself.

original: sgro 'dogs pa med na ni nges par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gang la rtogs pa po'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med na ni nges par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gang la rtogs pa po'i zhes bya'o //
translated: If there is no superimposition, there is ascertainment. This is explained in the line “With respect to that, the one who understands…”

original: des ni de ltar sngar bstan kyi gnas skabs na sgro 'dogs yod na rnam par rtog pa zlog par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des ni de ltar sngar bstan kyi gnas skabs na sgro 'dogs yod na rnam par rtog pa zlog par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, in the context presented above, it is not that the presence of superimposition prevents the reversal of conceptualization.

original: 'on kyang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i @175b dngos po las yin no zhes gzhung btsugs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i @175b dngos po las yin no zhes gzhung btsugs te /
translated: Rather, it is the case that the object to be invalidated and the invalidator are related. This is the point being made in the text.

original: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid bshad pa ni sgro 'dogs dben pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid bshad pa ni sgro 'dogs dben pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the subject that eliminates superimposition is “in the absence of superimposition.”

original: 'di ni zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de'i yul bshad pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de'i yul bshad pa ni //
translated: The explanation of the object of the expression “this” is “with respect to that.”

original: des pa zhes bya ba yin no //🔽ji skad bsgrub pa'i don gyi gtan tshigs ni //
analyzed: des pa zhes bya ba yin no // ji skad bsgrub pa'i don gyi gtan tshigs ni //
translated: The explanation of “that” is “the object.”

original: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid //🔽ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The reason that proves the point is “ascertainment and superimposition are mutually exclusive.”

original: 'grel pa ni des zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni des zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary is “by that.”

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin to /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin to /
translated: It is as explained above.

original: 'di ba lang ma yin pa ma yin no snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dag ni sre ba'i rtogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis gzhan sel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ba lang ma yin pa ma yin no snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dag ni sre ba'i rtogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis gzhan sel ba yin no //
translated: The cognitions that think, “This is not a non-cow,” etc., are exclusions of other because they are free from the realization of doubt.

original: gtan tshigs bsgrubs nas de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can zhes gang bshad pa de mjug sdud pa ni de lta bas na de yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrubs nas de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can zhes gang bshad pa de mjug sdud pa ni de lta bas na de yang zhes bya'o //
translated: Having proven the reason, he concludes what was previously stated, “The object of the exclusion of that alone,” with “Therefore, that is also . . .”

original: gzhan sel ba'i don can nyid du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di sgrub pa'i tshul gyis ni go bar byed pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni dngos po'i zhes bya ba nas mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i don can nyid du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di sgrub pa'i tshul gyis ni go bar byed pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni dngos po'i zhes bya ba nas mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar du'o //
translated: He explains that it is impossible to understand by the method of proof what it means to have an object that is an exclusion of other, with “The object . . . is not tenable.”

original: de ltar na sgro 'dogs med kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sgro 'dogs med kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even without superimposition, it is established that the object is an exclusion of other.

original: sgro 'dogs zlog par byed pa nyid na 'dis ji lta bu'i rang bzhin de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i sgro 'dogs pa de bzlog pa'i don nyid kyis de'i gnyen po tsam gyis dngos po bdag nyid la brten nas de zlog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir don tha
analyzed: sgro 'dogs zlog par byed pa nyid na 'dis ji lta bu'i rang bzhin de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i sgro 'dogs pa de bzlog pa'i don nyid kyis de'i gnyen po tsam gyis dngos po bdag nyid la brten nas de zlog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir don tha
translated: When it is the case that the superimposition is being reversed, then the antidote to that superimposition, which is of a type that is incompatible with the nature of that superimposition, is the very thing that reverses that superimposition.

original: mi dad pa yang bzlog par bya pa sgro 'dogs pa'i grangs snyed du zlog par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha dad par snang ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mi dad pa yang bzlog par bya pa sgro 'dogs pa'i grangs snyed du zlog par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha dad par snang ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the above explanation is presented in the following lines:

original: cha shas sgro 'dogs ji snyed pa //
analyzed: cha shas sgro 'dogs ji snyed pa //
translated: As many superimpositions as there are of parts,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: there are that many superimpositions of entities.

original: ngo bo rtogs pa yin na ni ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir thams cad don gcig la brten pa nyid do zhes ston pa ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo rtogs pa yin na ni ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir thams cad don gcig la brten pa nyid do zhes ston pa ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
