translated: If it were the case that the nature were realized, then since it would be a single nature, it would be the case that everything would be based on a single object. This is presented in the following line:🔽Otherwise, it would be a single entity.

original: 'di ni gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi 'grel par mdor med kyang gzhan gyi dngos po ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa la 'dir ni tshigs su bcad par bya ste brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi 'grel par mdor med kyang gzhan gyi dngos po ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa la 'dir ni tshigs su bcad par bya ste brjod do //
translated: This is the very same as the commentary on “if because of the cause of error” although it is not stated in the verse.  The other things that exist, etc., are explained here in the verse.

original: tshigs su bcad par bshad pa de bzhin du 'grel par ni 'grel ba nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad par bshad pa de bzhin du 'grel par ni 'grel ba nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: The verse explanation is the same as the commentary.

original: mdor med pa 'grel par bshad pa de ma thag tu mdor @176a * //
analyzed: mdor med pa 'grel par bshad pa de ma thag tu mdor @176a * //
translated: The commentary explanation of what is not in the verse is immediately after the verse.

original: brjod pa yang bsdu ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: brjod pa yang bsdu ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The statement is also a summary.

original: dper na ma rtogs pa nges pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa brgal te /
analyzed: dper na ma rtogs pa nges pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa brgal te /
translated: For example, the non-realization is ascertained, etc.  The reason is stated.

original: nye bar bkod pa'i dngos po de phyir de ltar rtags sel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa'i dngos po de phyir de ltar rtags sel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is like the verse that eliminates the reason.

original: chod pa la de'i don can gyi mdor byas pa ni bsdu ba ma yin la bshad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chod pa la de'i don can gyi mdor byas pa ni bsdu ba ma yin la bshad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The summary that has the meaning of that in the verse is not a summary, nor is it an explanation.

original: 'jug pa zhugs zin pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhugs zin pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the engagement has already been engaged, it is called an intermediate verse.

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan gyi nang du brjod pa bshad pa med pa'i tshigs su bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan gyi nang du brjod pa bshad pa med pa'i tshigs su bshad pa'o //
translated: The intermediate verses are those that are not explained in the sutra itself, but are explained in other sutras.

original: 'grel pa bshad zin na mdor brjod pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'grel pa bshad zin na mdor brjod pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If the commentary has already been explained, what is the use of a brief statement?

original: mdo'i bstan bcos ma tshang ba med par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo'i bstan bcos ma tshang ba med par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to make the treatise on the sutra complete.

original: gzhan du brjod par bya ba'i don yang mdor mi snyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du brjod par bya ba'i don yang mdor mi snyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the meaning to be expressed would not be included in the sutra.

original: des na de ltar rang gi phyogs la rigs pas don gyi rang bzhin ji lta bur gyur pa de la brten te /
analyzed: des na de ltar rang gi phyogs la rigs pas don gyi rang bzhin ji lta bur gyur pa de la brten te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, based on the nature of the meaning as it is, through reasoning in one's own position,

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pas rtogs par byed pa nyid bsal nas rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pas rtogs par byed pa nyid bsal nas rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: it is established by the proof statement beginning with The nature of the meaning is one, and so on, refuting the very possibility of understanding through exclusion, and thus the text is established.

original: da ni gzhan gyi khas blangs par rab tu grub pa'i don la brten nas kyang sgrub pa'i ngo bos rtogs par byed pa mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi khas blangs par rab tu grub pa'i don la brten nas kyang sgrub pa'i ngo bos rtogs par byed pa mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that even based on the meaning established by the assertion of others, understanding through the nature of proof is impossible,🔽he says:

original: rtsom pa ni gang gi ltar na blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa ni gang gi ltar na blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The author of the treatise states:

original: rgol ba gang gi ltar na ba lang nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par sna tshogs su gyur pa gang la yod pa de lta bu'i don blos 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba gang gi ltar na ba lang nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par sna tshogs su gyur pa gang la yod pa de lta bu'i don blos 'dzin pa'o //
translated: According to those who maintain that the mind apprehends an object that is qualified by various distinctions, such as cowness, impermanence, and so on,

original: khyad par de dag las kyang don de tha dad pa nyid do zhes brjod na ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par de dag las kyang don de tha dad pa nyid do zhes brjod na ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: if one says that the object is different from those distinctions, then it is called “different.”

original: yang na khyad par sna tshogs pa gyur pa nyid khyad par sna tshogs can te don de nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na khyad par sna tshogs pa gyur pa nyid khyad par sna tshogs can te don de nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or, the object itself that is qualified by various distinctions is called “having various distinctions,” and the mind apprehends that object.

original: 'di yang sna tshogs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni tha mi dad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang sna tshogs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni tha mi dad ces bya ba'o //
translated: If one says that the object is different from that very object that is qualified by various distinctions, then it is called “not different.”🔽If the apprehension is different due to the various distinctions, then there is no fault of the position of nondifference.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa tha dad pa na tha dad pa med pa'i phyogs la 'gyur ba'i skyon med do zhes bstan pa'i don du tha dad pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa tha dad pa na tha dad pa med pa'i phyogs la 'gyur ba'i skyon med do zhes bstan pa'i don du tha dad pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, the author of the treatise states:

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gal te yang sgra dang rtags dag gis bsgrub pas dngos po nyid rtogs pa de lta na yang sgra dang tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa'i nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: gal te yang sgra dang rtags dag gis bsgrub pas dngos po nyid rtogs pa de lta na yang sgra dang tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa'i nyes pa ni med do //
translated: Even if one does understand the nature of a thing through the proof statements and signs, there is no fault of the non-engagement of other means of knowledge such as verbal testimony and inference.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs zin pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang @176b 'di de kho na ltar rtogs pa yin na des ci bya /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs zin pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang @176b 'di de kho na ltar rtogs pa yin na des ci bya /
translated: If one understands it just as it is through another means of knowledge, what is the use of that?

original: de lta ma yin na yang ma rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa don bdag nyid gcig tu gyur ba nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yang ma rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa don bdag nyid gcig tu gyur ba nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If it were not so, it would be just as if one had not understood it.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyis gcig yin yang du ma dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyis gcig yin yang du ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The nature of a thing is not just one, but it has many aspects.

original: des na sgra'o zhes khyad par 'ga' zhig gis rnam par bcad de rtogs kyang mi rtag pa'o zhes khyad par gzhan gyis rnam par bcad de rtogs pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra'o zhes khyad par 'ga' zhig gis rnam par bcad de rtogs kyang mi rtag pa'o zhes khyad par gzhan gyis rnam par bcad de rtogs pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though one understands it by excluding some other aspect, such as sound, one does not understand it by excluding another aspect, such as impermanence. Thus, it is to be understood through inference.

original: sgras kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sgras kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Verbal testimony is also like that.

original: yang na bshad pa gnyis pa ltar sgra gzhan la sogs pa ni khyad par 'ba' zhig la gzhol ba yin pas skyon 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: yang na bshad pa gnyis pa ltar sgra gzhan la sogs pa ni khyad par 'ba' zhig la gzhol ba yin pas skyon 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Or, according to the second explanation, since the other words, etc. are only devoted to the distinctions, there is no fault at all.

original: 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary:

original: gang zhig ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ste /
translated: “That which is called”

original: gang gi ltar zhes bya ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi ltar zhes bya ba bshad pa'o //
translated: is explained as “according to whom.”

original: khyad par rnams phan tshun tha dad pa kho na yin la zhes bya bas ni khyad par ni sna tshogs can zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: khyad par rnams phan tshun tha dad pa kho na yin la zhes bya bas ni khyad par ni sna tshogs can zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: “The distinctions are only different from each other” explains “the various distinctions.”

original: rten las zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i ldog mtshams nyid kyis tha dad ces bya ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: rten las zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i ldog mtshams nyid kyis tha dad ces bya ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: “From the basis” explains “different by the very limit of difference.”

original: rten nyid kyi khyad par sna tshogs can don gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: rten nyid kyi khyad par sna tshogs can don gzhan nyid do //
translated: The various distinctions are just different from the basis.

original: de'i rgyu can gyi ma nyan pa dag ni de dag gi rten la 'jug pa zhes bya bas ni khyad par gyis te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyi ma nyan pa dag ni de dag gi rten la 'jug pa zhes bya bas ni khyad par gyis te /
translated: “The non-distinctions that are caused by them engage with their basis” explains “distinction.”

original: khyad par dag dang blos 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dag dang blos 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The distinctions are grasped by the mind.

original: de dag kho na la 'jug go zhes bya bas ni don gzhan ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kho na la 'jug go zhes bya bas ni don gzhan ston par byed pa'o //
translated: “They engage with just those” explains “different object.”

original: de bas na don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa'i thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa gang yin pa de'i ltar na yang khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa'i thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa gang yin pa de'i ltar na yang khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the reductio argument expressed by “the nature of the object is one, etc.” does not apply.

original: yan lag tu gyur pa'i nus pa las mi gzhan ba'i bdag nyid thams cad bzung na phan par bya ba'i khyad par gang zhig ma nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yan lag tu gyur pa'i nus pa las mi gzhan ba'i bdag nyid thams cad bzung na phan par bya ba'i khyad par gang zhig ma nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: But if you think that, then, when all the aspects of the object are grasped as not different from the capacity that is the part of the object, what specific thing to be benefited is not ascertained?

original: khyad par tha dad pa dag kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par tha dad pa dag kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: The commentary explains the phrase “only different aspects” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa de'i phyir sgra dang shes pa gcig gis yul du byas pa'i don de la sgra gzhan dang shes pa gzhan 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa de'i phyir sgra dang shes pa gcig gis yul du byas pa'i don de la sgra gzhan dang shes pa gzhan 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Because they are different, a different sound and a different consciousness can have as their object the object that is the object of a single sound and a single consciousness.

original: des na 'di dag don la sgra dang shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dag don la sgra dang shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Therefore, these are the causes of the other sounds and consciousnesses with regard to the object.

original: de lta na yang khyad par de dang ldan pa gcig pu nyid de ni sgra dang shes pa de dag gis nye bar len to //🔽de bdag nyid thams cad bzung na khyad par thams cad nges @177a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par de dang ldan pa gcig pu nyid de ni sgra dang shes pa de dag gis nye bar len to // de bdag nyid thams cad bzung na khyad par thams cad nges @177a * //
translated: Nevertheless, the mere fact that it possesses those differences is the object of those words and cognitions.

original: par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is apprehended in all its aspects, all the differences are ascertained.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te yang khyad par rnams tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa kho nas sgra dang shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yang khyad par rnams tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa kho nas sgra dang shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Even though the differences are different from each other, the words and cognitions are the causes of the differences.

original: gcig nyid kyis thams cad rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na yang khyad par dang ldan pa ni rang gi ngo bos gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyis thams cad rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na yang khyad par dang ldan pa ni rang gi ngo bos gcig kho na'o //
translated: Even though it is not the case that everything is understood by means of oneness, the possessor of the differences is, by its very nature, one only.

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir na thams cad bzung bas bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa na khyad par gyi byed pa la mi ltos pa kho nar khyad par thams cad 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir na thams cad bzung bas bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa na khyad par gyi byed pa la mi ltos pa kho nar khyad par thams cad 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: Because it is one, when it is apprehended in all its aspects, it apprehends all the differences without depending on the activity of the differences.

original: gcig por rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis bdag nyid thams cad bzung na yang khyad par thams cad bzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gcig por rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis bdag nyid thams cad bzung na yang khyad par thams cad bzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the entity of the self is apprehended by its own nature alone, how can all of its attributes be apprehended?

original: khyad par sna tshogs la zhes smos te /
analyzed: khyad par sna tshogs la zhes smos te /
translated: The response is: “The various attributes.”

original: khyad par sna tshogs phan pa'i rten nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par sna tshogs phan pa'i rten nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The various attributes are the entity that has the characteristic of being the support for the various benefits. Since it is not different from the self that possesses the attributes,

original: khyad par dang ldan pa'i khyad par sna tshogs la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni de las tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa'i khyad par sna tshogs la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni de las tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: the various attributes that are said to benefit the one who possesses the attributes are not different from it.

original: des na 'di'i de lta bu'i bdag nyid char bzung ba med pas khyad par sna tshogs la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bzung na /
analyzed: des na 'di'i de lta bu'i bdag nyid char bzung ba med pas khyad par sna tshogs la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bzung na /
translated: Therefore, since the entity of the self is not apprehended in this way, if the various attributes are apprehended as the ones that benefit it,

original: ji ltar khyad par ma bzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par ma bzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: how can the attributes not be apprehended?

original: dbyug pa ma bzung bar dbyug pa can mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyug pa ma bzung bar dbyug pa can mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the case of not apprehending the one who has a stick without apprehending the stick.

original: 'dir phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa ni gal che ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa ni gal che ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the object of benefit and the benefactor are not the most important things.

original: 'on kyang de dag de'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag la grags pa'i dbang du byas nas phan gdags bya 'dogs byed kyi rtsa ba can yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag de'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag la grags pa'i dbang du byas nas phan gdags bya 'dogs byed kyi rtsa ba can yin no //
translated: However, since they are its distinctions, from the perspective of what is accepted by us, it has the root of the object of benefit and the benefactor.

original: gzhan dag gi ltar ni 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ltar ni 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can nyid do //
translated: According to others, it has the root of the relation.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa can yang khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa can yang khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the related is nothing other than the nature that possesses the distinction.

original: 'di 'dod par mi bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'dod par mi bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that this is not accepted,

original: 'brel pa khas len na 'brel pa can gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir te 'brel pa can med par 'brel pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa khas len na 'brel pa can gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir te 'brel pa can med par 'brel pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one accepts the relation, one must certainly accept the related, because the relation is not established without the related.

original: des na don la khyad par thams cad dang 'brel pa can du bzung na ji ltar khyad par thams cad ma bzung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na don la khyad par thams cad dang 'brel pa can du bzung na ji ltar khyad par thams cad ma bzung bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if the object is apprehended as related to all distinctions, how could all distinctions not be apprehended?

original: de bshad pa ni khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is “because it is the very nature of all particularities to be helpful.”

original: 'brel pa can tha dad na ma rtogs @177b par 'gyur gyi tha mi dad na ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can tha dad na ma rtogs @177b par 'gyur gyi tha mi dad na ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the related things were different, there would be no understanding, but if they were not different, there would be no understanding. The explanation of that is “in its own nature.”

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis na phan par byed pa nyid du bzung ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis na phan par byed pa nyid du bzung ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Because it is not different, it is the nature that is grasped as helpful.

original: 'on te yang sgra dang tshad ma thams cad zhugs na khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te yang sgra dang tshad ma thams cad zhugs na khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur mod ce na /
translated: But if all words and all valid cognitions were engaged, all particularities would be understood.

original: de dag ces smos so //
analyzed: de dag ces smos so //
translated: The response to that is “those.”

original: khyad par sna tshogs pa dang de la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa'i bdag nyid gnyis kyi nang nas gcig shes na ni gnyis ka bzung /
analyzed: khyad par sna tshogs pa dang de la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa'i bdag nyid gnyis kyi nang nas gcig shes na ni gnyis ka bzung /
translated: From among the two—the various particularities and the nature of the capacity to be helpful—if one is known, both are grasped.

original: re zhig gcig ni shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: re zhig gcig ni shes pa kho na'o //
translated: One of the two is known.

original: de shes na cig shes kyang shes pa'i phyir gnyi ga 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shes na cig shes kyang shes pa'i phyir gnyi ga 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is known, both are grasped because one is known.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag nyid la 'brel pa'i phyir de dag gi 'brel pa ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid la 'brel pa'i phyir de dag gi 'brel pa ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Because they are related to the self, their relation is characterized by inherence.

original: de yang de'i bdag nyid la yod pa yin gyi bdag nyid gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de'i bdag nyid la yod pa yin gyi bdag nyid gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: And that inherence exists in the self, not in another self.

original: des na de dag nyid 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa can ni 'di gnyis las tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de dag nyid 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa can ni 'di gnyis las tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, because they themselves are related, the related is not different from these two.

original: bdag nyid gzhan la 'brel pa yod pa ni de nyid 'brel pa can du 'gyur gyi de gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan la 'brel pa yod pa ni de nyid 'brel pa can du 'gyur gyi de gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: If inherence existed in another self, that self would be the related, not those two.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: ji ltar khyed cag khyad par gyi sgo nas khyad par can rtogs par 'dod pa de bzhin du bdag cag gis khyad par dang ldan par khyad par dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid las khyad par rnams la rtogs par 'gyur ba yang bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed cag khyad par gyi sgo nas khyad par can rtogs par 'dod pa de bzhin du bdag cag gis khyad par dang ldan par khyad par dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid las khyad par rnams la rtogs par 'gyur ba yang bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: Just as you assert that the qualified is understood through the qualifier, in the same way, we also prove that the qualifiers are understood from the self that possesses the qualifiers and is related to the qualifiers.

original: 'brel pa can gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par dang ldan pa phyogs gcig gis rtogs par mi srid pa ni khyad par dang ldan par rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par dang ldan pa phyogs gcig gis rtogs par mi srid pa ni khyad par dang ldan par rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the nature of the related object, the cognition of the qualified is not possible without the cognition of the one part, i.e., the qualifier.

original: de bzhin du khyad par dag 'ba' zhig shes pa na yang khyad par can dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir cha med par rtogs pa las khyad par dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par dag 'ba' zhig shes pa na yang khyad par can dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir cha med par rtogs pa las khyad par dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa 'phen pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, when only the qualifiers are cognized, the cognition of the qualified is inferred from the cognition of the part, because it is the nature of the related object.

original: des na khyad par gcig gi sgo nas de'i don shes pa na yang khyad par thams cad rtogs par thal lo //
analyzed: des na khyad par gcig gi sgo nas de'i don shes pa na yang khyad par thams cad rtogs par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, when the object is cognized by means of one qualifier, it follows that all the qualifiers are cognized.

original: pha rol pos khyad par sna tshogs can gyi don blos 'dzin par brjod pa de'i ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par bzung ba na khyad par mtha' dag gzung bar thal bar brjod do //
analyzed: pha rol pos khyad par sna tshogs can gyi don blos 'dzin par brjod pa de'i ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par bzung ba na khyad par mtha' dag gzung bar thal bar brjod do //
translated: The opponent says that the mind apprehends the object that has various qualifiers. In the phrase “according to you,” etc., it is said that when the qualifier is apprehended, it follows that all the qualifiers are apprehended.

original: des na khyad par bzung bas stong ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de bzung na thams cad bzung bar 'gyur ro //🔽khyad par @178a * //
analyzed: des na khyad par bzung bas stong ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de bzung na thams cad bzung bar 'gyur ro // khyad par @178a * //
translated: Therefore, since there is no apprehension of a qualifier that is empty of the qualified, how could the apprehension of one imply the apprehension of the other?🔽If you say that the apprehension of all the qualifiers implies the apprehension of the qualified,

original: thams cad bzung ba las de bzung ba na ni mi 'dod pa cung zad kyang med do zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: thams cad bzung ba las de bzung ba na ni mi 'dod pa cung zad kyang med do zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: then there is nothing at all that is not accepted.🔽In response to this, it is explained:

original: de dag bdag nyid la 'brel phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid la 'brel phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: Because they are related to the self.

original: bdag nyid la 'brel par rnam par gnas pa nyid kyis gnyi ga yang 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir de ltar na bzung na cig shos kyi yul can gyi rtogs pa 'phen no //
analyzed: bdag nyid la 'brel par rnam par gnas pa nyid kyis gnyi ga yang 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir de ltar na bzung na cig shos kyi yul can gyi rtogs pa 'phen no //
translated: Since they are related to the self, both are related. Thus, when one is apprehended, the cognition of the other is implied.

original: des na thabs gang yang rung ba zhig gis khyad par dang ldan par gyur pa rtogs pa khyad par 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: des na thabs gang yang rung ba zhig gis khyad par dang ldan par gyur pa rtogs pa khyad par 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, by some means, the cognition of the qualified is the apprehension of the qualifier.

original: khyad par thams cad bzung bas de bzung na ni rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad bzung bas de bzung na ni rtsod pa med do //
translated: If the apprehension of all the qualifiers implies the apprehension of the qualified, then there is no dispute.

original: des na khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang de las rtogs pas reg pa na ma rtogs pa'i khyad par mtha' dag rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang de las rtogs pas reg pa na ma rtogs pa'i khyad par mtha' dag rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement is that when one understands it by means of one distinction, it follows that one understands all the distinctions that were not understood.

original: des na zlos par dogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na zlos par dogs par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not suspect redundancy.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa tha mi dad par bzung mod /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa tha mi dad par bzung mod /
translated: Granted that the benefit is apprehended as nondifferent,🔽but the difference is not different.

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no zhes kyang dogs par byas nas slar yang 'brel pa tha dad pa med pa tsam ston pa ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no zhes kyang dogs par byas nas slar yang 'brel pa tha dad pa med pa tsam ston pa ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Having suspected that, it is not tenable to demonstrate again that there is no difference in relation.

original: sngar nyid brjod zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar nyid brjod zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it was already stated previously.

original: 'di las lhag pa ni cung zad kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa ni cung zad kyang mi brjod do //
translated: Nothing more than this is stated.

original: des na don 'di sngar nyid grub pa'am yang na da lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don 'di sngar nyid grub pa'am yang na da lta yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this meaning was already established previously, or else it is not established now.

original: khyad par dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: The commentary is “distinction” and so on.

original: gang gi don du 'di bkod pa bshad pa ni de khyad par gcig gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du 'di bkod pa bshad pa ni de khyad par gcig gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the purpose of this composition is “by one distinction.”

original: khyad par la phan 'dogs pa nyid du khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs pa na /
analyzed: khyad par la phan 'dogs pa nyid du khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs pa na /
translated: In particular, when one realizes that the qualifier is qualified by the property of being a qualifier,

original: mdo gnyi gar yang snying por byas pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi tshul gang yin pa de gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: mdo gnyi gar yang snying por byas pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi tshul gang yin pa de gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: then the way in which the two sūtras clarify the distinction between the qualifier and the qualified is

original: khyad par dang ldan par 'dzin pa ni de 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan par 'dzin pa ni de 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that the apprehension of the qualifier is not without the apprehension of the qualified.

original: khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa med na med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa med na med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is not without the apprehension of all qualifiers

original: khyad par dang ldan par 'dzin pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan par 'dzin pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: is the apprehension of the qualifier.

original: thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du bzung ba na /
analyzed: thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du bzung ba na /
translated: When one apprehends the property of being a qualifier as the qualifier of all,

original: thams cad bzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad bzung ba kho na'o //
translated: then all are apprehended.

original: du ba'i rgyu nyid du rnam par rtog pas me bzung ba na /
analyzed: du ba'i rgyu nyid du rnam par rtog pas me bzung ba na /
translated: When one apprehends fire by the conception of its being the cause of smoke,

original: du ba mi 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba mi 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: one does not fail to apprehend smoke.

original: 'dzin pa med na med pa yin pa na phan gdags par bya ba ma bzung bar khyad par dang ldan pa phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'dzin par mi @178b 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gzhan du na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med na med pa yin pa na phan gdags par bya ba ma bzung bar khyad par dang ldan pa phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'dzin par mi @178b 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gzhan du na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no apprehension of the other, then the one who is qualified as the helper is not apprehended as the helper, because the one who is to be helped is not apprehended. This is explained by “otherwise.”

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang ldan pa nyid du yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang ldan pa nyid du yang ngo //
translated: “ In that way” means as the one who is qualified.

original: mi 'dzin par yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gzhan la phan par byed pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dzin par yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gzhan la phan par byed pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: “ It is not tenable that there is no apprehension” is explained by “the one who helps others.”

original: gzhan yin ni 'dir 'gyur gyi gzhan ma yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan yin ni 'dir 'gyur gyi gzhan ma yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ It would be like that” means it would be like the other.

original: nges par phan 'dogs par byed pa bzung ba na de la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du bzung bas na phan gdags par bya ba mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par phan 'dogs par byed pa bzung ba na de la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du bzung bas na phan gdags par bya ba mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: When the one who definitely helps is apprehended, then the one who is to be helped is not not apprehended, because the one who helps is apprehended as the one who helps.

original: de bshad pa ni phan par byed pa de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni phan par byed pa de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by “the one who helps in that way.”

original: phan gdags par bya ba ma bzung na phan 'dogs par byed pa de yang ma bzung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te dper na rje khol bzhin no //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ma bzung na phan 'dogs par byed pa de yang ma bzung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te dper na rje khol bzhin no //
translated: If the object to be benefited is not apprehended, then it follows that the benefactor is not apprehended, just as in the case of a master and a servant.

original: khol po khol po nyid du 'dzin pa na rje po mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khol po khol po nyid du 'dzin pa na rje po mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: When a servant is apprehended as a servant, a master is not apprehended.

original: 'dir khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po med mod kyi /
translated: Here, there is no relation of qualifier and qualificand.

original: de lta na yang rje bor 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang rje bor 'dzin pa ni /
translated: However, the apprehension of a master

original: khol po 'dzin pa la ltos pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: khol po 'dzin pa la ltos pa ni ma yin la /
translated: does not depend on the apprehension of a servant.

original: khol po'i shes pa la rje bo mi snang yang /
analyzed: khol po'i shes pa la rje bo mi snang yang /
translated: Although a master does not appear to the consciousness of a servant,

original: khol por 'dzin pa yang rje bo 'dzin pa la ltos pa yin pas dpe nyid do //
analyzed: khol por 'dzin pa yang rje bo 'dzin pa la ltos pa yin pas dpe nyid do //
translated: the apprehension of a servant depends on the apprehension of a master. Therefore, this is an example.

original: snga ma las phyi ma bzhin du de las de rtogs par nus pa nyid yin gyi khyad par dang khyad par can bzhin du tha dad par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma las phyi ma bzhin du de las de rtogs par nus pa nyid yin gyi khyad par dang khyad par can bzhin du tha dad par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The latter is able to understand that from the former, but it is not understood as different, as in the case of a qualifier and a qualificand.

original: phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa dag 'dzin pa ni ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo yod pa yin te /
analyzed: phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa dag 'dzin pa ni ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo yod pa yin te /
translated: The apprehension of the object of benefit and the benefactor is the existence of the nature of the qualifier and the qualified.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: It is like cause and effect.

original: gal te khyad par gyi sgo nas khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs pa na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyi sgo nas khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs pa na /
translated: If one understands the qualifier through the qualifier,

original: 'di pa lang ngo zhe 'am mi rtag pa'o zhes pa ltar des nye bar bsgyur ba de dang tha mi dad par rtogs la khyad par gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs na ni gang gi sgo nas der rtogs pa ma yin pa'i khyad par de 'brel par rtogs par
analyzed: 'di pa lang ngo zhe 'am mi rtag pa'o zhes pa ltar des nye bar bsgyur ba de dang tha mi dad par rtogs la khyad par gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs na ni gang gi sgo nas der rtogs pa ma yin pa'i khyad par de 'brel par rtogs par
translated: then just as one understands “this is a cow” or “this is impermanent,” one understands that the qualifier is not different from that which is qualified. But if one understands through another qualifier, then one would understand that the qualifier is related to that which is qualified through the qualifier by which one understands it.

original: 'gyur te / sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: 'gyur te / sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid do zhes so //
translated: For example, “the impermanence of sound.”

original: des na 'dir sgra mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel to zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na 'dir sgra mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel to zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, one would understand “here sound is related to impermanence.”

original: de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid khyad par ram 'brel pa can nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid khyad par ram 'brel pa can nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, impermanence would not be the qualifier or the related object.

original: de de la thim pa nyid du rtogs na de khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi 'brel par rtogs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de de la thim pa nyid du rtogs na de khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi 'brel par rtogs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: If one understands that it dissolves into that, then that is a special understanding, not an understanding of a connection.

original: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa'i thabs su brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa'i thabs su brjod de /
translated: This is said to be a method of understanding its nature.

original: khyod kyis bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni 'di ltar thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni 'di ltar thal ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like that according to the way you explain it.
Therefore,

original: na khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: na khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: why do you say, “The various distinctions are beneficial”?

original: brjod pa der thim pa'am de'i rang bzhin du snang ba sgra tsam snying por gyur pa mdun du sel bar 'gyur ba zhog ste 'di bsam mo //
analyzed: brjod pa der thim pa'am de'i rang bzhin du snang ba sgra tsam snying por gyur pa mdun du sel bar 'gyur ba zhog ste 'di bsam mo //
translated: Set aside the mere word “dissolves into that” or “appears as its nature,” which is just a sound that becomes the essence, and consider this:

original: sgra zhes khyad par gcig gi sgo nas rtogs pa po mi rtag pa zhes khyad par gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs pa na /
analyzed: sgra zhes khyad par gcig gi sgo nas rtogs pa po mi rtag pa zhes khyad par gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs pa na /
translated: When one understands the word “sound” from the perspective of one distinction and understands “impermanent” from the perspective of another distinction,

original: ci khyad par nyid lhag par rtogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci khyad par nyid lhag par rtogs pa yin nam /
translated: is it the distinction itself that is understood?

original: 'on te khyad par dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig rtogs /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig rtogs /
translated: Or is it some distinction that possesses a distinction that is understood?

original: de la 'dir rang gi bdag nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i sgo kho na nas bdag nyid thams cad rtogs pas mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgo nas de la tha mi dad pa'i khyad par gang zhig rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dir rang gi bdag nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i sgo kho na nas bdag nyid thams cad rtogs pas mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgo nas de la tha mi dad pa'i khyad par gang zhig rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not different from itself, all of its nature is understood just through the word “sound.” Therefore, what difference that is not different from sound is understood through the word “impermanent”?

original: 'di'i khyad par nyid char 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i khyad par nyid char 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The difference itself is the word “impermanent.”

original: des na sgra zhes bya bas 'di'i rang bzhin thams cad rtogs la khyad par ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra zhes bya bas 'di'i rang bzhin thams cad rtogs la khyad par ni gcig yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word “sound” understands all of its nature, but the difference is one.

original: des na mi rtag pa zhes rtogs pa na khyad par lhag pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa zhes rtogs pa na khyad par lhag pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when “impermanent” is understood, an additional difference is understood.

original: de ni sgra mi rtag pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya bar yang rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni sgra mi rtag pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya bar yang rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: That is also understood as “impermanent” in connection with sound.

original: de ltar ni khyad par ma yin te tha mi dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni khyad par ma yin te tha mi dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it is not a difference because it is not understood to be nondifferent.

original: 'di sus lan gal te nye bar sgyur bar byed pa ltar rnam par gnas pa'i khyad par ni nye bar sbyor bas tha mi dad par rtogs par bzod pa yin na gdon mi za bar rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de 'brel bar rtogs pa na /
analyzed: 'di sus lan gal te nye bar sgyur bar byed pa ltar rnam par gnas pa'i khyad par ni nye bar sbyor bas tha mi dad par rtogs par bzod pa yin na gdon mi za bar rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de 'brel bar rtogs pa na /
translated: If the difference in the state of the object is not understood separately from the application, then when the object to be understood is understood in connection with the application,

original: ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: how could it be understood in any other way?

original: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be understood just as it is in its own nature.

original: zla ba la sogs pa dag ni rtogs pa po yul tha dad pa can grangs med pa mang po dag gi rtogs pas rtogs pa na rang bzhin gzhan du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa dag ni rtogs pa po yul tha dad pa can grangs med pa mang po dag gi rtogs pas rtogs pa na rang bzhin gzhan du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The many countless cognizers of the moon, etc., do not apprehend the moon, etc., as different in nature when they cognize it.

original: des na gdon mi za bar rtogs par bya ba'i khyad par rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar rtogs par bya ba'i khyad par rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par 'gyur mod /
translated: Therefore, the difference in the object to be understood is certainly understood just as it is in its own nature.

original: gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis de ltar rtogs par mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis de ltar rtogs par mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But it is not tenable that it is understood in that way by another, because it is understood by means of another.

original: 'di yang ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar 'thad /
translated: How is this tenable?

original: gal te sgra zhes bya bas don de ltar rtogs na ji ltar khyad par thams cad kyis de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sgra zhes bya bas don de ltar rtogs na ji ltar khyad par thams cad kyis de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur /
translated: If the word “sound” causes one to understand the meaning in that way, then why would all the other attributes not cause one to understand it in that way?

original: des na rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa'i phyir smra ba gzhan dag kyang mi 'thad pas ji ltar gzhan la khro /
analyzed: des na rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa'i phyir smra ba gzhan dag kyang mi 'thad pas ji ltar gzhan la khro /
translated: Therefore, since it is completely untenable, the other’s position is untenable. So how could one be angry with another?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jug sdud pa'o //
translated: “ Therefore” and so on concludes the chapter.

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig @179b ces bya ba la sogs pa khyad par don gzhan ma yin pa la brjod pa'i thal ba gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig @179b ces bya ba la sogs pa khyad par don gzhan ma yin pa la brjod pa'i thal ba gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
translated: The reductio that was stated against the position that the nature of the object is not a different object is completely analogous.

original: gang dag chos dang chos can dag phan tshun 'brel pa med par tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du khas len pa de'i ltar na yang chos thams cad chos can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos gcig gi sgo nas rtogs pa na chos mtha'🔽dag rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag chos dang chos can dag phan tshun 'brel pa med par tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du khas len pa de'i ltar na yang chos thams cad chos can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos gcig gi sgo nas rtogs pa na chos mtha'🔽dag rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Even for those who accept that the property and the basis of the property are different from each other, but not unrelated, all properties are not different from the basis of the property. Therefore, when one property is understood, all properties are understood.

original: de dag de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different from that.

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not because they are different by way of the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ji ltar tha mi dad pa de'i bdag nyid la de dag de'i rang bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar tha mi dad pa de'i bdag nyid la de dag de'i rang bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist as the intrinsic reality of that which is not different from it.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan tha mi dad pa la gzhan tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir chos dnge  chos can tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par smra bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan tha mi dad pa la gzhan tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir chos dnge  chos can tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par smra bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then because that which is different would be different from that which is not different, one would not speak of phenomena as either different or not different from the subject.

original: des na tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa na de ma rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa na de ma rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, when one realizes the intrinsic reality of that which is not different, how could one not realize that?

original: des na de ltar thams cad 'brel pa can gyi bdag nyid khyad par dang ldan pa bzung ba na /
analyzed: des na de ltar thams cad 'brel pa can gyi bdag nyid khyad par dang ldan pa bzung ba na /
translated: Thus, when one apprehends that which is related to all things as possessing a specific nature,

original: khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du bsgrubs nas pha rol po dag khyad par bzhin du khyad par dang 'brel pa can nyid kyang tha dad pa'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i tha dad par 'gyur ba med par dogs pa byed pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du bsgrubs nas pha rol po dag khyad par bzhin du khyad par dang 'brel pa can nyid kyang tha dad pa'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i tha dad par 'gyur ba med par dogs pa byed pa ni /
translated: Having established that the qualifier is the qualifier of the qualified, the opponent fears that, like the qualifier, the qualifier-possessor will also be different, and so the non-difference stated will not occur.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ But if” is the question.

original: lan 'debs pa'i phyir bshad pa na /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa'i phyir bshad pa na /
translated: In order to respond, he says,

original: chos phan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos phan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The benefit of the property” and so on.

original: chos rnams la phan pa de nyid nus pa yin te /🔽chos la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa nyid phan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams la phan pa de nyid nus pa yin te / chos la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa nyid phan pa yin te /
translated: The benefit of the property is its capacity.

original: bya ba gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan ni med do //
translated: The capacity to benefit the property is the benefit, because there is no other action.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te khyad par re re la phan par byed pa nyid dag yin na zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te khyad par re re la phan par byed pa nyid dag yin na zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, he will explain, “If they are the benefactors of each individual qualifier.”

original: de rnams tha dad na 'o na 'di dag gang las tha dad de ni skabs kyi khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas nus pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rnams tha dad na 'o na 'di dag gang las tha dad de ni skabs kyi khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas nus pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: If they are different, then from what are they different? The passage beginning “the various specific capacities” indicates that they are not different from the capacity.

original: nus pa de dag de'i ci yin te /
analyzed: nus pa de dag de'i ci yin te /
translated: What is that capacity of that thing?

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “That” is a change due to a relation.

original: gal te khyad par dang ldan pa de las de dag la phan mod /
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang ldan pa de las de dag la phan mod /
translated: If that thing endowed with a specific capacity benefits those things,

original: de khyad par dang ldan pa 'brel pa can nyid ma yan na de'i tshe dngos po tha dad pa dag de'i nus pa zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //🔽gal te de lta yin mod /
analyzed: de khyad par dang ldan pa 'brel pa can nyid ma yan na de'i tshe dngos po tha dad pa dag de'i nus pa zhes bya bar mi 'thad do // gal te de lta yin mod /
translated: but that thing endowed with a specific capacity is not related to them, then at that time it is not tenable to say that different things are its capacity.🔽If that is so, what follows from that?

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na bshad pa /
translated: It is said:

original: de lta yin na thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta yin na thug med 'gyur //
translated: If that is so, there is an infinite regress.

original: @180a * // 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: @180a * // 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gal te yang khyad par dang 'brel pa can khyad par dang ldan pa las tha dad pa de ltar na yang de dag khyad par dang ldan pa dang ma 'brel pa kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang khyad par dang 'brel pa can khyad par dang ldan pa las tha dad pa de ltar na yang de dag khyad par dang ldan pa dang ma 'brel pa kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: But even if the qualifier is different from that which possesses the qualifier, still it is not unrelated to that which possesses the qualifier.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa can des khyad par can dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa can des khyad par can dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would not be related to that which possesses the qualifier.

original: nus pa'i phyogs la nus pa'o //🔽des na 'brel pa can dang 'brel pa can nyid dam /
analyzed: nus pa'i phyogs la nus pa'o // des na 'brel pa can dang 'brel pa can nyid dam /
translated: In the case of potentiality, it is potentiality.

original: nus pa la phan 'dogs pa nyid ni nus pa dang ldan pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa la phan 'dogs pa nyid ni nus pa dang ldan pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation of the qualifier and that which possesses the qualifier, or the benefit of potentiality, is not different from that which possesses potentiality.

original: des na tha dad pa med na cha med par bzung ba'i phyir khyad par thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ba spang ba'i don du tha dad par khas len pa la thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa med na cha med par bzung ba'i phyir khyad par thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ba spang ba'i don du tha dad par khas len pa la thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if there is no difference, then because it is grasped as partless, the grasping of all the qualifiers would be eliminated. The admission of difference would be endless.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul yang tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir der tha dad par rtogs pas na thug pa med do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul yang tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir der tha dad par rtogs pas na thug pa med do //
translated: And because the method of explanation would be reduced to nondifference, the realization of difference would be endless.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos phan nus pa rnams zhes bya ba 'chad do //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos phan nus pa rnams zhes bya ba 'chad do //
translated: The phrase “if they were” and so on explains the phrase “the useful properties.”

original: nus pa rnams rang gi bdag nyid du gyur na 'brel pa mi dgos pa zhig na /
analyzed: nus pa rnams rang gi bdag nyid du gyur na 'brel pa mi dgos pa zhig na /
translated: If the useful properties were to become the very nature of the object, then there would be no need for a relation.

original: khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'jigs pas de ni khas ma blangs so zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'jigs pas de ni khas ma blangs so zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: But since this is unacceptable, all the distinctions would be known, and therefore this is unacceptable.

original: de'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa dag ma yin pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa dag ma yin pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “they are not, in fact, the very nature of the object” explains this.

original: de ma yin na yang 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin na yang 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba yin te /
translated: Even if they are not the very nature of the object, they are useful for establishing the relation.

original: de med na ni 'brel pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na ni 'brel pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were not, then the relation would not exist.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained in the following:

original: de las phan pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽de lta yin na thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: de las phan pa zhes bya ba'o // de lta yin na thug med 'gyur //
translated: The phrase “the useful properties” explains this.

original: zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “in that case, there would be an infinite regress” explains this.

original: 'on te phan na ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on te phan na ni zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase “if they were useful” explains this.

original: mdor don 'di thug pa med par brjod pa bstan pas /
analyzed: mdor don 'di thug pa med par brjod pa bstan pas /
translated: In brief, this shows that the meaning of the infinite regress is stated.

original: 'dis rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the analysis.

original: gang gi phyir phan pa med na 'brel pa can nyid mi rung pa de'i phyir phan pa khas len na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phan pa med na 'brel pa can nyid mi rung pa de'i phyir phan pa khas len na /
translated: Since it is not tenable that they are related if they are not helpful, therefore, if you accept that they are helpful,

original: 'di khyad par gcig gis bzung na yang bdag nyid thams cad de'i khyad par thams cad kyi rang bzhin du bzung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di khyad par gcig gis bzung na yang bdag nyid thams cad de'i khyad par thams cad kyi rang bzhin du bzung ba kho na yin no //
translated: then when one of its attributes is apprehended, the whole of its nature is apprehended.

original: ji ltar de bzung na khyad par thams cad bzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzung na khyad par thams cad bzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that when it is apprehended, all of its attributes are apprehended?

original: bshad pa / rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: bshad pa / rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: The response is: “that which is of its own nature.”

original: de dag ni de las tha dad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni de las tha dad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since they are different from it, they are of its nature alone.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i nus pa dag gis khyad par la phan @180b 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nus pa la phan par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i nus pa dag gis khyad par la phan @180b 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nus pa la phan par byed pa yin no //
translated: The capacity that is such that it is helpful to the attributes is helpful to the capacity that is of the nature of being helpful to the attributes.

original: de lta na yang phyogs gcig gis 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar khyad par thams cad 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang phyogs gcig gis 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar khyad par thams cad 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Even so, since it is asserted that it is apprehended by one part, how is it that all of its attributes are apprehended?

original: gcig pus zhes smos so //
analyzed: gcig pus zhes smos so //
translated: The response is: “by the one.”

original: gcig la ni phyogs gcig srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la ni phyogs gcig srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible that one part of the one is apprehended.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /🔽khyad par dang 'brel pa can nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te / khyad par dang 'brel pa can nyid dam /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid khyad par dang ldan pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di'i tha dad pa de dag dang 'brel pa can nyid dam de dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ni tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid khyad par dang ldan pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di'i tha dad pa de dag dang 'brel pa can nyid dam de dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ni tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
translated: The relatedness to the distinctions, or the capacity to benefit, is not different from the possessor of the distinctions. Even so, the relatedness to those distinctions, or the capacity to benefit those, is not different.

original: des na khyad par gcig gi sgo nas 'di cha med par bzung ba na yang khyad par tha dad pa la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bzung ba'i phyir khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa bzung ba yin la de las kyang khyad par 'dzin pa yin no
analyzed: des na khyad par gcig gi sgo nas 'di cha med par bzung ba na yang khyad par tha dad pa la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bzung ba'i phyir khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa bzung ba yin la de las kyang khyad par 'dzin pa yin no
translated: Therefore, when one apprehends this as partless through a single distinction, one apprehends the capacity to benefit the different distinctions. Thus, one apprehends the capacity to benefit the distinctions, and from that, one apprehends the distinctions.

original: // yang na rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan 'dogs pa bzung ba nyid na khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa dang bcas par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // yang na rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan 'dogs pa bzung ba nyid na khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa dang bcas par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, when one apprehends the capacity to benefit the distinctions that is its own nature, one also apprehends the capacity to benefit the distinctions as possessing the capacity to benefit the distinctions.

original: de dag bdag nyid la 'brel phyir //
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid la 'brel phyir //
translated: Because they are related to the self.

original: gcig shes na ni gnyi ga bzung //
analyzed: gcig shes na ni gnyi ga bzung //
translated: When one is apprehended, both are grasped.🔽Here, the method of grasping the qualifier by grasping the qualified has already been explained, so that is not mentioned.

original: zhes bya bas 'dir khyad par dang ldan pa gzung ba'i sgo nas khyad par 'dzin pa'i tshul de ni sngar nyid brjod zin pa des na de ma brjod par khyad par 'ba' zhig bzung ba'i sgo nas khyad par dang ldan par bzung bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'dir khyad par dang ldan pa gzung ba'i sgo nas khyad par 'dzin pa'i tshul de ni sngar nyid brjod zin pa des na de ma brjod par khyad par 'ba' zhig bzung ba'i sgo nas khyad par dang ldan par bzung bar ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of grasping the qualified by grasping the qualifier alone is as follows.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: khyad par ni des nus pas phan gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni des nus pas phan gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The qualifier is the nature of what is to be benefited by that.

original: des na ji ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa bzung na phan gdags par bya ba 'dzin pa de bzhin du des phan gdags par bya ba bzung ba na yang de la phan 'dogs par byed pa 'dzin to //
analyzed: des na ji ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa bzung na phan gdags par bya ba 'dzin pa de bzhin du des phan gdags par bya ba bzung ba na yang de la phan 'dogs par byed pa 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, just as when the benefactor is grasped, the one to be benefited is grasped, likewise, when the one to be benefited is grasped by that, the benefactor is also grasped.

original: des na khyad par bzung na de la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par bzung na de la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa bzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the qualifier is grasped, the ability to benefit it is grasped.

original: tshul 'di nyid kyis nus pa bzung ba na nus pa la phan par byed par dngos po bzung ba yin la khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa la phan pa'i bdag nyid de bzung ba na yang ji ltar phan gdags par bya ba🔽gzung ba'i sgo nas phan 'dogs par byed pa 'dzin pa de bzhin du phan 'dogs par byed par bzung bas kyang phan gdags par @181a * //
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid kyis nus pa bzung ba na nus pa la phan par byed par dngos po bzung ba yin la khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa la phan pa'i bdag nyid de bzung ba na yang ji ltar phan gdags par bya ba gzung ba'i sgo nas phan 'dogs par byed pa 'dzin pa de bzhin du phan 'dogs par byed par bzung bas kyang phan gdags par @181a * //
translated: By this very method, when the capacity is apprehended, the entity that benefits the capacity is apprehended, and when the nature that benefits the capacity that benefits all the differences is apprehended, then just as the benefit is apprehended by the apprehension of that which is to be benefited,🔽in the same way, the benefit is apprehended by the apprehension of that which benefits, and therefore all the capacities that benefit are apprehended by the apprehension of the nature that becomes the benefit of all the capacities.

original: bya ba 'dzin pa'i phyir nus pa thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa bzung bas nus pa thams cad 'dzin pa de lta na yang khyad par thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni de bzung na zhes bya🔽ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba 'dzin pa'i phyir nus pa thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa bzung bas nus pa thams cad 'dzin pa de lta na yang khyad par thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni de bzung na zhes bya🔽ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Even though this is so, all the differences are apprehended.

original: chos la phan 'dogs par byed pa tha dad pas sngar bshad pa'i thal ba spong ba la thug pa med par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: chos la phan 'dogs par byed pa tha dad pas sngar bshad pa'i thal ba spong ba la thug pa med par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the previously explained reductio is inescapable, since the benefit to the object is distinct, he says:

original: chos la phan 'dogs pa tha dad pas na khyad par thams cad bzung bar thal bar 'gyur ba spangs kyang nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa tha mi dad pas slar thal ba po na 'dug go //
analyzed: chos la phan 'dogs pa tha dad pas na khyad par thams cad bzung bar thal bar 'gyur ba spangs kyang nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa tha mi dad pas slar thal ba po na 'dug go //
translated: Since the benefit to the object is distinct, although the absurd consequence of the grasping of all distinctions is avoided, the reductio still remains, since the benefit to the capacity is not distinct.

original: 'on te der yang phan pa tha dad par brtags pa de nyid kyis spong bar byed na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang phan pa tha dad par brtags pa de nyid kyis spong bar byed na /
translated: But if you imagine that the very same thing that is distinct in its benefit to the object avoids the reductio,

original: de'i tshe mthar thug pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe mthar thug pa med do //
translated: then there is no finality.

original: 'di ltar nus pa las phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa tha dad na phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa de yang rang gi bdag nyid kho nas phan gdags par bya ba yin pa des na thal ba de nyid
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa las phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa tha dad na phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa de yang rang gi bdag nyid kho nas phan gdags par bya ba yin pa des na thal ba de nyid
translated: Thus, if the capacity that benefits the object is distinct from the capacity, then the capacity that benefits the capacity that benefits the object is benefited by that capacity that benefits the capacity that benefits the object, only by itself. Therefore, the reductio

original: du 'gyur bas de ltar na der yang tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir khyad par dang de'i nus pa rnams mi 'byor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: du 'gyur bas de ltar na der yang tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir khyad par dang de'i nus pa rnams mi 'byor ba'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, because they are understood to be different, the features and their potential are not combined.

original: mi 'thad pa'i phyir de la phan pa'i bdag nyid khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed par gyur pa khyad par dang ldan pa de gcig pu nam yang khyad par dang nus pa de dag gis mi 'dzin pas /
analyzed: mi 'thad pa'i phyir de la phan pa'i bdag nyid khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed par gyur pa khyad par dang ldan pa de gcig pu nam yang khyad par dang nus pa de dag gis mi 'dzin pas /
translated: Because that is untenable, the singular thing that is the basis of features is never apprehended as possessing those features and potential.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not apprehended as possessing them.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir khyad par dang de'i nus pa dag mi 'thad pa des na nam yang khyad par dang nus pa dag gis khyad par dang ldan pa mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par dang de'i nus pa dag mi 'thad pa des na nam yang khyad par dang nus pa dag gis khyad par dang ldan pa mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the features and their potential are untenable, the singular thing that is the basis of features is never apprehended as possessing those features and potential.

original: khyad par med par 'dzin par byed pa nyid du brjod pa yang khyad par nye bar sgyur bar byed pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa la nye bar sbyor la /
analyzed: khyad par med par 'dzin par byed pa nyid du brjod pa yang khyad par nye bar sgyur bar byed pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa la nye bar sbyor la /
translated: Also, the statement “It is apprehended without features” is applied to the apprehension of that which is modified by features.

original: nus pa dag ni nye bar sgyur ba'i rgyu nyid dam /
analyzed: nus pa dag ni nye bar sgyur ba'i rgyu nyid dam /
translated: Potency is the cause of transformation.🔽

original: 'brel par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa can nyid do //
analyzed: 'brel par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa can nyid do //
translated: The potency is the cause of the transformation of the object, or it is the cause of the connection of the object with the cognition.🔽Therefore, it is the connection.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga'i rang bzhin med pa de nyid kyis 'dzin pa med par gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga'i rang bzhin med pa de nyid kyis 'dzin pa med par gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the absence of the nature of both is clearly shown by the absence of the apprehension of both.

original: des na phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid ma bzung ba ni nus par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa med pas @181b khyad par du yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir de dang ldan par 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid ma bzung ba ni nus par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa med pas @181b khyad par du yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir de dang ldan par 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the nature of the benefit is not apprehended, it is not tenable that there is potency, and since there is no connection, it is not tenable that there is a distinction. Therefore, there is no apprehension of the connection.

original: yang ji ltar khyad par dang de'i nus pa dag mi 'byor zhe na gtan tshigs bshad pa nus pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kho na la mtha' thug pa med pas so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar khyad par dang de'i nus pa dag mi 'byor zhe na gtan tshigs bshad pa nus pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kho na la mtha' thug pa med pas so //
translated: How is it that the distinction and its potency are not connected? The reason is stated: because the other and other potencies are endless.

original: 'brel pa can tha dad pa dang 'brel pa can nyid tha mi dad na yang thal ba de nyid du 'gyur bas der yang de kho na bzhin tha dad pa rtogs par thal bas na thug pa med pa'i phyir mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'brel pa can tha dad pa dang 'brel pa can nyid tha mi dad na yang thal ba de nyid du 'gyur bas der yang de kho na bzhin tha dad pa rtogs par thal bas na thug pa med pa'i phyir mi 'thad do //
translated: If the related are different, and the relation itself is not different, then the same absurd consequence would follow. Therefore, in that case, it would follow, absurdly, that difference would be cognized ad infinitum, and so it is untenable.

original: gal te de lta na nus pa mi 'thad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta na nus pa mi 'thad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is so, then potency is untenable,

original: khyad par bdag ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par bdag ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: but the difference itself is not.

original: 'brel pa med na khyad par dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med na khyad par dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no relation, then differences are untenable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one would not apprehend it as possessing that.

original: des na de ltar gang gi ltar blo khyad par can ni don ces bya ba /
analyzed: des na de ltar gang gi ltar blo khyad par can ni don ces bya ba /
translated: Thus, in this way, the one who says that the cognition of difference is the meaning of the word different

original: khyad par sna tshogs gang la yod //
analyzed: khyad par sna tshogs gang la yod //
translated: and that the various differences exist in that

original: ces bya ba'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa brjod nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa brjod nas /
translated: has been refuted.

original: khyad par sna tshogs nyid don yin pas khyad par sna tshogs can don zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di dgag pa'i phyir re zhig 'di la sngar brjod pa'i skyon med par bshad pa ni yang gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par sna tshogs nyid don yin pas khyad par sna tshogs can don zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di dgag pa'i phyir re zhig 'di la sngar brjod pa'i skyon med par bshad pa ni yang gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In particular, since the various differences are the object, in order to refute this position called “the various differences are the object,” first, in order to explain that the previously stated error does not apply, it is said, “If you say that the object is the various differences, then the object would be the difference alone.”

original: sgra dang shes pa rnams kyi khyad par dag nyi tshe la nye bar sbyor te /
analyzed: sgra dang shes pa rnams kyi khyad par dag nyi tshe la nye bar sbyor te /
translated: The various differences of sound and consciousness are applied to the mere object,

original: yul du byas par 'gyur gyi de'i sgo nas khyad par dang ldan pa yang yul du byed pa ni ma yin na de'i tshe gcig po de khyad par 'ba' zhig la ma 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul du byas par 'gyur gyi de'i sgo nas khyad par dang ldan pa yang yul du byed pa ni ma yin na de'i tshe gcig po de khyad par 'ba' zhig la ma 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: but the object that possesses the difference through that is not the object. At that time, since that single one is not related to the difference alone,

original: med pa'i phyir khyad par dang ldan pa de rtogs pa'i sgo nas khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba brjod pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir khyad par dang ldan pa de rtogs pa'i sgo nas khyad par thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ba brjod pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it does not exist, the statement that all differences are understood through understanding that which possesses the difference would not be tenable.

original: des na ba lang zhes khyad par gcig rtogs pa na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug go //
analyzed: des na ba lang zhes khyad par gcig rtogs pa na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, when one realizes a particular thing, such as a cow, the words impermanent, etc., are applied in order to realize other particulars, such as impermanence.

original: gang gis de rtogs pa'i sgo nas thams cad rtogs par 'gyur pa khyad par dang ldan pa ni rtogs ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de rtogs pa'i sgo nas thams cad rtogs par 'gyur pa khyad par dang ldan pa ni rtogs ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But one does not realize the thing as qualified by the particulars, because of which one would realize everything by realizing that.

original: 'on kyang nyes pa gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes pa gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: However, another fault would ensue, as stated in the following:

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “In that case, it would also be so.”
