original: gal te de dag bdag nyid la 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan pa'i tshul gyis na /🔽'brel pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i phyir khyad par 'ba' zhig rtogs pa @182a * //
analyzed: gal te de dag bdag nyid la 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan pa'i tshul gyis na / 'brel pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i phyir khyad par 'ba' zhig rtogs pa @182a * //
translated: If it is demonstrated that the particulars are related to themselves,

original: na yang khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid de /🔽gcig shes na ni gnyi ga gzung //
analyzed: na yang khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid de / gcig shes na ni gnyi ga gzung //
translated: then when one realizes the particular alone, because the relation is based on both, the thing would be realized as qualified by the particulars.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is stated, “If one knows one, one apprehends both.”

original: bden mod kyang 'di ni de nyid du bstan zin pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa gzhan nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: bden mod kyang 'di ni de nyid du bstan zin pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa gzhan nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: True, but this is a different refutation, because it teaches reality.

original: sgra dag gis khyad par dang ldan pa de ma brjod pa'i phyir rtogs pa po mi 'jug pas sgra sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dag gis khyad par dang ldan pa de ma brjod pa'i phyir rtogs pa po mi 'jug pas sgra sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the one who understands does not engage in the expression of the word, the application of the word is meaningless, because it does not express that which possesses the distinction.

original: gal te khyad par rtogs pa sgra'i don yin gyi 'jug pa ni ma yin pas na ji ltar don med pa yin zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te khyad par rtogs pa sgra'i don yin gyi 'jug pa ni ma yin pas na ji ltar don med pa yin zhe na bshad pa /
translated: If the understanding of the distinction is the meaning of the word, but not the engagement, then how is it meaningless?🔽It is said:

original: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The so-called affirmation and negation, etc.

original: sgrub pa ni sgrub par byed ba'i sgra dum pa yod do zhes bya ba lta bu yin la dgag pa ni med ces dgag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni sgrub par byed ba'i sgra dum pa yod do zhes bya ba lta bu yin la dgag pa ni med ces dgag par byed pa'o //
translated: Affirmation is the word that affirms, like “the pot exists.” Negation is the word that negates, like “it does not exist.”

original: de dag gi tha snyad gdags pa bum pa yod do med do zhes de lta bu'i don rtogs pa gang yin pa'i tha snyad de thams cad ni don med pa'i rten te /
analyzed: de dag gi tha snyad gdags pa bum pa yod do med do zhes de lta bu'i don rtogs pa gang yin pa'i tha snyad de thams cad ni don med pa'i rten te /
translated: All the conventions that are the understanding of the meaning of such expressions, like “the pot exists” and “the pot does not exist,” are meaningless, because

original: rgyu mtshan gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang la yod pa'o //
translated: they are the basis of the reason.

original: bsgrubs pa'am bkag pa'i don bya ba sgrub bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa'am bkag pa'i don bya ba sgrub bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: The proof and the refutation are the reasons for the performance of the function, because they cause the performance of the function that is to be accomplished or that is to be stopped.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ji lta bu'i don yul du gyur pas sgras brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos por rtogs pa de nyid 'di'i brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ji lta bu'i don yul du gyur pas sgras brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos por rtogs pa de nyid 'di'i brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what is said: The very thing that is understood as the object of the meaning, as the thing that is expressed and the expresser, is the object of expression of that.

original: dper na ba zhos shig 'bras bus mchod cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba zhos shig 'bras bus mchod cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “Milk! Fetch the rice!”

original: khyad par rnams kyis ni don bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyis ni don bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Particulars cannot perform the function,🔽because it is not possible to milk the cowness,

original: ba lang nyid bzho ba'am /🔽'bras bu'i rigs nyid mchod par byar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang nyid bzho ba'am / 'bras bu'i rigs nyid mchod par byar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: or to offer the rice-ness in sacrifice.

original: brngo btags bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos pos dum bur gtubs pa'i mthar thug pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brngo btags bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos pos dum bur gtubs pa'i mthar thug pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thing that is to be milked or offered in sacrifice is not established as the final stage of being cut into pieces by the act of milking or offering in sacrifice.

original: sgra'i don 'brel pa med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra'i don 'brel pa med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And the meaning of the word would be unrelated,

original: mes spongs shig ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mes spongs shig ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: like “Put out the fire with milk!”

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa srid pa'i don la sgra 'jug pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa srid pa'i don la sgra 'jug pas na /
translated: Therefore, since the word is applied to the object of engagement,

original: thams cad khyad par dang ldan pa'i yul can nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: thams cad khyad par dang ldan pa'i yul can nyid du rtogs so //
translated: it is understood that all are subjects that possess a qualifier.

original: de gzhan du gyur pa la 'jug na ni de dgos pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzhan du gyur pa la 'jug na ni de dgos pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were applied to the transformation of that, it would not have a purpose.

original: de bshad pa ni nus pa mi brjod pas sgra sbyor ba dag gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni nus pa mi brjod pas sgra sbyor ba dag gis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of the application of words by the explanation that does not express the capacity?

original: de'i dgos pa can ma yin yang rtogs pa ma yin pa des na khyad par nyid tshe'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa can ma yin yang rtogs pa ma yin pa des na khyad par nyid tshe'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Even if it does not have that as its purpose, it is not understood by that, so the qualifier itself is not the object.

original: de ltar na yang khyad par ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang khyad par ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, it would not be a qualifier.

original: rang gis nye bar @182b bsgrub pas gzhan rtogs par byed pa kho na khyad par yin te /
analyzed: rang gis nye bar @182b bsgrub pas gzhan rtogs par byed pa kho na khyad par yin te /
translated: It is a qualifier only when it causes the understanding of another by its own establishment.

original: gzhan du na bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang phan tshun khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang phan tshun khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even pots, etc., would be qualifiers of each other.

original: 'phrod pa 'du bas de ltar 'gyur na ni de khyad par de dang ldan pa dag la khyad par med pas na khyad par med pa kho na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du bas de ltar 'gyur na ni de khyad par de dang ldan pa dag la khyad par med pas na khyad par med pa kho na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then that which possesses that distinction would be without distinction, and thus it would be just without distinction that would be the entity of distinction and that which possesses distinction.

original: khyad par 'ba' zhig rtogs na ni khyad par gyi chos med pas na khyad par nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par 'ba' zhig rtogs na ni khyad par gyi chos med pas na khyad par nyid ma yin no //
translated: If only the distinction were understood, then since the distinguished property would not exist, it would not be a distinction.

original: de bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of that is “If it were so, then that which possesses that distinction would be without distinction.”

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la sgra dang shes pa dag zhugs na ni'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la sgra dang shes pa dag zhugs na ni'o //
translated: If the word and cognition were to engage in some entity other than that,

original: gang gi tshe khyad par las ma rtogs pa'i dngos po la sgra dang shes pa zhugs na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyad par las ma rtogs pa'i dngos po la sgra dang shes pa zhugs na 'gyur ro //
translated: then when the word and cognition engage in the entity that is not understood from the distinction, it would be so.

original: de las tha dad pa la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa la zhugs pa na /
translated: When engaging in that which is different from that,

original: ji ltar de dag la nye bar sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag la nye bar sbyor zhe na /
translated: how are they applied to that?

original: bshad pa / rang gi ngo bo tha dad par gyur pa'i gtso bo 'ga' yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa / rang gi ngo bo tha dad par gyur pa'i gtso bo 'ga' yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: It is said: “Because some principal entity that is different in its own nature becomes a part.”

original: gtso bo de'i yan lag yin pa la ltos nas khyad par zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gtso bo de'i yan lag yin pa la ltos nas khyad par zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called a “distinction” in dependence on being a part of the main point.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Possessing a distinction

original: rang gi ngo bos nges par mi rtogs par khyad par dag nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin par des smra ba rnams kyis khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos nges par mi rtogs par khyad par dag nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin par des smra ba rnams kyis khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: is not ascertained by its own nature, but is to be indicated by the distinctions themselves. This must be accepted by those who speak in this way.

original: de lta ma yin na chos can chos kyis rnam par bcad kyang so sor rang gi ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur te dbyug pa rnam par bcad pa'i dbyug pa can bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos can chos kyis rnam par bcad kyang so sor rang gi ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur te dbyug pa rnam par bcad pa'i dbyug pa can bzhin no //
translated: Otherwise, even if the subject is eliminated by the predicate, it would be ascertained as having its own nature, just as the stick-possessor is eliminated by the stick.

original: ba lang ngo zhes rtogs pa na ni dbyug pa'i rang bzhin las skyes bu bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i ba lang nyid dang ldan ba 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: ba lang ngo zhes rtogs pa na ni dbyug pa'i rang bzhin las skyes bu bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i ba lang nyid dang ldan ba 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: When one understands “cow,” just as a person is understood to be born from the nature of a stick, there is no understanding of any possessor of cowhood that is not of that nature.

original: des na 'di'i rang gi ngo bos mi rtogs pas khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin dang ldan par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di'i rang gi ngo bos mi rtogs pas khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin dang ldan par snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since its own nature is not understood, it appears to possess the nature of a distinction.

original: des na khyad par la gnas pa'i sgra dang rtogs pa dag de'i ngo bo nyid du khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs pa las khyad par dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir 'di dag ni gtso bo de'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na khyad par la gnas pa'i sgra dang rtogs pa dag de'i ngo bo nyid du khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs pa las khyad par dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir 'di dag ni gtso bo de'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the word and the cognition that abide in the particular are the essence of that, and the cognition that is endowed with the particular engages the particular. Thus, these are the limbs of that principal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig la dang 'ga' zhes khyad par dang ldan pa nges par rtogs pa med pa'i ngo bor bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig la dang 'ga' zhes khyad par dang ldan pa nges par rtogs pa med pa'i ngo bor bstan to //
translated: For that very reason, it is taught that the particular is not the nature of the cognition that definitely realizes the particular.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa sgra'i yul ma yin na ni tshul 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa sgra'i yul ma yin na ni tshul 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: If the particular were not the object of words, this method would not exist.

original: sgra dag gis de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dag gis de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by “because of the words.”

original: gal te de la 'jug par ma grub pa'i @183a * //
analyzed: gal te de la 'jug par ma grub pa'i @183a * //
translated: If it is not established that the particular is engaged by words,

original: phyir khyad par dang ldan pa sgra'i yul ma yin mod /
analyzed: phyir khyad par dang ldan pa sgra'i yul ma yin mod /
translated: then it is not the object of words.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar khyad par dag tu mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar khyad par dag tu mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: However, since it is realized in that way by conceptual perception and so on, how could it not be a particular?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la de ltar snang na 'o na der khyad par can rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i skyon du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la de ltar snang na 'o na der khyad par can rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i skyon du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: If it appears in that way to one who has discursive thought, then how could the fault of the connection with the realization of the qualifier not arise?🔽Since the word is possible, who can stop the word from engaging in that way?

original: de la sgra srid pa'i phyir sgra de ltar 'jug pa yang sus 'gog / sgra sbyar ba don med par 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa'i nyes par de ni med de shes par byas pas mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sgra srid pa'i phyir sgra de ltar 'jug pa yang sus 'gog / sgra sbyar ba don med par 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa'i nyes par de ni med de shes par byas pas mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault that you mentioned, namely, that the application of the word would be meaningless, does not apply, because the word indicates the object that is to be known.

original: sgras ni khyad par mtshon par byed cing rtogs par byed la shes par byed pa'i khyad par des ni sgra de'i brjod bya ma yin yang khyad par dang ldan pa mtshon par byed de gang g'a'i sgra'i zhes bya ba'i gang g'a'i don gyis 'gram bzhin no //
analyzed: sgras ni khyad par mtshon par byed cing rtogs par byed la shes par byed pa'i khyad par des ni sgra de'i brjod bya ma yin yang khyad par dang ldan pa mtshon par byed de gang g'a'i sgra'i zhes bya ba'i gang g'a'i don gyis 'gram bzhin no //
translated: The word indicates and causes one to understand the qualifier, and the qualifier that causes one to understand indicates that which possesses the qualifier, even though it is not the object of the word, just as the word “Gaṅgā” indicates the bank of the Gaṅgā.

original: gang g'a 'bod do zhes bya ba ni rgyun la mi srid pas na des mtshon pa'i 'gram du yin par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang g'a 'bod do zhes bya ba ni rgyun la mi srid pas na des mtshon pa'i 'gram du yin par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is impossible to say “The Gaṅgā is called,” one understands that it is the bank that is indicated by that word.

original: mtshon pa'i sgra'i byed pa'am don gyis byed pa yin pa ni pha rol po rang ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon pa'i sgra'i byed pa'am don gyis byed pa yin pa ni pha rol po rang ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The opponent should understand the function of the word that indicates or the function of the meaning just as he himself accepts it.

original: de bas na ba lang la sogs pa'i rigs rjod par byed pa dag gis kyang mtshon pa'i stobs kyis dogs bzhin du 'brel pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na ba lang la sogs pa'i rigs rjod par byed pa dag gis kyang mtshon pa'i stobs kyis dogs bzhin du 'brel pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even those who express the class of cow, etc. will understand the possession of a specific relation by the power of indication.

original: der slob dpon skabs rnyed nas langs pa ni /
analyzed: der slob dpon skabs rnyed nas langs pa ni /
translated: The master who has found an opportunity to speak in this context rises up.

original: thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, “The consequence is the same.”

original: khyad par dang ldan par brjod pa la bshad pa'i thal ba gang yin pa de ni khyad par 'ba' zhig brjod pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan par brjod pa la bshad pa'i thal ba gang yin pa de ni khyad par 'ba' zhig brjod pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The consequence that was explained for the expression of possession of a distinction is the same for the expression of a mere distinction.

original: ji ltar mtshungs pa de bshad pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshungs pa de bshad pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of how it is the same is, “For example.”

original: re zhig khyad par gyis nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa de ni 'dis bdag nyid thams cad dpyis phyin par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig khyad par gyis nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa de ni 'dis bdag nyid thams cad dpyis phyin par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: First, that which is indicated by a distinction is understood to be complete in itself.

original: des na de khyad par dag gis nye bar mtshon pa ni zhes 'thad par 'gyur ba so na 'dug par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de khyad par dag gis nye bar mtshon pa ni zhes 'thad par 'gyur ba so na 'dug par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that the word is qualified by the qualifications.🔽If the function of the qualification is to qualify, then the word is qualified by the qualification.

original: khyad par rnams kyi nye bar mtshon pa'i byed pa de'i mthar thug pa yin na /
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyi nye bar mtshon pa'i byed pa de'i mthar thug pa yin na /
translated: If the function of the qualification is to qualify, then the word is qualified by the qualification.

original: gcig gis nye bar mtshon pa yang bdag nyid thams cad nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig gis nye bar mtshon pa yang bdag nyid thams cad nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: If the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.

original: gang gi tshe sgras khyad par gcig gi sgo nas nye bar mtshon pa de'i tshe 'di la khyad par gzhan dag gi sgo nas @183b mtshon par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma lus kyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgras khyad par gcig gi sgo nas nye bar mtshon pa de'i tshe 'di la khyad par gzhan dag gi sgo nas @183b mtshon par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma lus kyi /
translated: When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.

original: 'on kyang sgra gcig kho nas khyad par gcig gi sgo nas nye bar mtshon par byed pa na /🔽bdag nyid thams cad kyis nye bar mtshon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra gcig kho nas khyad par gcig gi sgo nas nye bar mtshon par byed pa na / bdag nyid thams cad kyis nye bar mtshon par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.

original: med na med pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: med na med pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.🔽When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.

original: mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa med pa brten nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa med pa brten nas 'jug ste /
translated: When the word is qualified by one qualification, then the word is qualified in its entirety.

original: des na khyad par rnams ni med na med pa nyid kyis 'di'i mtshon par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na khyad par rnams ni med na med pa nyid kyis 'di'i mtshon par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the distinctions are the indicators of this, because they are not without it.

original: 'di'i med na med par yang gcig gis yin gyi 'dir 'ga' zhig cha 'ga' zhig gis ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i med na med par yang gcig gis yin gyi 'dir 'ga' zhig cha 'ga' zhig gis ma yin no //
translated: And it is not that this is without one of them, but not without some of them.

original: med na med pas mtshon par 'gyur ba na 'dir khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang bdag nyid thams cad 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na med pas mtshon par 'gyur ba na 'dir khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang bdag nyid thams cad 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is indicated by the absence of something, then all of its nature is indicated by the absence of one of its distinctions.

original: gtan tshigs de bas na thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de bas na thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reductio remains.

original: blo la gnas pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs na yang khyad par gcig gi sgo nas khyad par mtha' dag 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo la gnas pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs na yang khyad par gcig gi sgo nas khyad par mtha' dag 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one understands the nature of something as it is, along with the distinctions that are present to the mind, one still grasps the totality of the distinctions by means of one of the distinctions.

original: blo la gnas pa de yang sgras rjod par byed pas byed kyang rung mtshan nyid 'jug pas kyang rung ste khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: blo la gnas pa de yang sgras rjod par byed pas byed kyang rung mtshan nyid 'jug pas kyang rung ste khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: And whether that which is present to the mind is indicated by the word or by the application of a definition, there is no difference.

original: de brjod pa ni 'di sgras nye bar mtshon kyang rung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni 'di sgras nye bar mtshon kyang rung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “or by the word” means that it is indicated by the word.

original: 'dis ni rjod par byed pa'i khyad par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjod par byed pa'i khyad par brjod do //
translated: This indicates the difference in the expression.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa'i khyad par dag gis nye bar mtshon kyang rung zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa'i khyad par dag gis nye bar mtshon kyang rung zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase even if it is indicated by the difference that is illustrated by it indicates the definition.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang de la rtogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang de la rtogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Because there is no difference in the understanding of that, whether it is indicated or not,

original: re zhig de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase at that time explains this.

original: 'dir mtshon pa la mngon par zhen pa med de rnam pa gang yang rung bas kyang khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs par khas blangs pa na khyad par thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mtshon pa la mngon par zhen pa med de rnam pa gang yang rung bas kyang khyad par dang ldan pa rtogs par khas blangs pa na khyad par thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Here, there is no attachment to the illustration, because when one accepts the understanding of the difference that is possessed in any way, it follows that all differences are apprehended.

original: re zhig khyad par dag par rtogs par smra ba thams cad kyis kyang gsal bar rtogs pa la ltos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: re zhig khyad par dag par rtogs par smra ba thams cad kyis kyang gsal bar rtogs pa la ltos par bya ba yin te /
translated: For, all who maintain that there is the understanding of the difference must depend upon the understanding of the manifestation,

original: gzhan du na sgras don rtogs par mthar phyin par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sgras don rtogs par mthar phyin par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise the understanding of the meaning by the word would not be completed.

original: des na rnam pa gang gis de ltar 'dod de /
analyzed: des na rnam pa gang gis de ltar 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, by what aspect is it maintained that it is not so?

original: thams cad du nyes pa 'di khyad par med do //
analyzed: thams cad du nyes pa 'di khyad par med do //
translated: This fault is the same in all cases.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning “Therefore” concludes the discussion.

original: de yang skabs kyi don nye bar sdud pa ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //🔽khyad par gcig pa la phan par byed @184a * //
analyzed: de yang skabs kyi don nye bar sdud pa ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no // khyad par gcig pa la phan par byed @184a * //
translated: The verse of summary is a summary of the topic under discussion.

original: pa gang yin pa shes pa'i yul du gyur pa'i phyir bzung na ni /
analyzed: pa gang yin pa shes pa'i yul du gyur pa'i phyir bzung na ni /
translated: If the benefit that is the same in all cases is the object of the cognition that apprehends it,

original: mthong ba de gzhi de la ltos te /
analyzed: mthong ba de gzhi de la ltos te /
translated: then the seeing of that benefit is dependent on that basis.

original: khyad par gzhan gyi yul can gyis ma mthong ba'i phan pa de dag ni gzhan min no //🔽gal te de ltar yin mod /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan gyi yul can gyis ma mthong ba'i phan pa de dag ni gzhan min no // gal te de ltar yin mod /
translated: The benefit that is not seen by the cognition that has a different object is not different from that.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, what follows from that?

original: bshad pa gtan tshigs de'i phyir phan par byed pa mthong ba'i der ma mthong ba'i phan pa med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bshad pa gtan tshigs de'i phyir phan par byed pa mthong ba'i der ma mthong ba'i phan pa med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: The explanation is this: because of that reason, the benefit that is seen in that is not the benefit that is not seen.

original: de las kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽de bzung na ni thams cad bzung //
analyzed: de las kyang cir 'gyur zhe na / de bzung na ni thams cad bzung //
translated: What follows from that?

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: The verse says, “If that is apprehended, all is apprehended.”

original: rang gi ngo bo khyad par dang ldan pa la thams cad ma yin pa mi srid de cha med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo khyad par dang ldan pa la thams cad ma yin pa mi srid de cha med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible that a thing with a specific nature not be everything, because it is partless.

original: des na khyad par thams cad kyis thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na khyad par thams cad kyis thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, everything would be everything.🔽Thus, when the opponent is refuted in this way, that is, that the conceptual consciousnesses are subjects that ascertain by the power of the engagement of another valid knowledge, the opponent fears that the same thing will happen here with respect to perception.

original: des na de ltar tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa rnams sgrub pa'i yul can yin pa bzlog pa na pha rol po dag 'dir yang mngon sum bzhin du 'dzin par dogs par byed pas de'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya
analyzed: des na de ltar tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa rnams sgrub pa'i yul can yin pa bzlog pa na pha rol po dag 'dir yang mngon sum bzhin du 'dzin par dogs par byed pas de'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya
translated: Therefore, in order to anticipate that fear, it says, “If you say . . .”

original: ba'o // ji ltar khyod kyi phyogs la mngon sum gyis chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don bzung yang 'khrul pas rnam pa bskal pas na tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pas kyang thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi
analyzed: ba'o // ji ltar khyod kyi phyogs la mngon sum gyis chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don bzung yang 'khrul pas rnam pa bskal pas na tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pas kyang thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi
translated: Just as in your system, although perception apprehends an object that is the nature of all phenomena, because it is mistaken with respect to aspect, it relies on another valid knowledge, in the same way, conceptual consciousnesses also, because they are mistaken with respect to the object, rely on another valid knowledge.

original: dngos po bzung ba 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin mtha' dag ma nges pa gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir nyes pa 'ga' zhig med do //
analyzed: dngos po bzung ba 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin mtha' dag ma nges pa gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir nyes pa 'ga' zhig med do //
translated: Because of the power of error in apprehending a thing, one does not ascertain its entire nature, and so one engages in other [means of valid cognition]. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang khyad par can bzung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang khyad par can bzung ba de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when one apprehends a thing by way of a single attribute,

original: gal te yang khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa de gzung ba'i phyir khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa 'thob pa de lta na yang khyad par gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa'am khyad par gzhan la 'khrul pa yod pas de nges par mi 'dzin
analyzed: gal te yang khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa de gzung ba'i phyir khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa 'thob pa de lta na yang khyad par gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa'am khyad par gzhan la 'khrul pa yod pas de nges par mi 'dzin
translated: even if one does apprehend all the attributes because of apprehending that which benefits all the attributes, one still does not apprehend that thing with certainty because of the existence of error with respect to other attributes.

original: pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan la ltos so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan la ltos so //
translated: Therefore, one relies on another means of valid cognition.

original: des na khyad par gzhan de rtogs par byed pas de la 'jug pa na de la 'khrul pa zlog par byed pas go bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: des na khyad par gzhan de rtogs par byed pas de la 'jug pa na de la 'khrul pa zlog par byed pas go bar byed pa yin /
translated: Thus, when one engages in that [means of valid cognition] in order to understand that other attribute, it is a means of understanding because it prevents error with respect to that [attribute].

original: des na khyad par de dang de'i sgo nas don rtogs par byed pa'i tshad mas gzhan rnams de srid tsam gyi yul can gyi 'khrul pa zlog par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma gzhan gyi yul rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par de dang de'i sgo nas don rtogs par byed pa'i tshad mas gzhan rnams de srid tsam gyi yul can gyi 'khrul pa zlog par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma gzhan gyi yul rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the valid cognition that causes one to understand the object in terms of this or that distinction, by merely the extent of reversing the error of other subjects, does not cause one to understand the object of another valid cognition.

original: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya bas ni rnam par 'grel @184b to //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya bas ni rnam par 'grel @184b to //
translated: With If one thinks thus, he comments.

original: gal te de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs so //
translated: With Even if that is so, etc., he replies.

original: rnam par rtog pa gcig gis bzung ba la yang 'khrul pas gzhan bzlog pa'i don du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du grub po //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gcig gis bzung ba la yang 'khrul pas gzhan bzlog pa'i don du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du grub po //
translated: Even with respect to what is apprehended by a single conceptual cognition, the cognition that engages in reversing error for the sake of reversing another is established as having a negated object.

original: 'di ltar 'khrul pa de bzlog pa ni des sgro btags pa'i don dang tha mi dad par bzlog pa'i sgo nas don rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khrul pa de bzlog pa ni des sgro btags pa'i don dang tha mi dad par bzlog pa'i sgo nas don rtogs par byed la /
translated: In this way, the reversal of that error is the understanding of the object by way of the reversal that is not different from the object superimposed by that.

original: 'di la sngon po ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi sel ba'i yul can gyi dngos po yang 'di kho nar zad do //
analyzed: 'di la sngon po ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi sel ba'i yul can gyi dngos po yang 'di kho nar zad do //
translated: In this regard, the object of the cognition that excludes non-blue and so on is just this.

original: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is this:

original: kho bo cag gis rtogs pa'i ngo bos yul can du mi 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rtogs pa'i ngo bos yul can du mi 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: We do not accept that the object is in the form of an awareness.

original: khyed de ltar 'dod pas ni dngos po yul can nyid kyang sel ba'i sgo nas yin par brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyed de ltar 'dod pas ni dngos po yul can nyid kyang sel ba'i sgo nas yin par brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Since you accept it in that way, you would say that the object is an entity that is the object of exclusion.

original: rang gi gzhung gis 'di sngon po ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung gis 'di sngon po ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the awareness that is produced by your own text, which is understood as “This is not non-blue.”

original: de 'khrul pa bzlog pa na don rtogs par byed pa sel ba'i yul can du 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de 'khrul pa bzlog pa na don rtogs par byed pa sel ba'i yul can du 'gyur mod /
translated: When the error is eliminated, it becomes an awareness that has an object of exclusion.

original: gang gi yul la 'khrul pas bskal pa na de 'jug pa de go ji ltar gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi yul la 'khrul pas bskal pa na de 'jug pa de go ji ltar gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin zhe na /
translated: When the object is distant due to error, how can it be an awareness that has an object of exclusion?

original: de las gzhan pa'am zhes smos so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'am zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “or something other than that.”

original: ji ltar de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin pa de bzhin du de las gzhan yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin pa de bzhin du de las gzhan yang grub pa yin no //
translated: Just as it is the subject that eliminates that, in the same way, it is established as being different from that.

original: ji ltar zhe na sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: How is it? It is said, “without superimposition.”

original: sngar zhugs pa sel par byed pa nyid ma yin yang sgro 'dogs yod na 'di med pa nyid kyis sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: sngar zhugs pa sel par byed pa nyid ma yin yang sgro 'dogs yod na 'di med pa nyid kyis sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: Even though it is not the eliminator of what has already been engaged, it is the subject that eliminates by the absence of that when there is superimposition.

original: mthong ba 'ga' la shes pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba 'ga' la shes pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As was previously explained, “the cognition of something seen, etc.”

original: 'grel pa ni 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'grel pa ni 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The commentary is “the reversal of error.”

original: 'dis ni de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can grub ces bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can grub ces bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains “it is established as the subject that eliminates that.”

original: de las gzhan pa'am /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'am /
translated: “Different from that”

original: de dang 'dra ba zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: or “similar to that” is explained.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ste gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub ces 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ste gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub ces 'brel to //
translated: “It is also like that” is connected, “it is established as the subject that eliminates the other.”

original: sgro 'dogs med pa'i yul la ni zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs med pa'i yul la ni zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of “in the absence of superimposition” is

original: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Without superimposition” means without the superimposition of a universal.

original: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i yul la 'jug pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis ston pa ni gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i yul la 'jug pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis ston pa ni gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement that the object of conceptual cognition is engaged by means of the forward and reverse pervasion is “Whatever is . . .”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //🔽des na de ltar gzhan gyis @185a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o // des na de ltar gzhan gyis @185a * //
translated: “Therefore” concludes the argument.

original: brjod pa'i lan gyis tshul khas blangs nas gzhan sel ba'i yul can du thal ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i lan gyis tshul khas blangs nas gzhan sel ba'i yul can du thal ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having accepted the opponent’s response, Dharmakīrti states the absurd consequence that conceptual cognition is a subject that engages its object through exclusion.

original: de ni 'di la mngon sum dang mtshungs pa nyid srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang ngo bo gang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ni 'di la mngon sum dang mtshungs pa nyid srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang ngo bo gang zhes smos so //
translated: To show that it is impossible for conceptual cognition to be similar to perception, Dharmakīrti states, “Moreover, the object of conceptual cognition . . .”

original: rnam par rtog pas khyad par gyi sgo nas don la 'jug pa na don bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas khyad par gyi sgo nas don la 'jug pa na don bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: When conceptual cognition engages its object by means of a distinguishing feature, it apprehends the object in its entirety.

original: de 'khrul pas de ltar nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum dang 'dra ba'i tshul 'di ni rnam par rtog pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: de 'khrul pas de ltar nges par ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum dang 'dra ba'i tshul 'di ni rnam par rtog pa la mi srid do //
translated: Since it is mistaken, it does not ascertain its object as it is. This way of being similar to perception is impossible for conceptual cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pas khyad par thams cad kyi yul la phan pa sgrub par byed pa'i don bdag nyid thams cad bzung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi srid de rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul rnam par ma btags pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas khyad par thams cad kyi yul la phan pa sgrub par byed pa'i don bdag nyid thams cad bzung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi srid de rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul rnam par ma btags pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible to say that the conceptual thought apprehends the entire object, which is the basis for the establishment of all the distinctions.

original: myong ba myong bzhin par gyur pa rnam pa ji zhig ltar nges pa ni rnam par rtog par brjod do //
analyzed: myong ba myong bzhin par gyur pa rnam pa ji zhig ltar nges pa ni rnam par rtog par brjod do //
translated: The conceptual thought is said to be certain in the sense that it experiences the object in a certain way, as it has been apprehended.

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for a conceptual thought to be uncertain.

original: des na khyad par so so'i rang gi ngo bo dang de la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du nges pa med par khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa rnam par rtog pas bzung ba yin no zhes ji ltar brjod
analyzed: des na khyad par so so'i rang gi ngo bo dang de la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du nges pa med par khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa rnam par rtog pas bzung ba yin no zhes ji ltar brjod
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that the conceptual thought apprehends the object as possessing the distinction that is the basis for the establishment of all the distinctions, without being certain as to the individual nature of each distinction and its role in the establishment of that object?

original: / 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i myong ba nas dngos po la snang ba skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin yang bum pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la rig pa na /
analyzed: / 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i myong ba nas dngos po la snang ba skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin yang bum pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la rig pa na /
translated: Thus, the nature of the object, such as a pot, is the nature of its own entity, which is the experience of the object and the momentary nature of the object. However, when a pot, etc. is cognized by conceptual thought,

original: skad cig ma nyid du ma nges pa dis na skad cig ma nyid kyis rtogs pa logs su btsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du ma nges pa dis na skad cig ma nyid kyis rtogs pa logs su btsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: the momentary nature is not ascertained. Therefore, the momentary nature must be sought elsewhere for understanding.

original: des na gang rtogs pa na ji ltar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de ni de ltar de'i yul du brjod pa na ma nges pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: des na gang rtogs pa na ji ltar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de ni de ltar de'i yul du brjod pa na ma nges pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid ma yin na /
translated: Thus, when something is cognized, it becomes the object of conceptual thought in that way. When it is expressed as its object, if it is not ascertained, it is not the object of conceptual thought.

original: de ji ltar rnam par rtog pas ma rtogs pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam par rtog pas ma rtogs pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is not cognized by conceptual thought become the object of conceptual thought?

original: nges pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: The phrase by the ascertained and so on is the commentary.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rang gi don rtogs pa ni 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rang gi don rtogs pa ni 'di kho na yin te /
translated: This is the very understanding of the object by conceptual thoughts.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa der nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa der nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the determination of that concept.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa tsam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa tsam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a concept has the nature of mere determination.

original: des na gang zhig nges pa ma yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di lta @185b bu'o zhes nges par ma byas pa de ni rnam par brtags pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na gang zhig nges pa ma yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di lta @185b bu'o zhes nges par ma byas pa de ni rnam par brtags pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, if something is not determined, it is not a concept. Thus, if it is not ascertained as being such and such, it is not conceptualized.

original: de bshad pa ni gal te de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni gal te de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: if it is that, etc.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du ma nges na na des na de bzhin du gzhan yang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du ma nges na na des na de bzhin du gzhan yang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Just as it is not another aspect, so it is not determined by that. Thus, it is not determined as being such and such.

original: 'on te ma nges kyang bzung ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges kyang bzung ba yin na /
translated: But if it is not determined, it is apprehended.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang ci ste ma bzung /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang ci ste ma bzung /
translated: Why is another aspect not apprehended?

original: des na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there is an absurd consequence:

original: ma nges pa yang yul yin na /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang yul yin na /
translated: If an undetermined object exists,

original: rnam par rtog pa gcig gi yul yang don thams cad yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gcig gi yul yang don thams cad yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the object of a single concept would be all objects.

original: ma nges pa yang bzung bar pha rol po dag gis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang bzung bar pha rol po dag gis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opponent accepts that it is also apprehended as indefinite.

original: 'di kho na zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa gzhan bzlog pa'i phyir nges par bzung ba'i dngos po khyad par can gcig gi sgo nas 'dzin pa na gal te khyad par mtha' dag 'phen par byed pa'i bdag nyid du bzung mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di kho na zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa gzhan bzlog pa'i phyir nges par bzung ba'i dngos po khyad par can gcig gi sgo nas 'dzin pa na gal te khyad par mtha' dag 'phen par byed pa'i bdag nyid du bzung mod kyi /
translated: If you say that when one apprehends a particular thing as definite, as in “this alone,” because it excludes other aspects,

original: de lta yang 'khrul pas nges par mi zin to zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta yang 'khrul pas nges par mi zin to zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: and if you say that because of error, it is not ascertained, that is untenable.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pas thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid de bzung ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pas thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid de bzung ba ni /
translated: If you apprehend that as having the nature of assisting everything,

original: 'di ltar na bzung bar 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar na bzung bar 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: then it would be apprehended in this way.

original: gal te thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du nges na'o //
analyzed: gal te thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du nges na'o //
translated: If it were ascertained as assisting everything,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because conceptual thought has a definite object.

original: khyad par thams cad ma nges par ni khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad ma nges par ni khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In particular, since there is no apprehension of all the particulars as being helpful, there is no apprehension of all the particulars.

original: sgra dang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa don med pa 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sgra dang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa don med pa 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: It is quite reasonable that the application of sound and other validating cognitions is purposeless.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis sgrub pa'i ngo bos don 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la re zhig brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis sgrub pa'i ngo bos don 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la re zhig brtsad pa med do //
translated: If it is said that the nature of the object is apprehended by direct perception, then there is no dispute.

original: des na 'dir yang khyad par tha dad pa'i phyogs thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i don du bzung na khyad par thams cad bzung ba ci ste mi rtsod ce na /
analyzed: des na 'dir yang khyad par tha dad pa'i phyogs thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i don du bzung na khyad par thams cad bzung ba ci ste mi rtsod ce na /
translated: But why is it not disputed that if the object is apprehended as being helpful to all the different particulars, then all the particulars are apprehended?

original: de ltar ni brtsad par mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar ni brtsad par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be disputed in this way,

original: don khyad par bral bar smra ba rang gi phyogs la yang cha shas kyi 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir don gyi chos su gyur pa'i rgyu nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs par khas blangs par bya bas des rgyu bzung ba na 'bras bu 'dzin par thal par ji ltar
analyzed: don khyad par bral bar smra ba rang gi phyogs la yang cha shas kyi 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir don gyi chos su gyur pa'i rgyu nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs par khas blangs par bya bas des rgyu bzung ba na 'bras bu 'dzin par thal par ji ltar
translated: because even in the case of one’s own position, which maintains that the object is devoid of particulars, there is no apprehension of parts. Therefore, it must be accepted that the cause, which is the property of the object, is understood by direct perception. Thus, when the cause is apprehended, how can it follow that the effect is apprehended?

original: mi 'gyur / 'bras bu 'dzin pa na yang rgyu bzung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur / 'bras bu 'dzin pa na yang rgyu bzung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: No, because it follows that when the effect is apprehended, the cause is also apprehended.

original: gal te der 'bras bu la phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid du rgyu bzung ba na 'bras bu mi 'dzin @186a * //
analyzed: gal te der 'bras bu la phan 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid du rgyu bzung ba na 'bras bu mi 'dzin @186a * //
translated: If the cause is apprehended in the form of a benefit to the effect, but the effect is not apprehended,

original: na ni khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed pa bzung ba na khyad par 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: na ni khyad par la phan 'dogs par byed pa bzung ba na khyad par 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can the cause be apprehended when it is a benefit to the qualifier, but the qualifier is not apprehended?

original: nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: de nas 'brel pa can 'dzin pa de'i yan lag nyid la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas 'brel pa can 'dzin pa de'i yan lag nyid la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the statement “there is no error in the apprehension of the related object”

original: rnam par rtog pa'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i chos yin gyi /
translated: is a conceptual phenomenon.

original: nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of experience,

original: de ni rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the apprehension of the nature of the object just as it is.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of an entity is not dependent on another nature.

original: des ni ji ltar rgyu nyid ni dngos po tsam gyis mthar phyin pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid 'bras bu la mi ltos pa de bzhin du de'i 'dzin pa yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa kho na'i 'bras bu'i khyad par la ltos🔽pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar rgyu nyid ni dngos po tsam gyis mthar phyin pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid 'bras bu la mi ltos pa de bzhin du de'i 'dzin pa yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa kho na'i 'bras bu'i khyad par la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the apprehension of that cause is the result of the mere awareness of the intrinsic nature of the cause, not dependent on the result.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni me la sogs pa so so rang gi rnam pa gzhan gyis rgyu nyid du ma grub pa na me la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa me la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag la 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par du gyur🔽pa rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni me la sogs pa so so rang gi rnam pa gzhan gyis rgyu nyid du ma grub pa na me la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa me la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag la 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par du gyur pa rtogs par byed do //
translated: When conceptual thought is not established as the cause of each individual aspect such as fire, the conceptual thought of fire realizes the aspects of fire, etc., as distinguished by the distinction of the result.

original: des na 'di ni rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis nyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di ni rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis nyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, this is a fault of conceptual thought itself,

original: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of direct perception.

original: 'di pha rol po dag rnam par rtog pa dang nyams su myong pa gnyis kyi rtogs pa'i byed pa mi 'dra ba ma rtogs pas ni ji ltar zhes rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di pha rol po dag rnam par rtog pa dang nyams su myong pa gnyis kyi rtogs pa'i byed pa mi 'dra ba ma rtogs pas ni ji ltar zhes rtsod par byed do //
translated: The opponent argues, “How can you say that?” because he does not understand the difference between the two kinds of activity of cognition, namely, conceptualization and experience.

original: rnam par rtog pas ma nges pa 'dzin par khas len na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ma nges pa 'dzin par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that conceptual cognition apprehends an object that is not ascertained,

original: da ni rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi mngon sum ji snyed pas kyang ma nges pa ji ltar bzung ba yin /
analyzed: da ni rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi mngon sum ji snyed pas kyang ma nges pa ji ltar bzung ba yin /
translated: then how is it that even perception apprehends an object that is not ascertained?

original: de la yang nges pa las gzhan pa'i byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de la yang nges pa las gzhan pa'i byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Moreover, there is no activity of perception other than ascertaining its object.

original: des na khyod kyi don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa yang ji ltar mi 'gal /
analyzed: des na khyod kyi don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa yang ji ltar mi 'gal /
translated: Therefore, how can you avoid the contradiction of saying that the nature of the object is one and so on?

original: de skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa don gyi ngo bo nyid mtha' dag ni nges pa yod pa ma yin la ma nges pa yang gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa don gyi ngo bo nyid mtha' dag ni nges pa yod pa ma yin la ma nges pa yang gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: You may ask, “How can the entire nature of the object, such as its momentariness, be neither ascertained nor apprehended?”

original: de bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To respond to this, it is said:

original: mngon sum ni gang gi yang nges par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni gang gi yang nges par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Perception does not ascertain anything.

original: rnam par rtog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not conceptualize.

original: mngon sum ni 'ga' yang rnam par rtog par byed pa ma yin pas mngon sum la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rig pa'i byed pa med do //
analyzed: mngon sum ni 'ga' yang rnam par rtog par byed pa ma yin pas mngon sum la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rig pa'i byed pa med do //
translated: Since no perception whatsoever conceptualizes, perception does not have the activity of cognition that is associated with conceptualization.🔽If that is so, then how does it cognize?

original: 'o na ji ltar rig par byed pa yin zhe na des zhes smos te mngon sum @186b des gang zhig 'dzin pa de yang nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rig par byed pa yin zhe na des zhes smos te mngon sum @186b des gang zhig 'dzin pa de yang nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The response is “by it,” because that which is apprehended by that perception is not ascertained.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is it?

original: des 'dzin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni snang bas so //
analyzed: des 'dzin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni snang bas so //
translated: The response is “it is said to be apprehended by it, because it appears to it.”

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te dngos po rig pa ni dngos po gsal pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te dngos po rig pa ni dngos po gsal pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is what is being said: the object of cognition is the clear object, because it is the object that appears to cognition.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no other activity of cognition.

original: gsal ba'i chos kyis ma zin par yang gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /🔽de ni shes pa kho na'i mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i chos kyis ma zin par yang gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te / de ni shes pa kho na'i mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does the object become clear without being grasped by the quality of clarity.🔽That is the definition of consciousness itself.

original: shes pa'i chos kyis zin pa'i yang shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sngon po'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i chos kyis zin pa'i yang shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sngon po'o //
translated: The object is blue because it is grasped by the quality of consciousness, and it is consciousness itself.

original: rnam pa gsal bzhin du shes par gyur pas na sngon po gsal pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsal bzhin du shes par gyur pas na sngon po gsal pa yin no //
translated: Since it becomes cognition while having a clear aspect, it is a clear blue.

original: gsal bzhin pa nyid ni gzhan gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsal bzhin pa nyid ni gzhan gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since it is clear, it is not tenable that it is the object of another cognition.

original: nus pa bzhin du rang gi gnas lugs yin par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa bzhin du rang gi gnas lugs yin par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory that it is the mode of being of itself, like a potency.

original: de yang gsal ba zhes bya ba brjod pa gang yin pas te /
analyzed: de yang gsal ba zhes bya ba brjod pa gang yin pas te /
translated: Moreover, it is clear in the sense that it is expressed as clear.

original: des de lta bur gyur pas 'di don rig pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni snang bas dngos po 'dzin pa yin no //🔽mngon sum ni gang gi yang nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod zin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: des de lta bur gyur pas 'di don rig pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni snang bas dngos po 'dzin pa yin no // mngon sum ni gang gi yang nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod zin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since it is like that, it is the object of awareness, and therefore it is the apprehension of an object by appearance.🔽Isn’t it stated that perception is not a determiner of anything?

original: de ji ltar na nges pa ni ma yin no zhes yang brjod ce na brjod pa mngon sum ni gang gis yang nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod na gzhan dag mngon sum rig pa'i byed pa dang bral bar go bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji ltar na nges pa ni ma yin no zhes yang brjod ce na brjod pa mngon sum ni gang gis yang nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod na gzhan dag mngon sum rig pa'i byed pa dang bral bar go bar 'gyur te /
translated: How can it be said that it is not a determiner? It is stated that perception is not a determiner of anything, but others understand that perception is devoid of activity.

original: des na des gang zhig 'dzin pa zhes bya bas rig pa'i bdag nyid du sgrub pa nyid bstan te nges pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas mi 'dod pa bkag nas der snang ba las so zhes bya bas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa nyid bstan pa
analyzed: des na des gang zhig 'dzin pa zhes bya bas rig pa'i bdag nyid du sgrub pa nyid bstan te nges pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas mi 'dod pa bkag nas der snang ba las so zhes bya bas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa nyid bstan pa
translated: Therefore, the phrase “that which it apprehends” indicates that it is established as having the nature of awareness, but it does not indicate that it is ascertained.🔽Having refuted what is not accepted, the phrase “that which appears to it” indicates what is accepted.

original: yin no // des na ji ltar ma nges pa mngon sum gyis kyang bzung zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi rigs par brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yin no // des na ji ltar ma nges pa mngon sum gyis kyang bzung zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi rigs par brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement “How can non-ascertainment be apprehended by perception?” is said to be illogical.

original: de bas na nges pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na nges pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “Therefore, ascertainment” indicates this.

original: gang zhig nges pa de ni bzung ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig nges pa de ni bzung ba yin la /
translated: That which is ascertained is apprehended.

original: ma nges pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: ma nges pa gang yin pa /
translated: That which is not ascertained

original: de ni bzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: is not apprehended. This is not the case.

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul dang sbyar nas rnam par rtog pa sngon po la sogs pa rig pa nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med par mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul dang sbyar nas rnam par rtog pa sngon po la sogs pa rig pa nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med par mi srid pa yin te /
translated: If it is applied in the manner explained, even the awareness of a conceptual image such as blue is not possible without the aspect of blue.

original: de la yang sngon po la sogs pa yul du gyur pa rnams gzhan du gsal bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang sngon po la sogs pa yul du gyur pa rnams gzhan du gsal bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is impossible for objects such as blue to be manifest in any other way.

original: srid na ni mngon sum yang snang ba med par rig par @187a * //
analyzed: srid na ni mngon sum yang snang ba med par rig par @187a * //
translated: If it were possible, then even direct perception would be known without appearance.

original: ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why wouldn’t it be?

original: dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni nges pa rnams kyis ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs pa 'di bsu nas bshad pa ni nges pa rnams kyis ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Anticipating this doubt, it is explained: “Those who are certain do not think that way.”

original: rnam par rtog pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Conceptual thought does not apprehend or not apprehend due to the power of appearance.

original: 'dir ni snang ba yod pa bkag pa ma byas te /
analyzed: 'dir ni snang ba yod pa bkag pa ma byas te /
translated: Here, the existence of appearance is not refuted.

original: ji ltar sngar mngon sum ni gang gi yang nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes nges par byed pa nyid bkag pa ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar mngon sum ni gang gi yang nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes nges par byed pa nyid bkag pa ltar ro //
translated: Just as it was previously stated that direct perception is not a determiner of anything, and the very act of determining is refuted,

original: 'on kyang 'di ni 'dzin pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni 'dzin pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: here, the identity of that apprehension is refuted.

original: des na snang ba yod kyang 'di 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa de bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na snang ba yod kyang 'di 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa de bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that even if appearance exists, it is not apprehended or not apprehended by that identity.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the reason.

original: gang zhig nges kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig nges kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and even if it were ascertained, it would not be ascertained as the object of that.🔽The aspect of a pot, etc., is just as it is seen by direct perception, and that very aspect, such as having a round belly, etc., is the object of the conception of a pot, but it is not clear.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji lta ba zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba lto ba yangs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de nyid bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi gsal ba nyid du de'i yul can dang 'gal bar khyad par du 'gyur bas snang ba
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji lta ba zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba lto ba yangs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de nyid bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi gsal ba nyid du de'i yul can dang 'gal bar khyad par du 'gyur bas snang ba
translated: It appears as if it were different from the object of that conception,🔽because it is different from the object of that conception.

original: yin no ; / skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang de lta bur gyur pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: yin no ; / skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang de lta bur gyur pa de nyid yin te /
translated: The aspect of momentariness, etc., is just like that.

original: des na gal te 'di snang bas 'dzin par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te 'di snang bas 'dzin par byed pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it were apprehended by appearance,

original: skad cig ma la sogs pa yang 'dzin par yang 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma la sogs pa yang 'dzin par yang 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: momentariness, etc., would also be apprehended. But that is not so.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig nges kyang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan la ma nges par 'jug pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig nges kyang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan la ma nges par 'jug pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages in ascertaining some nature of a pot, etc., but not ascertaining another nature, such as momentariness, etc.

original: ji ltar de'i ngo bo nges pa de ltar rtogs pa po 'jug gi ji ltar nges pa ma yin pa de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i ngo bo nges pa de ltar rtogs pa po 'jug gi ji ltar nges pa ma yin pa de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as it is ascertained in its nature, so it is engaged by the cognizer; but not as it is not ascertained.

original: 'di ltar chu ldugs pa'i don du gnyer ba bum pa zhes de ltar nges pa la 'jug gi / mi rtag pa'o zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chu ldugs pa'i don du gnyer ba bum pa zhes de ltar nges pa la 'jug gi / mi rtag pa'o zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, one engages in the ascertainment of a pot for the purpose of drawing water, but not as impermanent.

original: ci ste yang rnam par rtog pa yang mngon sum dang 'dra bar ma nges kyang de lta bu'i rnam pa 'dzin par byed pa yin mod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste yang rnam par rtog pa yang mngon sum dang 'dra bar ma nges kyang de lta bu'i rnam pa 'dzin par byed pa yin mod ce na /
translated: But if conceptual cognition, although not ascertained like perception, does indeed apprehend in that way?

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: snang ba tha dad pas dngos su 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pas dngos su 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established as an actual apprehender due to the difference in appearance.

original: mngon sum 'dra bar te snang ba nyid kyis dngos po la gzhol bar mi grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum 'dra bar te snang ba nyid kyis dngos po la gzhol bar mi grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established as directed towards the thing due to the appearance resembling perception.

original: nges pa nyid la ltos te 'ga' zhig la 'dzin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa na nges pa ji ltar ba kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: nges pa nyid la ltos te 'ga' zhig la 'dzin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa na nges pa ji ltar ba kho nar rigs so //
translated: When it is established as an apprehender in relation to ascertainment itself, it is reasonable just as it is ascertained.

original: nges pa yang myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa myong pa'i chos yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa yang myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa myong pa'i chos yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and ascertainment is not of the nature of experience, but is a phenomenon of experience.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug @187b sdud pa ste nges pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa ni yin gyi yod kyang snang ba ni ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug @187b sdud pa ste nges pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa ni yin gyi yod kyang snang ba ni ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: “Therefore” is a conclusion. It is ascertainment that is the apprehender, not the appearance. The point is to ascertain that.

original: gal te de ltar mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos su 'dzin par byed pa nyid mi srid pas ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang gi mthar thug pa nyid kyis gang la yang 'dzin par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos su 'dzin par byed pa nyid mi srid pas ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang gi mthar thug pa nyid kyis gang la yang 'dzin par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that, then since it is impossible for it to be the actual apprehender, the conceptual consciousness would not be the apprehender of anything, because it would not terminate in anything.

original: 'di ni zhen pa'i dbang nyid kyis phyi rol tu phyogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ni zhen pa'i dbang nyid kyis phyi rol tu phyogs pa yin na /
translated: Since it is directed outward under the power of attachment,

original: de lta bu'i phyi rol na med pa'i phyir don dam par na yul med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyi rol na med pa'i phyir don dam par na yul med pa kho na'o //
translated: since there is no external object of that kind, ultimately there is no object at all.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bor ni don la gzhol bar brjod do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bor ni don la gzhol bar brjod do //
translated: It is said that the nature of the conceptual consciousness is directed toward the object.

original: de bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is “If that were not so.”

original: des ni de ltar mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa 'khrul pas nges par mi zin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: des ni de ltar mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa 'khrul pas nges par mi zin pa bzhin du /
translated: Thus, just as the object that is made directly evident is not ascertained by a mistaken consciousness,

original: rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa las yang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa las yang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba /
translated: so too, a valid cognition that engages its object by means of a conceptual consciousness is not ascertained.

original: nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //
analyzed: nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “How could the non-ascertained be ascertained by the ascertainers?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal ba na mngon sum yang nges pa'i ngo bo yin par mgo mnyam pa de las bzlog par bstan pas bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal ba na mngon sum yang nges pa'i ngo bo yin par mgo mnyam pa de las bzlog par bstan pas bsal ba yin no //
translated: When this is refuted, it is also refuted by the statement that direct perception is equivalent to the ascertainer.

original: da ni mngon sum nges pa'i bdag nyid ma yin mod /
analyzed: da ni mngon sum nges pa'i bdag nyid ma yin mod /
translated: Now, direct perception is not an ascertainer.

original: de lta yang shes pa gcig gi yul du byas pa las de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dag 'jug par rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang shes pa gcig gi yul du byas pa las de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dag 'jug par rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin te /
translated: However, it is established by nature that other consciousnesses that follow it engage their objects by making them the object of a single consciousness.

original: rjes su dpag pas yul du byas pa'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yul du byas pa'i don bzhin no //
translated: This is like the case of the object that is made the object of an inference.

original: des na mngon sum gyis kyang sgrub pa'i ngo bos don yul du byed na rnam pa thams cad la nges pa skyed pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i skabs med do //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis kyang sgrub pa'i ngo bos don yul du byed na rnam pa thams cad la nges pa skyed pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i skabs med do //
translated: Therefore, if direct perception also makes the object its own nature, then it would generate certainty with respect to all aspects, and there would be no opportunity for the engagement of other valid cognitions.

original: de la srid na ni rnam par rtog pa yang 'gyur ro zhes rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas mgo mtshungs par ston pas pha rol po dag spang pa'i phyir zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: de la srid na ni rnam par rtog pa yang 'gyur ro zhes rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas mgo mtshungs par ston pas pha rol po dag spang pa'i phyir zhes smra bar byed do //
