translated: If it were possible, then it would be conceptual. In this way, he shows that the opponent’s position is similar to other positions and thus he says that the opponent’s position is to be rejected.

original: thams cad las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la de kho na bzhin du nyams su myong ba skyed kyang ji ltar nyams su myong ba thams cad las tha dad pa'i dngos po las skye ba de kho na bzhin du ci ste nges pa mi 'byung /
analyzed: thams cad las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la de kho na bzhin du nyams su myong ba skyed kyang ji ltar nyams su myong ba thams cad las tha dad pa'i dngos po las skye ba de kho na bzhin du ci ste nges pa mi 'byung /
translated: Even though it generates the experience of the nature of the thing that is different from all others, why is it that certainty does not arise in the same way that it arises from the thing that is different from all other experiences?

original: dngos po gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid kyis dngos po dngos po gzhan dang po gzhan las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid kyis dngos po dngos po gzhan dang po gzhan las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The thing that is different from all other things has a nature that is different from other things because it has a nature that is different from other things.

original: de lta ma yin na rang bzhin med pa tha dad par mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rang bzhin med pa tha dad par mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the absence of intrinsic reality would not be suitable as a distinction.

original: des na 'di bum pa zhes khyad par can gyi ngo bo'i dbyibs dang ldan pa'i @188a * //
analyzed: des na 'di bum pa zhes khyad par can gyi ngo bo'i dbyibs dang ldan pa'i @188a * //
translated: Therefore, since this is the shape that has the nature of a particular, called a pot,

original: phyir de'i ngo bo dbyibs can ma yin pa bum pa ma yin pa las ldog pa yin la rgyu'i byed pas bsgrub pa'i phyir ni byas pa ma yin pa las 'jig pa'i ngang can gyis ni mi 'jig pa las so //
analyzed: phyir de'i ngo bo dbyibs can ma yin pa bum pa ma yin pa las ldog pa yin la rgyu'i byed pas bsgrub pa'i phyir ni byas pa ma yin pa las 'jig pa'i ngang can gyis ni mi 'jig pa las so //
translated: it is the opposite of that which does not have the nature of a pot, which is not the shape. Since it is established by the function of the cause, it is the opposite of that which is not produced, which is not perishable.

original: des na 'di de lta bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kho na la ma nges pa skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan la ga la ltos /
analyzed: des na 'di de lta bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kho na la ma nges pa skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan la ga la ltos /
translated: Therefore, how can this be uncertain with regard to just such a nature and so forth, since it arises? How can it depend on another valid cognition?

original: ji ltar nyams su myong tsam gyis nges par 'gyur na gang gis 'di skad rtsod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong tsam gyis nges par 'gyur na gang gis 'di skad rtsod par byed ce na /
translated: If it were ascertained merely by experience, then by what would this be disputed?

original: dran pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: dran pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “It is remembered.”

original: de ni nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed tsam gyis bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed tsam gyis bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: That is established by the mere conditioning of experience,

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other reason.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi don myong ba na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi don myong ba na /
translated: When one experiences an object that has such a form,

original: de'i rnam pa mtha' dag nges par ce ste mi skye /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa mtha' dag nges par ce ste mi skye /
translated: does one not ascertain all of its aspects?

original: de lta ma yin na nam yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nam yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were otherwise, it would never be ascertained.

original: de bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute that,

original: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: it says, “because the assemblage of causes is incomplete.”

original: 'dir mi skye ba'i rgyu ci yin zhes 'dri ba'i ngag yin na ni /
analyzed: 'dir mi skye ba'i rgyu ci yin zhes 'dri ba'i ngag yin na ni /
translated: If this is a question asking, “What is the cause of non-arising?”

original: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'o zhes lan du 'gyur na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'o zhes lan du 'gyur na /
translated: then the answer is, “The assemblage of causes is incomplete.”

original: rgyu ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i ngag yin na ni /
analyzed: rgyu ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i ngag yin na ni /
translated: If this is a question asking, “Why does the cause not arise?”

original: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: then it is correct to answer, “It does not arise because the assemblage of causes is incomplete.”

original: gal te dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la ltos pa med kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rten nges pa nyid du skye ba yin te sngon po nyams su myong ba nyid las des 'du byed so sor nges
analyzed: gal te dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la ltos pa med kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rten nges pa nyid du skye ba yin te sngon po nyams su myong ba nyid las des 'du byed so sor nges
translated: Even though the conception of memory does not depend on the assemblage of objects, faculties, and so on, it arises as a definite support of blue and so on, because it arises from the experience of blue and so on.

original: pa skyes pa ni de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa skyes pa ni de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the man who has been born in that way will be like that.

original: don gzhan la chags pa la sogs pas ma nyams pa'i nyams su myong ba'i de ma thag tu 'das pa na dran pa skye ba la ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med do //
analyzed: don gzhan la chags pa la sogs pas ma nyams pa'i nyams su myong ba'i de ma thag tu 'das pa na dran pa skye ba la ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med do //
translated: When memory arises immediately after the experience of something that has not been damaged by attachment to another object, etc., it does not depend on a cooperative condition.

original: nyams su myong ba tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the mere experience.

original: des na lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, why is it said that it is because of the incompleteness of the cooperative condition?

original: brjod pa nges pa tsam skye ba 'dri ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod pa nges pa tsam skye ba 'dri ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: We reply: It is not that the mere arising of certainty is questioned.

original: 'on kyang khyad par thams cad la nges pa skye ba 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par thams cad la nges pa skye ba 'dri ba yin no //
translated: But rather, the arising of certainty about all the particulars is questioned.

original: des na 'di ni de nyid la lan btab pa yin te de nyid kyi phyir thams cad las tha dad pa cha shas dang bral pa'i ngo bo nyid nyams su myong mod kyi zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di ni de nyid la lan btab pa yin te de nyid kyi phyir thams cad las tha dad pa cha shas dang bral pa'i ngo bo nyid nyams su myong mod kyi zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this is the answer to that: “Therefore, although the nature of the thing itself is experienced as distinct from everything else, as free from parts,” as will be explained.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa'i phyir skabs su bab pa ji ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa'i phyir skabs su bab pa ji ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: In order to express just this, it is said in the context: “as it is described.”

original: de la ni lhan cig byed pa gzhan la ltos pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ni lhan cig byed pa gzhan la ltos pa yod pa yin te /
translated: In that case, it would depend on another cooperating cause,

original: nyams su myong ba tsam las mi 'byung ba'i phyir @188b ro ;
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam las mi 'byung ba'i phyir @188b ro ;
translated: because it would not arise from mere experience.

original: /'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mdun na gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes re zhig ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mdun na gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes re zhig ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the nature of a thing such as a pot that is manifest in front of us is its own nature as impermanent, etc.

original: des na ngo bo nyid skad cig ma nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa yin no//
analyzed: des na ngo bo nyid skad cig ma nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa yin no//
translated: Therefore, it has the nature of being momentary, existent, cause and effect, etc.

original: de yang de ltar snang ba na nges pa'i shes pa la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang de ltar snang ba na nges pa'i shes pa la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: And when it appears in that way, it is established by a determinate cognition.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo'i dbyibs kyis rnam par bcad pa dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir dang / de lta bur gyur pa nyid bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo'i dbyibs kyis rnam par bcad pa dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir dang / de lta bur gyur pa nyid bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the shape that is its nature is manifest to the sense consciousness and because it becomes the conception of a pot, etc.

original: des na mthong ba'i cha gang zhig rnam par rtog pa la mi snang ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i cha gang zhig rnam par rtog pa la mi snang ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing whatsoever that is a part of the seen that does not appear to thought.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid ni skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pas yul du ma byas mod kyi /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid ni skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pas yul du ma byas mod kyi /
translated: The nature of the object is not made into an object by thought, which has the nature of momentariness, etc.

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yang chos gcig tu nges par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yang chos gcig tu nges par byas pa yin no //
translated: However, the nature of all phenomena is ascertained as a single phenomenon.

original: des na de ltar mthong ba'i 'du byed tsam la rag las nas skye ba'i dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni cha shas kyi skye ba yang ma yin la de tsam gyis tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa med pa yang ma yin te chos gcig gi bdag nyid
analyzed: des na de ltar mthong ba'i 'du byed tsam la rag las nas skye ba'i dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni cha shas kyi skye ba yang ma yin la de tsam gyis tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa med pa yang ma yin te chos gcig gi bdag nyid
translated: Therefore, the memory that arises in dependence on just that much that is seen is not a part of arising. Nor is it that it is not dependent on another valid cognition, because the nature of a single phenomenon

original: du nges par byas pa'i phyir chos gzhan dag la tshad ma gzhan bsgrub pas rnam par gzhag pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du nges par byas pa'i phyir chos gzhan dag la tshad ma gzhan bsgrub pas rnam par gzhag pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is ascertained. It is because of that that the establishment of another valid cognition is posited in relation to other phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa ma tshang bas thams cad las tha dad pa'i don la nges pa ma skyes pa'i gtan tshigs de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid cha med pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyis ni bzung ba la ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa ma tshang bas thams cad las tha dad pa'i don la nges pa ma skyes pa'i gtan tshigs de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid cha med pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyis ni bzung ba la ste /
translated: Among the features of that, such as momentariness and selflessness, whatever feature is ascertained is understood. The reason is that the collection of causes and conditions is incomplete. The reason is that certainty about an object that is different from everything else is not produced. Therefore, when a partless nature that is an intrinsic identity is apprehended by direct perception,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis bzung ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis bzung ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is apprehended in its entirety.🔽That which is devoid of parts is partless.🔽It is said that such a thing is apprehended only without a valid cognition.🔽Among the features of that, such as momentariness and selflessness, whatever feature is ascertained is understood. The reason is that the collection of causes and conditions is incomplete. The reason is that certainty about an object that is different from everything else is not produced. Therefore, when a partless nature that is an intrinsic identity is apprehended by direct perception,🔽it is apprehended in its entirety.

original: cha shas rnams spangs pa ni cha shas dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: cha shas rnams spangs pa ni cha shas dang bral ba ste /
translated: That which is devoid of parts is partless.

original: de lta bu ni tshad ma med pa kho nar 'dzin to zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni tshad ma med pa kho nar 'dzin to zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that such a thing is apprehended only without a valid cognition.🔽Among the features of that, such as momentariness and selflessness, whatever feature is ascertained is understood. The reason is that the collection of causes and conditions is incomplete. The reason is that certainty about an object that is different from everything else is not produced. Therefore, when a partless nature that is an intrinsic identity is apprehended by direct perception,🔽it is apprehended in its entirety.🔽That which is devoid of parts is partless.🔽It is said that such a thing is apprehended only without a valid cognition.

original: de'i khyad par skad cig ma nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi nang nas khyad par gang zhig nges pa la rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod pa de ni rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par skad cig ma nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi nang nas khyad par gang zhig nges pa la rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod pa de ni rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among the features of that, such as momentariness and selflessness, whatever feature is ascertained is understood. The reason is that the collection of causes and conditions is incomplete. The reason is that certainty about an object that is different from everything else is not produced. Therefore, when a partless nature that is an intrinsic identity is apprehended by direct perception,🔽it is apprehended in its entirety.🔽That which is devoid of parts is partless.🔽It is said that such a thing is apprehended only without a valid cognition.🔽Among the

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa med pas tha dad pa thams cad ma nges pa'i phyir khyad par gang zhig nges par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod pa'i khyad par de nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa med pas tha dad pa thams cad ma nges pa'i phyir khyad par gang zhig nges par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod pa'i khyad par de nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because there is no co-operation, all differences are uncertain. Therefore, that difference which is the co-operating condition that makes a difference certain, that difference will be certain.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa @189a * //🔽yin no // gang zhig mngon sum gyi stobs kyis 'phangs pa ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa dag la yang nges par ji lta ba bzhin thams cad kyi yan lag yin gyi snang ba ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa de ni rang bzhin
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa @189a * // yin no // gang zhig mngon sum gyi stobs kyis 'phangs pa ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa dag la yang nges par ji lta ba bzhin thams cad kyi yan lag yin gyi snang ba ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa de ni rang bzhin
translated: But not another.

original: gyis sgrub pa'i brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gyis sgrub pa'i brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is projected by the power of perception, and is understood by thought just as it is experienced, is a part of all that is certain just as it is, not just as it appears. That is not to be stated by nature.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shugs kyis byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shugs kyis byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bzhin no //
translated: Like another thought that arises by the force of inference.

original: 'grel pa ni thams cad las zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni thams cad las zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary is “from all.”

original: nyams su myong mod kyi 'on kyang khyad par thams cad nges par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong mod kyi 'on kyang khyad par thams cad nges par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although there is an experience, still, all the distinctions are not ascertained.

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it not ascertained?

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it depends on another cause.

original: nyams su myong ba tsam gyis ni khyad par thams cad la nges pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam gyis ni khyad par thams cad la nges pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: For, distinctions are not ascertained by mere experience.

original: 'on te rgyu gzhan las yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu gzhan las yin no //
translated: But if it is from another cause,🔽then that distinction which is ascertained by a cause is ascertained.

original: des na khyad par gang nges pa la rgyu yod pa de ni nges pa yin no zhes 'thad pa brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can mdo'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par gang nges pa la rgyu yod pa de ni nges pa yin no zhes 'thad pa brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can mdo'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the sutra, preceded by a logical argument.🔽What is that other cause, and what is the conception that depends on it?

original: rgyu gzhan de yang gang zhig yin la de la ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa de de yang gang yin zhe na gnyi ga ston pa ni nyams su myong ba ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan de yang gang zhig yin la de la ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa de de yang gang yin zhe na gnyi ga ston pa ni nyams su myong ba ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He shows both: “The experience is not beyond conception.

original: rnam par rtog pa goms pa las ma 'das par nyams su myong ba rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa goms pa las ma 'das par nyams su myong ba rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed de /
translated: The experience that is not beyond the conception of habit produces conception.

original: de nas 'dir lhan cig byed pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: de nas 'dir lhan cig byed pa ni de yin no //
translated: Then, here, that is the cooperating cause.

original: goms pa 'di gang gi yul can yin pa de ni ma brjod do //
analyzed: goms pa 'di gang gi yul can yin pa de ni ma brjod do //
translated: But it is not stated what the object is of this habit.

original: de la ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa nyid kyis go ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa nyid kyis go ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood by the mere indication of the conceptual thought that depends on it.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa gang zhig goms par byed /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa gang zhig goms par byed /
translated: So what conceptual thought is being cultivated?🔽And what is the arising that depends on it?

original: de la ltos na skye ba yang gang yin zhes gnyi ga brjod par bya ba las de la ltos pa nyid brjod pas goms pa gang yin pa de nyid skye ba yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //🔽de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ltos na skye ba yang gang yin zhes gnyi ga brjod par bya ba las de la ltos pa nyid brjod pas goms pa gang yin pa de nyid skye ba yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since both should be stated, by stating that it depends on it, it would be as if he were to say, “That very habit is the arising.”🔽In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: dper na zhes smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes smos so //
translated: For example,

original: ro myags pa dang / nyal po bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa rnams de dag nyid ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: ro myags pa dang / nyal po bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa rnams de dag nyid ltos pa yin no //
translated: the conceptual forms of putrid flesh, sexual intercourse, and food are just that on which it depends.

original: so sor rtogs pa la gnas pa bud med la sogs pa la mi mthun par goms par byed pa bud med dag gson po'i lus shi ro dang khyad par med pa de lta bu nyid du sgom par byed pa ni de'i rnam par rtog pa goms pas nyams
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa la gnas pa bud med la sogs pa la mi mthun par goms par byed pa bud med dag gson po'i lus shi ro dang khyad par med pa de lta bu nyid du sgom par byed pa ni de'i rnam par rtog pa goms pas nyams
translated: The yogi who is habituated to the idea of a woman’s body as being repulsive, and who meditates on the fact that a woman’s living body is no different from a dead body, is habituated to the idea of a woman’s body as being repulsive.

original: su myong bas rnam par rtog pa de nyid skyed par byed do //
analyzed: su myong bas rnam par rtog pa de nyid skyed par byed do //
translated: By the experience of that idea, that idea is generated.

original: 'dod pa can ni @189b bde ba'i sgrub byed du goms pas nyal po bya ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dod pa can ni @189b bde ba'i sgrub byed du goms pas nyal po bya ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur la /
translated: The lustful person, by being habituated to the idea of a woman as the means of achieving pleasure, generates the idea of sexual intercourse.

original: khyi dang ce spyang la sogs pa dag ni 'grangs pa'i rgyu nyid du goms pas bza' bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyi dang ce spyang la sogs pa dag ni 'grangs pa'i rgyu nyid du goms pas bza' bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Dogs, jackals, and so on, by being habituated to the idea of a woman as the means of satisfying hunger, generate the idea of eating her.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gang gi tshe cha shas dang bral ba'i don gcig la nyams su myong ba'i ma thus rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gang gi tshe cha shas dang bral ba'i don gcig la nyams su myong ba'i ma thus rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba na /
translated: This is what is being said: When one is habituated to the idea of a single object free of parts, one generates the idea of its nature just as it is.

original: dper na de yod pa na bde ba dmigs pa'i phyir bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dper na de yod pa na bde ba dmigs pa'i phyir bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid dam /
translated: For example, when it exists, one realizes by direct perception that it is the proof of pleasure because pleasure is observed, or that it is the proof of fire because smoke is observed.

original: me la sogs pa du ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ltar de chos gcig po gang gis bdag nyid du nges par byas pa de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams de la yod par tshad ma gzhan gyi dbang las rtogs par bya ste /🔽dngos po gcig dang rang bzhin nyid /🔽de bzhin du chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid do zhes de lta bur gyur pa rnam pa de lta bu'i tshad mas rtogs pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du yang nas yang du goms par byed pa de'i tshe de dmigs pa na rang bzhin de bzhin du 'di
analyzed: me la sogs pa du ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ltar de chos gcig po gang gis bdag nyid du nges par byas pa de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams de la yod par tshad ma gzhan gyi dbang las rtogs par bya ste / dngos po gcig dang rang bzhin nyid / de bzhin du chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid do zhes de lta bur gyur pa rnam pa de lta bu'i tshad mas rtogs pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du yang nas yang du goms par byed pa de'i tshe de dmigs pa na rang bzhin de bzhin du 'di
translated: In the same way, one should realize by means of another valid cognition that other phenomena exist in that which is ascertained to be of a certain nature by means of one phenomenon.🔽One should repeatedly cultivate familiarity with the nature of that which is realized by such valid knowledge, thinking, “This is of one nature and this very nature is also the nature of other phenomena.”

original: yang nges par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: yang nges par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: When one observes that, one will definitely ascertain that its nature is just as it is.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par mi gsal bar ni nyams su myong bas nges par sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par mi gsal bar ni nyams su myong bas nges par sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the specific aspect is not clear, it is not possible to ascertain it by experience.

original: des na goms pa la yod kyang des yul du byas pa'i don gyi rnam pa'i khyad par gsal ba med par skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa'i don gyi mthar thug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na goms pa la yod kyang des yul du byas pa'i don gyi rnam pa'i khyad par gsal ba med par skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa'i don gyi mthar thug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even though it is familiar, a conceptual consciousness that arises without a clear image of the object that is its object does not reach the final object that is the object of direct perception.

original: dran pa bzhin du dngos po gzhan mthong ba las dngos po gzhan la gzhol ba'am sgro 'dogs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa bzhin du dngos po gzhan mthong ba las dngos po gzhan la gzhol ba'am sgro 'dogs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Like memory, it would be directed toward or superimpose one thing when seeing another thing.

original: rnam pa'i gsal ba'i khyad par gsal bar gyur na yang goms pa la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i gsal ba'i khyad par gsal bar gyur na yang goms pa la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the clear image of the aspect is clear, it would not depend on familiarity,

original: sngon po nyid la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin du mthong ba tsam las 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po nyid la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin du mthong ba tsam las 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it would arise from merely seeing blue and so on, like a conceptual consciousness.

original: 'di las nges pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di las nges pa 'di yin te /
translated: The ascertainment from this is as follows.

original: gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po gcig gi bdag nyid du nges par byas pa dmigs shing dngos su na rang bzhin de nyid chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po gcig gi bdag nyid du nges par byas pa dmigs shing dngos su na rang bzhin de nyid chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When an object that is one nature is ascertained to be one nature, it is observed, and in reality that nature is the nature of another phenomenon.

original: de'i rang bzhin du tshad mas lan gcig dmigs nas der goms pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin de nyid chos gzhan gyi rnam par yang 'jog @190a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du tshad mas lan gcig dmigs nas der goms pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin de nyid chos gzhan gyi rnam par yang 'jog @190a * // pa yin no //
translated: Having ascertained the nature of fire by means of a valid cognition, one posits that very nature in the aspect of another phenomenon by the power of being accustomed to that.

original: dper na me'i rnam pa nyid du bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de du ba dang 'brel par myong ba med na /
analyzed: dper na me'i rnam pa nyid du bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de du ba dang 'brel par myong ba med na /
translated: For example, if one does not experience the nature of fire as being produced in the aspect of smoke,

original: me zhes bya ba nyid du nges par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: me zhes bya ba nyid du nges par mi 'gyur la /
translated: one will not ascertain it as fire.

original: de la gang zhig snang ba nyid kyis nges par 'gyur ba rva can bzhin du du ba skyed par byed pa nyid gzhan ni snang bar byed pa des na du ba dmigs pa'i phyir me'i rnam pa de nyid du ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes thun mong ba
analyzed: de la gang zhig snang ba nyid kyis nges par 'gyur ba rva can bzhin du du ba skyed par byed pa nyid gzhan ni snang bar byed pa des na du ba dmigs pa'i phyir me'i rnam pa de nyid du ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes thun mong ba
translated: If something else that is ascertained by mere appearance, like a horn, produces smoke, then because smoke is observed, that aspect of fire is also the cause of smoke.🔽Thus, one should understand that it is common.

original: nyid du bya ste yang nas yang de lta bu nyid du dmigs pa las rnam pa de dmigs na ji ltar me'o zhes nges pa de bzhin du /🔽du ba'i rgyu'o zhes kyang nges par byed do //
analyzed: nyid du bya ste yang nas yang de lta bu nyid du dmigs pa las rnam pa de dmigs na ji ltar me'o zhes nges pa de bzhin du /🔽du ba'i rgyu'o zhes kyang nges par byed do //
translated: If one observes that aspect again and again, then just as one ascertains it as fire, one also ascertains it as the cause of smoke.

original: de nas de ltar goms pa yang dgos pa yin la me'i rnam pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: de nas de ltar goms pa yang dgos pa yin la me'i rnam pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Then, the object of the conceptual thought is the object of the conceptual thought that is the cause of the appearance of the form of fire.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rtog pa myong bas yul du byas pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rtog pa myong bas yul du byas pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could the conceptual thought follow the distinction that is the object of experience?

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa la yang sngon po'i rnam pa nyid skad cig ma nyid kyi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa la yang sngon po'i rnam pa nyid skad cig ma nyid kyi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, for the yogi, the form of blue itself appears as momentary.

original: des na nyams su myong ba ni ji ltar gzugs dang dbyibs dag la 'gyur ba bzhin rtogs pa tsam las rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: des na nyams su myong ba ni ji ltar gzugs dang dbyibs dag la 'gyur ba bzhin rtogs pa tsam las rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, experience is like the change in form and shape. It is only the conceptual thought that produces the conceptual thought.

original: yang chos gzhan gyi rnam pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid du gyur par goms pa'i dbang gis yin te /
analyzed: yang chos gzhan gyi rnam pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid du gyur par goms pa'i dbang gis yin te /
translated: Or, it is by the power of being accustomed to the other entity having the nature of the other aspect.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do //
translated: Another aspect is not possible.

original: gang du rang bzhin khyad par can mngon sum gyi tshad mas rtogs pa yod pa der ni rnam par rtog pa tsam skye ba mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i byed pa khyad par du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du rang bzhin khyad par can mngon sum gyi tshad mas rtogs pa yod pa der ni rnam par rtog pa tsam skye ba mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i byed pa khyad par du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Where there is direct perception of a special nature, the mere arising of conception is not a special activity of direct perception.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid de /
translated: However, it is direct perception itself.

original: dper na nor bu'i gzugs la sogs pa dag la bzhin no zhes gzhan du gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: dper na nor bu'i gzugs la sogs pa dag la bzhin no zhes gzhan du gtan la phab zin to //
translated: For example, it is like the form of a jewel and so on.

original: goms par bya bar gyur pa nyid la ltos par bya ba gzhan dag kyang yod par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: goms par bya bar gyur pa nyid la ltos par bya ba gzhan dag kyang yod par bshad pa ni /
translated: Other things that depend on being made familiar are explained.

original: de la zhes bya ba ste goms pa yin par 'gyur ba de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ste goms pa yin par 'gyur ba de la'o //
translated: In that, means in that which becomes familiar.

original: blo gsal ba ni yid la byed pa mi mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gsal ba ni yid la byed pa mi mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: A clear mind is not incompatible with attention.

original: yid la byed pa mi mthun par gyur na nyams su myong ba nyid kyang mi skye ba de lta na yang nyams su myong ba'i dngos po'i mthu las skye ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa khyad par du 'phags pa kho nas mngon sum du skye ba'i gags
analyzed: yid la byed pa mi mthun par gyur na nyams su myong ba nyid kyang mi skye ba de lta na yang nyams su myong ba'i dngos po'i mthu las skye ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa khyad par du 'phags pa kho nas mngon sum du skye ba'i gags
translated: If the mental activities are not in agreement, then experience does not arise.🔽But even so, it is only the superior non-agreement that generates the direct perception, because it arises from the power of the experienced thing.

original: byed la / rnam par rtog pa ni cung zad mi mthun na yang mi skye ste dpyod pa'i rang @190b bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed la / rnam par rtog pa ni cung zad mi mthun na yang mi skye ste dpyod pa'i rang @190b bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conceptualization does not arise if there is the slightest disagreement, because it has the nature of investigation.

original: dpyod pa ni shin tu 'tsham pa med par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni shin tu 'tsham pa med par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Investigation does not exist without a very close correspondence.

original: de la yang mi mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang mi mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And in that case, it does not depend on disagreement or similarity.

original: rnam par dpyod pa phra mo ni cung zad shed dmas kyang ldog la gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa phra mo ni cung zad shed dmas kyang ldog la gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be inferred that subtle investigation is stopped by the slightest weakness, but not the others.

original: gal te goms pa yod pa nyid la de'i bag chags goms pa zhes bya ba 'di ji zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te goms pa yod pa nyid la de'i bag chags goms pa zhes bya ba 'di ji zhig yin /
translated: If there is only habituation, what is this called “the habit-energy of that”?

original: de yod pa la blo gsal ba nyid bzhin du 'di ni tha dad par gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pa la blo gsal ba nyid bzhin du 'di ni tha dad par gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not different from that which exists, just as the clarity of the mind.

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang sngar rnam par rtog pa goms par bshad gang yin pa de nyid 'di ltar khyad par du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang sngar rnam par rtog pa goms par bshad gang yin pa de nyid 'di ltar khyad par du byas pa yin te /
translated: This is true, but the point is that the previously explained cultivation of conceptualization is distinguished in this way.

original: rnam par rtog pa goms pa na bag chags goms par 'gyur gyi bag chags goms pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni med la rnam par rtog pa goms pa yang gzhan du nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa goms pa na bag chags goms par 'gyur gyi bag chags goms pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni med la rnam par rtog pa goms pa yang gzhan du nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: When conceptualization is cultivated, habitual tendencies are cultivated, but there is no other aspect of cultivating habitual tendencies, and the cultivation of conceptualization is not applied elsewhere.

original: dngos po de ltar tshad mas de'i chos nyid du rtogs pa na bag chags skye la /
analyzed: dngos po de ltar tshad mas de'i chos nyid du rtogs pa na bag chags skye la /
translated: When a thing is realized by valid cognition to be its nature, habitual tendencies arise.

original: de yang nas yang du de ltar rtogs pa las ni /
analyzed: de yang nas yang du de ltar rtogs pa las ni /
translated: And from repeatedly realizing it in that way,

original: bag chags de goms par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bag chags de goms par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: those habitual tendencies are cultivated.

original: des na de ltar rnam par rtog pa goms pa'i myong ba las rnam par rtog pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar rnam par rtog pa goms pa'i myong ba las rnam par rtog pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, conceptualization arises from the experience of cultivating conceptualization in that way.

original: gal te bag chags goms pa las rnam par rtog pa skye na bag chags rgyu yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te bag chags goms pa las rnam par rtog pa skye na bag chags rgyu yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If a concept arises from the maturation of a latent impression, then the latent impression is the cause,

original: nyams su myong ba ni rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but the experience is not the cause.

original: des na dang po'i skad cig pa mi mthong la /
analyzed: des na dang po'i skad cig pa mi mthong la /
translated: Therefore, the first moment is not seen,

original: gnyis pa la du ba'i 'bras bu can gyi bag chags sad pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa la du ba'i 'bras bu can gyi bag chags sad pa /
translated: but in the second moment the latent impression that has the effect of smoke is activated,

original: gsum pa rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gsum pa rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and in the third moment there is the concept.

original: 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa skad cig ma gsum pa la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di ni shin tu chung ste me'i rnam par rtog pa yang de bzhin kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa skad cig ma gsum pa la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di ni shin tu chung ste me'i rnam par rtog pa yang de bzhin kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: This statement that the effect, the concept, arises in the third moment is too small, for the concept of fire would arise in the same way.

original: 'di ltar me'i rnam bar rtog pa ni me nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed las yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i rnam bar rtog pa ni me nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed las yin te /
translated: Thus, the concept of fire arises from the formative force that is the experience of fire,

original: gzhan du na ni shes pas shes pa gzhan skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni shes pas shes pa gzhan skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: for one consciousness does not produce another consciousness.

original: des na dngos po nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir 'di yang de bzhin kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir 'di yang de bzhin kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the formative predispositions that experience entities are conceptual, it follows that this is exactly the same.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: blo gzhi tshugs pa'i 'du byed ces brjod do //
analyzed: blo gzhi tshugs pa'i 'du byed ces brjod do //
translated: The formative predispositions are said to be the basis of the mind.

original: gzhi tshugs pa nyid ni rgyu mtshan gzhan la brten nas lan gcig blo ji lta bu nyid du skyes @191a * //
analyzed: gzhi tshugs pa nyid ni rgyu mtshan gzhan la brten nas lan gcig blo ji lta bu nyid du skyes @191a * //
translated: The basis is the mind that arises in a particular way in dependence on a specific causal process.

original: pa de kho na bzhin du rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos par myong ba gsal ba'i mtshan nyid rang gi bdag nyid phul du byung ba kho na las skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa de kho na bzhin du rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos par myong ba gsal ba'i mtshan nyid rang gi bdag nyid phul du byung ba kho na las skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not dependent on any other causal process, but arises from its own nature alone, which is characterized by the clarity of experience.

original: des na 'di ni yid gtad pa la /
analyzed: des na 'di ni yid gtad pa la /
translated: Therefore, when the mind is directed towards an object,

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo las de ma thag pa kho nar de ltar 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo las de ma thag pa kho nar de ltar 'grub ste /
translated: it is established in that way immediately after the mind has that nature.

original: don gzhan la 'gro bar mi 'dod kyang de lta bus bskyed pa'i nus pa skyes pa yin pa sad pas dus gzhan du de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dran pa zhes bya bskyed par byed pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa la 'byung bar thal ba ma
analyzed: don gzhan la 'gro bar mi 'dod kyang de lta bus bskyed pa'i nus pa skyes pa yin pa sad pas dus gzhan du de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa dran pa zhes bya bskyed par byed pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa la 'byung bar thal ba ma
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the fault of the arising of memory in the third moment follows.

original: yin no // 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: yin no // 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The conceptual thoughts of effect and so on are also like that.

original: me'i rnam pa nyid du ba'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bsgos pa'i blo can ni ji ltar me'i rnam par nyams su myong ba na nyams su myong ba des me'o snyam ba skyed pa de bzhin du du ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya bar yang yin no //
analyzed: me'i rnam pa nyid du ba'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bsgos pa'i blo can ni ji ltar me'i rnam par nyams su myong ba na nyams su myong ba des me'o snyam ba skyed pa de bzhin du du ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya bar yang yin no //
translated: One who has the idea that the effect of smoke is the aspect of fire, when experiencing the aspect of fire, generates the idea that it is fire through that experience. In the same way, it is the cause of smoke.

original: de skabs ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de skabs ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the cause of conceptual thought?

original: sman pa'i skabs su gnas par 'gyur ba'i skyes bu la sman par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: sman pa'i skabs su gnas par 'gyur ba'i skyes bu la sman par nges pa yin no //
translated: The person who is in the position of a doctor is ascertained as a doctor.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis ma nges pa'i chos de dang ldan pa rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis de ltar nges par tshad ma gzhan gyi rtsa ba las yin gyi mngon sum la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis ma nges pa'i chos de dang ldan pa rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis de ltar nges par tshad ma gzhan gyi rtsa ba las yin gyi mngon sum la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If one is uncertain about a property by means of perception, and one is certain about it by means of another reason, then the other valid cognition is based on a different root, but it is not based on perception.

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the case of momentariness.

original: brjod pa / bzo'i sbyor ba du ma shes pa'i khyad par can gyi skabs dang 'brel pa las khyad par can gyi chos dang ldan par nges kyi gzhan ma yin pas de'i lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa mngon sum de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa / bzo'i sbyor ba du ma shes pa'i khyad par can gyi skabs dang 'brel pa las khyad par can gyi chos dang ldan par nges kyi gzhan ma yin pas de'i lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa mngon sum de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: We reply: The reason for the perception of the possession of the property of the special is the special, which is related to the special occasion of the knowledge of many applications of craft, not anything else.

original: de la chos gzhan gyi 'du byed yod kyang skabs tha dad pa'i phyir mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos gzhan gyi 'du byed yod kyang skabs tha dad pa'i phyir mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there is the activity of another property, it is not ascertained because of the difference of occasion.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i tshig gi don to //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the other cases as they are experienced. This is the meaning of the word “etc.”

original: 'di ltar nye ba la yang ltos te nges pa skye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye ba la yang ltos te nges pa skye ba yin te /
translated: In this way, certainty arises in dependence on the near.

original: nor bsrung ba la nges par sbyor ba dmigs nas rang gi chung ma khyo'i rnam par rtog pa skye'i gzhan ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bsrung ba la nges par sbyor ba dmigs nas rang gi chung ma khyo'i rnam par rtog pa skye'i gzhan ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one is intent on guarding one’s wealth, the thought of one’s wife arises in the form of a man, but not otherwise.

original: des ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa lhan cig byed pa la ltos te yod pa dang med par bstan nas skye ba rnams la yang snga phyir skye ba so sor nges par rgyu bshad pa ni de kho na zhes bya ba ste nges pa dag snga phyi🔽nyid du @191b 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa lhan cig byed pa la ltos te yod pa dang med par bstan nas skye ba rnams la yang snga phyir skye ba so sor nges par rgyu bshad pa ni de kho na zhes bya ba ste nges pa dag snga phyi nyid du @191b 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, having shown that the existence and non-existence of conceptual differentiation is dependent on the cooperating conditions, he explains the cause of the individual determination of the prior and subsequent arising of the conceptual differentiations in regard to the arising of the latter:

original: rnam par rtog pa la la ni sngar skye la la la ni phyis so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la la ni sngar skye la la la ni phyis so //
translated: “in reality, i.e. in certainty, the prior and subsequent arising of the conceptual differentiations is due to the prior and subsequent arising of the cooperating conditions.”

original: ji ltar byas te zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas te zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: bshad pa / nye ba dang ches shin tu nye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: bshad pa / nye ba dang ches shin tu nye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: It is said: “due to the distinction of proximity, remoteness, etc.”

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi rim pa las so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi rim pa las so //
translated: It is due to the order of the distinction of the cooperating conditions.

original: dper na blo gsal ba dang ches shin tu gsal pa la ltos nas chos rnams las 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med par rnam par rtog pa de bzhin du snga phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na blo gsal ba dang ches shin tu gsal pa la ltos nas chos rnams las 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med par rnam par rtog pa de bzhin du snga phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is not the case that they are earlier and later.

original: de bzhin du goms pa dang ches shin tu goms pas kyang snga phyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du goms pa dang ches shin tu goms pas kyang snga phyir 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, through practice and great practice, they become earlier and later.

original: sogs pa smos pas bzung ba'i lhan cig byed pa rnams nye bar mtshon pa'i don du 'dir nye ba nye bar bkod da //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas bzung ba'i lhan cig byed pa rnams nye bar mtshon pa'i don du 'dir nye ba nye bar bkod da //
translated: The co-operating conditions mentioned by the word 'etc.' are set forth here in order to illustrate them.

original: pha nyid nye ba yin gyi mkhan po nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha nyid nye ba yin gyi mkhan po nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The father is the proximate cause, not the teacher.

original: de ni goms pa las nye ba nges pa yin yang pa'i 'og tu 'dir nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni goms pa las nye ba nges pa yin yang pa'i 'og tu 'dir nges pa yin no //
translated: Although the father is ascertained as proximate through practice, here the teacher is ascertained.

original: goms pa la yang dpe 'di yin no //
analyzed: goms pa la yang dpe 'di yin no //
translated: This is an example of practice.

original: 'di ltar gcig nyid skyed par byed pa dang / 'don du 'jug par byed pa nyid du khyad par med kyang pha nyid ni yun ring du goms pa la mkhan po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig nyid skyed par byed pa dang / 'don du 'jug par byed pa nyid du khyad par med kyang pha nyid ni yun ring du goms pa la mkhan po ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, although there is no difference in the father's and the teacher's ability to produce and make recite, the father is proximate through long practice, not the teacher.

original: pha bu'i skyed par byed pa nyid du mngon sum ma yin pa de lta na yang 'dir ni dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: pha bu'i skyed par byed pa nyid du mngon sum ma yin pa de lta na yang 'dir ni dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: Even though the father is not directly perceived as the producer of the son, here it is merely an example.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa rnams yod kyang khyad par nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa rnams yod kyang khyad par nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If, although the cooperating causes exist, the determination of the difference does not exist,

original: dper na smig rgyu dag la bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu dag la bzhin no //
translated: then, like mirages,

original: des na ji ltar lhan cig byed pa rnams lhan cig byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar lhan cig byed pa rnams lhan cig byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can the cooperating causes be cooperating causes?

original: de ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The response is, “No, it is not so.”

original: nges pa de yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: nges pa de yang zhes smos so //
translated: The determination of that is also mentioned.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no cause of error, it occurs.

original: rgyu mtshan de yod tsam gyis ni 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de yod tsam gyis ni 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it does not occur merely by the existence of that reason.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o//
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o//
translated: Therefore is a conclusion.

original: des na de ltar gang phyir dngos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du khas blangs pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid du 'gyur ba spangs par brjod pa'i gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyi sgra dang tshad ma gzhan
analyzed: des na de ltar gang phyir dngos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du khas blangs pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid du 'gyur ba spangs par brjod pa'i gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyi sgra dang tshad ma gzhan
translated: Therefore, the passage beginning “Thus, all things” indicates that the object of the exclusion of other is accepted as one part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: 'jug pa ni 'di yan chad kyis bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'di yan chad kyis bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The application of the term “exclusion of other” and the other valid means of knowledge are established by this passage.

original: da ni gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa gang dag slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba dngos po las tha dad pa dngos med kyi mtshan nyid sgra'i don du gsungs par rtogs nas sun 'byin pa brjod pa de dag gi 'dod pa
analyzed: da ni gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa gang dag slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba dngos po las tha dad pa dngos med kyi mtshan nyid sgra'i don du gsungs par rtogs nas sun 'byin pa brjod pa de dag gi 'dod pa
translated: Now, Kumārila and others, having understood that the master Dignāga taught that the definition of nonentity, called “exclusion of other,” is the meaning of words, express objections.

original: bsal ba'i phyir de la @192a * //
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyir de la @192a * //
translated: In order to dispel their assertions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pas rang gi gzhung ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pas rang gi gzhung ston par byed do //
translated: the author of the commentary teaches his own position with the chapter beginning with “In that case . . . ”

original: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can de la yang gzhan la sogs par gyur pas na gzhan las log pa dang ldog par byed pas na gzhan las ldog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang de bzhin du nges pa rnam par rtog pa nyid gang yin pa de dag ni
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can de la yang gzhan la sogs par gyur pas na gzhan las log pa dang ldog par byed pas na gzhan las ldog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang de bzhin du nges pa rnam par rtog pa nyid gang yin pa de dag ni
translated: The object of the ascertaining consciousness is also called “the opposite of other” because it is the opposite of other, and it is called “the opposite of other” because it causes the opposite of other.

original: brda'i rjes su byed pa yin gyi don la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brda'i rjes su byed pa yin gyi don la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: These terms are used figuratively, but they are not based on the object.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gzhan las log pas na log pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan las log pas na log pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa yin la /
translated: The opposite of other is called the opposite because it is the realization of the nature of an entity.

original: 'di'i gzhan las log par byed pa'i ldog pa yang gzhan med pa nyid do //🔽des na de ltar sgra dang shes pa dag rang gi bdag nyid kho nas yul tha dad par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni zhes bya bas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i gzhan las log par byed pa'i ldog pa yang gzhan med pa nyid do // des na de ltar sgra dang shes pa dag rang gi bdag nyid kho nas yul tha dad par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni zhes bya bas brjod pa yin te /
translated: The opposite that causes the opposite of other is the nonexistence of other.🔽Therefore, the statement “in that case, the terms and consciousnesses are understood to have different objects by their own nature alone” is expressed by the word “only.”

original: de ltar sgra dang shes pa dag yul tha dad kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar sgra dang shes pa dag yul tha dad kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that although the terms and consciousnesses have different objects.

original: de lta bu de dag la yang ji ltar rtogs pa'i yul tha dad pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu de dag la yang ji ltar rtogs pa'i yul tha dad pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And in these cases, there is no connection with a different object of understanding.

original: gang zhig byed pa por gyur pas 'di log pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig byed pa por gyur pas 'di log pa'am /
translated: There is no one who, as an agent, would stop or🔽cause to stop the activity of the object of negation.

original: ldog par byed pa med par byed pa nyid du 'gyur bas ldog par 'gyur ba bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog par byed pa med par byed pa nyid du 'gyur bas ldog par 'gyur ba bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no such thing as “the cessation of that which has ceased.”

original: gang zhig 'ga' yang med ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig 'ga' yang med ce na /
translated: What is there that does not exist?

original: brjod pa 'di la re zhig sgra ni rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di la re zhig sgra ni rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: We reply: Sound is not a property of the object of understanding,

original: rnam par shes pa bzhin du rang nyid yul dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bzhin du rang nyid yul dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir du ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is not like consciousness, which is a property of its object, like smoke.

original: rtogs pas dmigs pa'i yul bstan par bya ba'i don du rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pas dmigs pa'i yul bstan par bya ba'i don du rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is applied to indicate the object that is the object of understanding.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa kho na'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa yang rang nyid dbang po la brten pa'am /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa kho na'o // rnam par rtog pa yang rang nyid dbang po la brten pa'am /
translated: And that is only conceptual.🔽And conceptual cognition does not occur in dependence on the sense faculties,

original: de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor does it occur in dependence on the consciousnesses that occur in dependence on the sense faculties.

original: dbang po byed pa dang bcas pa las bzlog par bya ba'i bdag nyid dam dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa la rtags kyi rjes su dpag pa de lta bu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po byed pa dang bcas pa las bzlog par bya ba'i bdag nyid dam dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa la rtags kyi rjes su dpag pa de lta bu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no such inference that has as its object a non-entity, the nature of which is the absence of the appearance of an entity that is the opposite of the functioning of the sense faculty.

original: tha snyad 'di tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin yang dngul la sogs pa'i tha snyad ltar mngon sum nyid gzhan du dmigs pas ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad 'di tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin yang dngul la sogs pa'i tha snyad ltar mngon sum nyid gzhan du dmigs pas ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Although this convention is related to the different [entities], it is not the case that it is reversed by the observation of something else, like the convention of silver and so forth.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tsam la gnas pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gcig nyid 'di ni log pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tsam la gnas pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gcig nyid 'di ni log pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of an object that abides in its own entity alone is just one, and this is reversed.

original: 'di'i ldog pa'o zhes 'brel pa can gyi dngos po gzhan @192b du sgro 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i ldog pa'o zhes 'brel pa can gyi dngos po gzhan @192b du sgro 'dogs pa'am /
translated: It is imputed by superimposing an entity that is related to it, such as “this is its reversal,”

original: rang gi bdag nyid la brten pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos sgro 'dogs pas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la brten pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos sgro 'dogs pas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: or by superimposing an unreal property that is based on itself.

original: 'di'i ldog pa zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa ni ldog pa'i mthar thug pa yin yang rten tha dad pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa med pa'i phyir des sgo 'dogs pa dngos po de'i mthar thug pa kho nar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i ldog pa zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa ni ldog pa'i mthar thug pa yin yang rten tha dad pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa med pa'i phyir des sgo 'dogs pa dngos po de'i mthar thug pa kho nar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The cognition called “the opposite” is the final opposite, but because the basis is not established as different and because there is no fault, it is the cognition that the superimposition is only the final object.

original: gang gis de ltar rtogs pa'i yul ma grub pa ni bag chags tsam la brten par 'gyur ba 'di ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar rtogs pa'i yul ma grub pa ni bag chags tsam la brten par 'gyur ba 'di ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The object that is not established as the object of such a cognition is based on mere latent propensities. This is not an intrinsically occurring cognition.

original: rtag pa dang rdzas gcig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang rdzas gcig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not like the conceptual thought that conceives of permanence, a single substance, and so on.

original: 'on kyang sa thams cad pa'i brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i yan lag nyid kyis don ston par byed pa rnams kyis thams cad de tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa thams cad pa'i brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i yan lag nyid kyis don ston par byed pa rnams kyis thams cad de tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: However, because the meaning is taught by those who are established as the conventions of all the levels, everything is just that.

original: mi shes pa'i phyir de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir na brda kho na'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i phyir de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir na brda kho na'o //
translated: It is a mere convention because it is established in that way, i.e., as a convention, due to the conformity of the activity, agent, etc.

original: des pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: des pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The convention is twofold:

original: yul so sor rnam par gnas pa'i yul gyi skad la brten pa de ni rtogs pa po rnams kyi thog ma med pa can yin te /
analyzed: yul so sor rnam par gnas pa'i yul gyi skad la brten pa de ni rtogs pa po rnams kyi thog ma med pa can yin te /
translated: the first is based on the language of a particular country and is beginningless for those who understand it,

original: tha snyad snga ma snga ma mthong nas phyi ma phyi ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad snga ma snga ma mthong nas phyi ma phyi ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they engage in the latter by seeing the former.

original: des ni yul gcig pa rnams nyid tha snyad byed pa yin no //🔽gzhung sdeb pa sgrub pa lhur len pa rnams bye brag tu sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po ni yul gyi skad kyi sgra la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni yul gcig pa rnams nyid tha snyad byed pa yin no // gzhung sdeb pa sgrub pa lhur len pa rnams bye brag tu sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po ni yul gyi skad kyi sgra la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: It is the convention of those who have the same country.

original: sa thams cad pa'i rtogs pa po la bstan par bsams nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa thams cad pa'i rtogs pa po la bstan par bsams nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is based on the sounds of the language of a particular country and is established by those who are intent on composing treatises, because they are intended for those who understand all languages.

original: de la nye bar mkho ba la ltos pa'i phyir yang bha bat la sogs pa'i sgra dag 'ga' zhig gis bye brag tu bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nye bar mkho ba la ltos pa'i phyir yang bha bat la sogs pa'i sgra dag 'ga' zhig gis bye brag tu bshad pa yin te /
translated: Because it depends on what is needed, some explain the words “bhāva” and so on as follows.

original: de bas na dngos po don dam pa rig kyang thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir de ltar btags pas chod pas dngos po la 'jug pa 'di dag gi tha snyad byed pa na nyes pa dang bcas pa brjod pa lta bur mngon te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po don dam pa rig kyang thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir de ltar btags pas chod pas dngos po la 'jug pa 'di dag gi tha snyad byed pa na nyes pa dang bcas pa brjod pa lta bur mngon te /
translated: Therefore, even though one knows the ultimate thing, because there is no other method, one is obstructed by such designations. When one engages with things, one seems to be speaking with faults.

original: dper na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos ldog pa'i yul can du gsung pa na sgra tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gis log pa las tha dad pa'i ldog pa'i yul can du rtogs pa la de ltar ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos ldog pa'i yul can du gsung pa na sgra tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gis log pa las tha dad pa'i ldog pa'i yul can du rtogs pa la de ltar ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when the master Dignāga speaks of a subject that is a negation, those who follow mere words understand it as a subject that is a negation that is different from a nonaffirming negation, but that is not so.

original: de bas na tha dad pa ni brda tsam la brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa ni brda tsam la brten pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore difference is based on mere conventional symbols.

original: dngos po'i yul can ni ma yin no //🔽gal te yang rang gi bdag nyid tsam la @193a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can ni ma yin no //🔽gal te yang rang gi bdag nyid tsam la @193a * //
translated: It is not based on a thing.🔽If one is satisfied with mere words, one will not understand the meaning.

original: rnam par gnas pas na dngos po la dngos po gzhan med pa de lta na yang ji ltar mi dmigs pa phyogs bum pa med pa yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po nyid ldog par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par gnas pas na dngos po la dngos po gzhan med pa de lta na yang ji ltar mi dmigs pa phyogs bum pa med pa yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po nyid ldog par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Since it is a state of rest, a thing does not have another thing. But just as non-apprehension is taught to be the absence of a pot in a certain place, so here also the negation of a thing is expressed,

original: yul nyid la ltos pa na dngos po nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yul nyid la ltos pa na dngos po nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the object itself is the object of negation.

original: / phan tshun du tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon yin zhes med pa tsam ni sa bon du mdun du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / phan tshun du tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon yin zhes med pa tsam ni sa bon du mdun du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The seed of this mutual difference is mere non-existence, which will be explained later.

original: 'grel pa ni de la yang zhes mdo rjes su brjod do /
analyzed: 'grel pa ni de la yang zhes mdo rjes su brjod do /
translated: The commentary repeats the sutra with “that” .

original: gzhan sel pa zhes yul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sel pa zhes yul bstan pa yin no //
translated: “ Exclusion of other” indicates the object.

original: ldog par byed cing sel bar byed pa'i rnam pa ldog pa gzhan la log pa yang gzhan pa yang med do //
analyzed: ldog par byed cing sel bar byed pa'i rnam pa ldog pa gzhan la log pa yang gzhan pa yang med do //
translated: The form of negation and exclusion is the negation of the other, but the other is not negated.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'di gnyi ga la gzhan nyid du brjod pa'i phyir na skabs kyi gzhan nyid phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'di gnyi ga la gzhan nyid du brjod pa'i phyir na skabs kyi gzhan nyid phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it does not depend on anything else, and since both are called “other” in this context, otherness is mutual dependence.

original: ldog pa ni log pa las gzhan ma yin la log pa yang ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldog pa ni log pa las gzhan ma yin la log pa yang ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The reversal is not different from the non-reversal, and the non-reversal is not different from the reversal.

original: ji ltar gzhan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ma yin no zhe na /
translated: How are they not different?

original: rigs pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the reasoning is:

original: de las ldog pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las ldog pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “from the reversal of that.”

original: ldog mtshams nyid du ltos pa'i don gzhan ni de zhes bya bar 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog mtshams nyid du ltos pa'i don gzhan ni de zhes bya bar 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The other meaning of “in dependence on” is connected with “that.”

original: rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa las ldog pa bzlog par 'gyur ba rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa las ldog pa bzlog par 'gyur ba rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the reversal of that which is dissimilar would be the reversal of the reversal, and it would be a dissimilar entity.

original: ba lang la ni rta med la rta la yang ba lang med pas na rta ba lang las ldog pa /
analyzed: ba lang la ni rta med la rta la yang ba lang med pas na rta ba lang las ldog pa /
translated: Since the cow does not exist in the horse and the horse does not exist in the cow, the horse is the reversal of the cow.

original: ba lang yang rta las log par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ba lang yang rta las log par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The cow is also the reversal of the horse.
